Together with his wife he sells the vegetables on the markets of the Sunikskiy region, and the meat, milk and remaining unsold vegetables are bought by his regular customers straight from his home. Thanks to his farming business Kamo has the ability to provide for his family with all necessities and pay for his son's education.

Kamo needs a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 dram to buy eight calves and fodder for the winter. This is the second loan for Kamo which has been provided by the field partner Nor Orizon and he has paid it off without delinquencies.

loans.use: to buy eight calves and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 49 years old and supports a family of five people. She is married and blessed with five children ages 25,23,18,16, and 13 years. Mary owns a tailoring shop in Kapsabet town and has been in operation for a period of six years, earning a monthly income of 8,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

She has applied for a loan of 40,000 KES from KADET LTD, this being her fourth loan after she successfully repaid the previous loans. She wishes to use this amount to purchase stock for her business.  

The profits will be used to educate her children and improve the living standards of the family as a whole. Her dream is to own a tailoring school and also prosper in business.

loans.use: To purchase stock for the business.

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma, 57 years old, is married and lives with her family: her husband and five children, all involved in different types of work. Her sons are barbers by profession while her daughters are involved in sewing. They all contribute to the family financially from their earnings. Salma’s days are focused on managing the household chores. She is a very caring lady and takes good care of her family.

Salma's husband has been involved in a shoemaking business for over 20 years. He makes traditional shoes called khussa in the Urdu language. Khussa is a very famous product and people love wearing them. He makes simple and embroidered khussas for his customers on demand. Salma's husband will use this loan to purchase embroidery material and leather in larger quantities to be able to make many more khussas to sell. Salma is hopeful that his business will bring in a good revenue after the loan investment.

Note: In the photo, Salma is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy embroidery material and leather

loans.name: Zita

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, é casada vive na casa própria com sua familia, e mae de 4 filhos todos vao a escola. Responsabiliza se pela sua sobrinha que vive com ela.
 É  proprietaria de um estabelecimento  comercial  localizado na sua residência, vende produtos de primeira necessidade e bebidas alcoolicas. Tem um rendimento mensal de 4.000.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da sua casa, este é seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku  no valor de 10.000.00m com o qual pretende aumentar o volume da sua mercadoria nomeadamnete( bolachas, acucar , arroz e bebidas alcoolicas) o anterior de 6.000.00mt foi usado também para o comércio.
Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo para aceder a outros emprestimos. Pretende futuramente construir uma esplanada dando assim mais conforto aos seus clientes
texts.en:
Zita was born in the district of Namaacha. She is married and lives in her own home with her family. She has four children, who are all in school. She also supports her niece, who lives with her.
She runs a business out of her home selling staple goods and alcohol. She earns 4,000 meticals a month, which she uses to cover household expenses. This is her second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which she will invest in expanding the amount of merchandise she carries (crackers, sugar, rice, and alcohol). Her previous loan for 6,000 meticals was also used for the business.
She is confident that she will pay off this loan early and request additional loans. In the future, she plans to build a walkway so her customers will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (crackers, sugar, rice, and alcohol) for her shop.

loans.name: Sabina Del Carmen

texts.es: Sabina, solicita otro préstamo con la intención de mejorar mas su negocio de frutas y verduras y debido a la época navideña sus clientes quieren variedad por eso comprara frutas como: melón, sandia, guineos, papaya, solo de esa forma podrá mejorar en sus ganancias.El prestamo anterior le ayudo mucho porque cada día aumento en los ingresos, siendo mejor para ella, ya que tuvo una buena experiencia.
texts.en: Sabina is seeking another loan so she can make her fruit and vegetable business even better. With the Christmas season approaching, her customers will want a wider variety so she is planning to buy melons, watermelons, bananas, and papaya. By buying more produce she will earn more money. The previous loan helped her greatly and her income increased each day. The whole experience was very positive for her.

loans.use: to buy melons, watermelons, bananas, and papaya

loans.name: Kay

texts.en:
Kay is 54 years old. She is married and blessed with a son in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been making creels (wicker baskets) to sell for more than four years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband and her son are construction workers who earn about $8 each day. 

Kay is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase timber to build a new house. This purchase will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run a groceries store at home to generate additional income to financially support her family.

loans.use: buy timber to build a new house

loans.name: Sèbèsso Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Sèbèsso sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques avec en moyenne 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Dona dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de bois de chauffe et du charbon de bois. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Kadia (femme debout en boubou jaune tâché sur la photo) est connue dans le village et ses environs pour la vente du bois de chauffe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 30  chargements de charrettes de bois de chauffe. Elle se ravitaille en bois avec les exploitants forestiers du village et de ses environnants. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile et au bord du goudron dans le village à une clientèle mixte. Madame Kadia espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins du foyer en condiments. 
Tout comme les autres femmes du groupe, Madame Kadia dans le souci de diversifier les activités ambitionne de faire l’élevage de petits ruminants avec l’épargne constituée.

loans.use: Pour  acheter du bois de chauffe

loans.name: Flor Geraldine

texts.es:
Flor es una joven de 19 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su pequeño hijo de 2 años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, Flor puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella cuenta con un pequeño espacio en su vivienda, así también sale a recorrer las calles de su ciudad para realizar sus ventas, Flor puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas diarias y cree que le va bien el empeño que le pone a su trabajo.
Flor se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como prendas de vestir y zapatos para damas, caballeros y niños; de esta manera Flor tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder ampliar su negocio y así ella desea lograr su gran sueño de ver a su pequeño convertido en un hombre de bien y en un buen profesional.

loans.use: Para la compra de mercadería, tales como prendas de vestir y zapatos.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a married woman, 47 years old with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Raquel has a weaving business in the Philippines. Raquel requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like abacca, silk and other materials for her business.

Raquel has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like abacca, silk and other materials for her business

loans.name: Steve

texts.en:
This description was written by Moses Onyango, a staff member for Kiva and Village Enterprise Fund in Uganda

He got a grant of 100$ US from Village Enterprise Fund (VEF). He started with selling of Oranges and Guavas.

After attending training on business skills twice, he got wider knowledge on how to choose and run his business effectively. He then shifted to Butchery including buying and slaughtering of cattle and selling meat in his butchery. His business picked up very much and he got enough profit and opened up many other Butchers.

Now, Steve O. buys animals from the rural markets where the poor farmers bring their animals for sale so as to meet other requirements in their families.

In the rural markets he buys this animals quiet cheaply depending on the size of the animal like it ranges from 180,000/= up to 280,000/= as a basic price.

The local Government has provided some especially designed slaughter areas and itâ€™s where almost all animals are slaughtered and then transported to different butcheries and this areas are made of cement and poles to ensure that the meat is clean.

His butchery has been build with bricks and has a log for cutting meet inside, where to hang the meat and a table where cut meat is placed with a weighing scale hanging at the window opening. Â

loans.use: Buying animals for slaughter

loans.name: Harefa

texts.en:
Harefa is 33 years old and lives with her 3 children in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

She has passed her 1st loan cycle and is continuing with a 2nd loan cycle. Before she had a problem with income for her family and fees for her children's school, but then she decided to take a loan to increase her business and get a good income for her family.

She has a stove in her yard to bake bread in. By taking a loan she can buy wood, flour and any other things she needs so that her business can grow.

loans.use: To buy wood and flour

loans.name: Gladis

texts.en:
Gladis E. says she is in the right business for raising her six growing children, ages 7, 11, 12, 13, 15 and 16. She runs her own bakery, which allows her to directly provide for much of the food for her household as well as a steady source of income to take care of immediate needs. Gladis requests this loan to purchase a bread-maker and additional ingredients such as flour and oil so that she can create enough bread to be a main distributor in her rural town outside the capital of San Pedro de Macoris. The profits she makes are invested in her business and go to savings for her children's education, which she says is one of her primary dreams for her children.

NOTE: This $1,000 will fund Gladis' business plus 4 others in her community. She and four additional entrepreneurs have formed a solidarity group that received business training from Esperanza and will be responsible for paying back this loan together as they develop their respective businesses. This group-lending methodology fosters accountability among the members because they all must pay in full and on time.

loans.use: Purchase additional bread-making machine, baking ingredients and coffee

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela is married and she has three children. She is originally from San luis Potosí, but she has been living in Reynosa for the past 7 years; the same time that Maria has been working at a stationer’s shop. Due to health reason the current owner cannot longer run the business, and he has offered to sell her the business. She knows that that with her experience and a lot of effort she will be able to make it. In order to cover the transaction expenses Graciela is asking for a loan of $925, that she will repay over a period of 6 months. Don’t hesitate, you can help improve the quality of life of this family, Graciela only wants the best future for her family. They are very grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Graciela es casada y tiene tres hijos, ella es originaria de San Luis Potosí, tiene 7 años viviendo en Reynosa, Tamaulipas, ese mismo tiempo que tiene de trabajar en una papelería y ahora, por problemas de salud el dueño actual no puede seguir al frente del negocio y le ha propuesto a Graciela el traspaso de la papelería. Ella sabe que con la experiencia que tiene en el negocio y el esfuerzo que esta dispuesta a realizar podrá salir adelante. Para poder cubrir el costo del traspaso Graciela solicita un crédito de $925 dólares, mismos que devolverá en un lapso de 6 meses. Tú puedes mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, Graciela sólo desea un futuro mejor para ella y su familia, no lo pienses más, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Buy business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a hair dryer and blow dryer

loans.name: Vay

texts.en: Mrs. Vay S., age 26, works in a garment factory, earning around $3 per day. Her husband works as a farmer, growing crops and raising pigs. They have one child in school. In order to expand the stock of pigs that they raise and sell, she would like to borrow $300 to purchase feed for their pigs. The increased stock of pigs will raise their revenue and allow them to further invest in the growth of their business.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Olga Maria

texts.es:
Olga Maria is constantly moving around the central market of Leon selling her products. She also participates in the fairs where handmade clothing is always in demand. She has had this business for 8 years, starting with an investment of just $100 thanks to her mother, who had the business originally and had Olga Maria working by her side. She began to create her handmade pieces back when she was in 6th grade, learning from her mother and selling her own pieces in order to help the family's financial situation. She used the money from her mother to buy merchandise and sold her pieces from the time she was young. Her mother worked as a seamstress from their house, creating all kinds of clothing and uniforms.

Later, her mother helped her set up a shop and turned the business over to Olga, who has done well with it, always participating in the social gatherings and national fairs to display her products. Olga is married and she and her husband support their children. She has had 7 loans which have helped her improve their quality of life. The loans are very helpful as they enable her to invest in the business and offer more variety to her customers.

La Sra. Martinez tiene productos a la venta que estan en constante movimiento dentro y fuera del mercado CENTRAL de León, ademas que ella siempre participa en ferias porque la ropa y las artes manuales son bien demandados, además ella tiene arte para elaborar todo tipo de prendas.

Tiene 8 años de tener el negocio y comenzó invirtiendo $ 100 gracias al aporte de su madre, porque inicialmente el negocio era de su mamá y ella trabajaba a su lado. Comenzó a elaborar sus artes manuales desde que estudiaba en 6to grado de primaria, agarraba dle negocio de su mamá y vendia por aparte para ayudarle economicamente a la familia, tambien del dinero que su mamá le daba compraba mercaderia y las vendia ambulante desde que era una niña. Luego trabajó con su mamá porque el negocio estaba en su casa (era costurera), elaboraban todo tipo de prensas de vestir, sobre todo los uniformes

Mas tarde su mama le ayudo a poner una tienda y le fué dejando en sus manos el negocio, así ha sobresalido, siempre ha participado en las tertulias del parque y ferias nacionales para exponer sus produtos.

Doña Olga actualmente es casada y con el esposo ayuda a sacar adelante a sus hijos. Ha trabajado con 7 créditos y esto le ha ayudado ya que de su crédito saca para la venta y de su ganancia para mejorar su condicion de vida. Ha sido muy util sobre todo porque el crédito es rápido y eso ayuda a invertir siempre en su negocio para tener mas variedad que ofrecer.

loans.use: TO BUY MATERIAL FOR HER HANDMADE CLOTHING, EXPANDING THE VARIETY SHE CAN OFFER HER CLIENTS.

loans.name: Rohana

texts.en: Rohana is 46-year-old widow. Her husband passed away a long time ago, leaving her to work hard by herself to cover the family's daily needs.  She sells snacks, drinks, candies, and household goods, and usually earns US$ 10 per day. Rohana is requesting a loan to expand her business, so she can pay tuition for her children's schooling. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her  little general store

loans.name: Flor Violeta

texts.es:
Mrs. Flor Violeta is 23 years old. She studied until second grade. She has two children who still economically depend on her. She lives in the Mache district, Otuzco province, La Libertad state.

She owns a business for purchasing and selling cows, guinea pigs, chickens and fresh cheese. She sells cereals, such as wheat and and barley, at the harvesting season. She also makes and sells roof tiles during the summer.

Flor Violeta is getting started on the sale of small animals like guinea pigs, chicken, pigs, turkeys and ducks in Julcán, where she was able to get many clients. She is well known and people request various orders from her.

She got her first loan at the “Women at Work” communal bank. She used her S/. 300.00 loan to purchase some rams. With her new S/. 1,600.00, which she promises to repay in four months, she will purchase two veal, rams and other small animals. Mrs. Flor is also partner in one of the most popular eateries from her neighborhood “Maria Victoria”. Her biggest dream is to own a car so she can home deliver the roof tiles that she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Flor Violeta tiene 23 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo año de secundaria, tiene 2 hijos que aún dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Mache, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad. Tiene un negocio de compra y venta de reses, gallinas y cuyes, asimismo compra y vende cuajada (quesillo). En tiempo de cosecha vende cereales como trigo y cebada y también en temporada de verano elabora y vende tejas para el techo de algunas casas. Se inicia en el comercio vendiendo animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, cerdos, pavos y patos en Julcán, lugar donde pudo captar varios clientes, es por eso que es conocida y le hacen pedidos. En el banco comunal “Mujeres de Trabajo” obtuvo un primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 y con este dinero compró algunos carneros. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,600.00, el cual pagará en 4 cuotas, comprará 2 terneras, carneros y otros animales menores . La señora Flor también es socia del comedor popular de su sector, “Maria Victoria”. Su mayor sueño es contar con un vehículo para transportar las tejas que elabora para distintos domicilios.

loans.use: Purcahse animals (cattle, veal, etc)

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina is 23 years old and has one child. Her husband works in a free zone in a factory. The income that her husband earns is low in comparison to their family’s expenses. In light of this, this young woman searched for an alternative form of employment through which she could generate extra income. As a result, she became affiliated with AVON through which she buys products with her own money at distributor prices and then sells them at work, friend and family gatherings. She acquires AVON products in two ways: either with cash or partly on credit or by consignment. She has to move expeditiously to pay back the company so she may achieve turnover. This young woman requires a loan so that she may purchase personal use products that her customers are requesting. It is in this way that this family has moved ahead: through the efforts of the couple and their need to search for a better life for themselves and their small child.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Guillermina tiene 23 años, tiene un hijo, su esposo trabaja en una zona franca de operario de maquila, los ingresos que percibe su esposo son bajos en comparación con los gastos de la familia, viéndose en esa decisión la joven busca una alternativa de empleo en donde le genere ingresos extras y es por eso que se afilia a AVON, en donde por cuenta propia compra los productos a precios de distribuidor y los ofrece a centros de trabajo, amistades y familiares. Ella adquiere los productos en AVON de dos maneras ya sea al contado y una parte al crédito o por consignación. Ella tiene que moverse a colocar los productos y cuanto antes pagar a la empresa que le facilita para que vuelva a sacar nuevamente. La joven requiere de un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal que le están solicitando sus clientas. Es de esta manera como esta familia ha logrado salir adelante, con el esfuerzo de los esposos y las ganas de buscar mejor vida para ellos y su pequeño hijo.

loans.use: Purchase perfume and cosmetics.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en: Elijah A. is married and has 8 children.  Elijah is a distiller and mechanic.  He buys sugar cane, processes it through the machine, then distills it.  Elijah is a very hard worker and also has several employees.  He is requesting a loan of $525 to buy sugar cane in bulk from the farmers so he can get a reduced rate.  Elijah was also kind enough to let us have a free sample of his fine product! Elijah is the treasurer of a lending group called “Nyame Ye Kase Traders”, which consists of 14 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy sugar cane in bulk from the farmers so he can get a reduced rate.

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa is 50 years old and is married with four children. Since 2000, Basilisa has sold cereals seller and been a pastoralist. Every day, she works from 10am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Basilisa now hopes for a loan to buy more cereals for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cereasls for her business

loans.name: Mahmadrahim

texts.ru:
G. Mahmadrahim lives in the Abdurahmoni Jomi region of Tajikistan. He is 38, is married and has 5 children. G. and his family work in agriculture. They work together harmoniously. He has a plot of land in which he sows wheat, potatoes and other vegetables. He needs a loan to stock up fertilizers for the spring planting season. He plans to repay his loan within 6 months. At harvest time, G. will sell his wheat, potatoes and other vegetables in various markets in and around Dushanbe.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Гафуров Махмадрахим житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 38 , женат и имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается сельским хозяйством. Имеет участок земли , который засеивает пшеницей , картофелем и другими овощами. Планирует получить кредит , для того , чтобы закупить удобрения. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 6 месяцев.У него большая семья и все они дружно работают на земле и помогают друг другу.Полученный урожай клиент будет реализовывать на базарах города Душанбе

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Irma Campoverde

texts.en:
Irma belongs to the Medalla Milagrosa Village Bank and lives in Pamplona Alta in San Juan D. Miraflores.

She is married and has 5 children and 2 grandchildren. She sells clothes which she gives to her friends at home. She also learned to make pullovers, a business that helped her to educate her children and have another income for the household. One of her daughter's is abroad at the moment and helps her with the business. 

Irma is soliciting a 3000 soles loan so as to purchase more merchandise, pullovers and vests to take advantage of the season. 

Now her children are grown-ups, they help her but Irma still has dreams and aims to achieve, such as setting up a business in her own house. She would like to have a bookstore and proviD. a photocopying service.

loans.use: Irma is soliciting a 3000 soles loan so as to purchase more merchandise, pullovers and vests to take advantage of the season.

loans.name: Sira

texts.fr:
Sira Diate is a small business woman who sells donuts and mangoes. She is a mother and the revenue from this business helps her husband support the basic needs of their family. Mrs D. lives in the popular district of Belfort in the center of Ziguinchor.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

Sira D. est une dame qui fait du petit commerce. Elle vend des beignets et des mangues. Avec cette activité génératrice de revenus, cette mére de famille aide son époux à subvenir aux besoins de base de la famille; elle habite le populaire quartier de Belfort au centre de Ziguinchor.

loans.use: Small Business

loans.name: Liliane

texts.fr: Dame S. Liliane est née le 14 mai 1978 à Ekpè dans le département de l'Ouémé au sud-est du Bénin. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants: Corneille et Fabienne âgés respectivement de 5 ans et de 2ans. Elle fournit divers produits de ménage à ses voisins de quartiers avec qui elle a un contrat de confiance parce que ses produits sont de bonne qualité. Elle demande ce prêt pour renforcer son activité qui est en pleine croissance.
texts.en:
Mrs. Liliane S. was born on May 14, 1978 in Ekpè in Ouémé County in the southeast of Benin. She is married and the mother of 2 children: Corneille and Fabienne, aged 5 and 2 respectively. She furnishes various household items to her neighbors in the district who have confidence in her because her products are of good quality. She is requesting this loan to bolster her business which is currently growing rapidly.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 10 cases of tinned goods

loans.name: Mr. Nop Heng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank which consists of thirteen members, is located in Ba Khong Khang Lech Village within Takeo Village. Mr. Nop H. is the village bank president, having been selected by the membership. He is 42-years-old and the father of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the remaining two attend school.

Mr. Nop H. is a Prohok seller in the local market. Prohok is made by using small fish as an ingredient for soup. Roast Beef with Prohok is an exceptionally delicious menu in Cambodia. His business is going well, but Mr. Nop H. wants to expand so he has decided to ask for a loan to purchase more Prohok to increase his sales. His wife, Mrs. Sok TH., helps him in the current business.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Seven members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To purchase more Prohok to increase sales

loans.name: Nen

texts.en: Mrs. Nen Y., 39, is a widow selling fish such as dried fish, smoked fish and fish-paste in the Kompong Tom Market. She is doing well by purchasing fish from a supplier to sell retail in the market. Nen has five children, four of whom are students while her eldest daughter Mrs. Sreymom Chi, 19, is married and helps her business. Nen requests a loan of US$400 to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for easier transportation and will use the rest of the loan to expand the business. They all live in Compongkrobav Commune, Kompong Tom Province. (Nen is so busy, so we just took a picture of her daughter and her son-in-law.)

loans.use: Nen would like to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to improve her fish-selling business.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.es:
La señora Madeleine pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuevo Edén ubicado en el Jr. Callería Nº 751, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijas, menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como comerciante. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de abarrotes.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en casa y tiene el apoyo de sus hijas y de su esposo. Se dedica a su negocio y al cuidado de su hogar. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará un saco de arroz, un saco de azúcar, dos cajas de leche, etc.

Madeleine manifiesta que todo lo que ha logrado es producto de su habilidad y esfuerzo. Agradece al banco comunal por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Madeleine belongs to the Community Bank 'Nuevo Eden', located in the Jr Calleria No 751, in the district of Yarinacocha, in the province of Coronel Portillo, in the department of Ucayali. She is 40 years old and has 2 kids who are young and depend on her. She is married and her husband is a salesman. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, she decided to invest in groceries.

She currently has a store in her house and her daughters and husband support her. She dedicates herself to her business and looking after her home.

With this loan of 1000 soles, which she will repay over a period of 4 months, she will buy a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, 2 cartons of milk etc.

Madeleine states that everything she has achieved is a product of her skill and effort. She thanks the community bank for the support they have offered her.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, 2 cartons of milk etc/Comprará un saco de arroz, un saco de azúcar, dos cajas de leche, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy "pagnes" and pans

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: Humberto tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su conviviente y sus dos hijos, quienes lo motivan día a día a seguir trabajando duro. El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público desde hace 8 años atrás, Humberto trabaja durante todo el día, a razón de sacar adelante a sus hijos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares y trata con personas que le enseñan técnicas y estrategias de trabajo. Además le es rentable, ya que él mismo maneja su motocarro. Las dificultades se presentan cuando su vehículo sufre desperfectos. Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP, siendo una persona responsable en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar a reparar su herramienta de trabajo y comprar algunos repuestos para trabajar tranquilo y sin preocupaciones.
texts.en:
Humberto is 40 years old and lives with his wife and their two children, who motivate him day after day to continue working hard. He is dedicated to offering public transportation service and has been since eight years ago. Humberto works all day, for the sake of his children. The thing he likes about his work is that he knows a lot of places and he works with people who teach him techniques and strategies for his job. Furthermore, it is profitable for him since he is the one who drives his motocart. He has difficulties when his vehicle gets damaged. This is his sixth loan with MFP and he is a responsible person in his payments. With the money requested, he wants to send his vehicle for repairs and buy some spare parts so he can work peacefully and without worries.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his motocart.

loans.name: Lelane

texts.en: Mrs. Lelane B., 41 years old, married and lives at San Vicente, Dapitan City. She has 5 children and 2 of them are in school. Her husband is a mere laborer. In order to help her husband,she decided to sell basic commodities in front of their house displayed in a table. This thing was materialized because of Paglaum Cooperative who have helped her in terms of financial assistance. She joined the cooperative last April 2008. She is happy enough knowing that aside from availing loan, she was able to save part of her income. Now, she applies PhP7,000 to buy goods or commodities for her sari-sari store. Hopefully this year, she will be able to build a store, so she can comfortably display her merchandise. She also wanted to see her children finish their studies and obtain successful careers in the future.

loans.use: to buy basic commodities for her sari-sari store

location.town: Dipolog-San Vicente, Dapitan City,Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and use a mill

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo F. S. se dedica a vender ropa usada desde hace cuatro años en su misma casa, la mercancía la pone en el portal para que tenga mejor vista ya que su casa esta en muy buena ubicación.
El señor Bernardo  necesita surtir su mercancía para tener más variedad en tallas, colores de ropa y así tener más fuentes de ingresos.
Su esposa le gusta el oficio de vendedora lo cual en todo momento es un apoyo para en el negocio.
texts.en:
Bernardo F. S. has been selling second-hand clothing from his home for four years. He displays his merchandise at his doorway so that it is more visible as his home is in a very good location. Bernardo needs to stock his business so that he has a greater variety of sizes and colours of clothing and so have greater profits. His wife enjoys selling and is always very helpful in the business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina E. cooks rice and sells it along with perfume and oil in Idan, near Cape Coast. She has done so since 2006. She is married with two children and has received her junior high school degree. Her husband works as a trader.

She is responsible for paying her children’s school fees and house utilities. Augustina's loan will be used to buy provisions for resale and the food she prepares for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy land.

loans.use: Buy provisions for resale and food she prepares for sale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is married with 3 children. She has received an education through junior high school. While Agnes works as a trader, her husband is employed as an auto mechanic.

For 6 years, Agnes has sold minerals such as Coca Cola and Malt in Siwdo. She uses her income to help pay for the family’s expenses. She plans to use this loan to purchase additional drinks for resale. Agnes plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business in order to promote her continued success.

loans.use: To purchase additional drinks for resale

loans.name: Nidia Aracely

texts.es: Nidia Aracely H. M. vive en Ciudad Arce departamento La Libertad. A sus 28 años Nidia es una mujer casada y madre de tres niños, Jonathan de 6 años, Nelson de 4 años y la pequeña Dianita de 1 año. Esta pareja de esposos se dedican a su negocio que es una panadería donde elaboran pan dulce y pan francés, tienen 7 años de experiencia en el negocio; Nidia solicita un crédito para comprar materia prima para su panadería, como harinas y levadura; Nidia ya ha obtenido otros créditos anteriormente y ha sido muy responsable en todos sus pagos de cuotas.
texts.en:
Nidia Aracely H. M. lives in Arce city, La Libertad state. At 28 years old, Nidia is a married woman and mother of three children: Jonathan of age 6, Nelson of age 4, and Dianita of age 1. This couple works at a bread shop where they make sweet bread and french bread. They have 7 years of experience in this field. Nidia would like a loan to purchase basic ingredients for her bread shop, such as flour and yeast. Nidia has received loans in the past and she has been very responsible with all of her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic ingredients for bread making

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow cassava

loans.name: Phạm Thị

texts.en:
L. Phạm Thị (1312020271) is a 48-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has six school-aged children.

L. owns and operates a business primarily providing a rice-processing service to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

In 2002, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service.

L. is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 7th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es: la sra Maria Emilia M. ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una  pequeña pulperia en la cual vende pocas cosas ya que no tiene el capital suficiente para poderla surtir como se debe, ademas tiene un año y medio de haber iniciado con su negocio, tambien vende recargas para llamadas de celular, es casada y madre de 2 hijos que todavia dependen del matrimonio, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.- con los ingresos que el negocio le genera, ella cubre sus gastos personales y tambien le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Emilia M. sells popular household products from her small grocery store. She is only able to sell a few items because she does not have sufficient capital to keep her store as well stocked as she would like. A year and a half after she started her business, she also began selling rechargeable mobile phone cards.

Maria Emilia is married and the mother of 2 dependent children. Her husband is a farmer. With the earnings generated from her business, she is able to cover her personal expenses as well as assist her husband with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soap, beans, bread, rice, sugar, coffee, cookies, chips, soup, and toilet paper

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana es socia del Banco Comunal Rubi.
Roxana es soltera, tiene 21 años y 1 hija, estudia informática, Roxana tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en donde vende carne de cerdo, el cual es adquirido en la ciudad de Lima, además reparte por mayor a los comerciantes de carne.
Roxana necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carne de cerdo.
Los sueños de Roxana son que su hija sea profesional y que nunca le falte nada.
texts.en:
Roxana is a member of the Rubi (Ruby) communal bank group.

She is 21 years old, single and has one daughter. In addition, Roxana is studying computer science. She has a vending stall in the Nery García market where she sells pork that she acquires in the city of Lima, primarily from wholesale meat distributors.

Roxana needs a loan of 1050 soles to buy more pork. She dreams that her daughter will pursue a professional career and that her family never lacks anything.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more pork

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more equipment

loans.name: Rosa Alina

texts.es: La señora Rosa Alina Hernández, tiene la edad de 44 años, habita en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, junto  a su esposo el cual trabaja y le apoya con las actividades del hogar, ellos tiene tres hijos, una de ella independiente y dos actualmente estudiantes, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, doña Rosa desde hace 25 años se dedica a las confecciones, con sus propios esfuerzos y el apoyo de Afodenic, ella a logrado mejorar gran parte de su vivienda. Con este préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción como: arena, cemento, piso para que le pongan el piso y poder gozar de la comodidad junto a  su familia. es sus sexto crédito y ha invertido con los anteriores prestamos en las mejoras para su vivienda para logar una casa digna.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para poner el piso

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana B. is from the village of Mamanga Gamay. She is 54 years old, married, and has four adult children. Ana owns and operates a general store in which she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Ana has been engaged in her business for over two years.

In 2008, Ana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services so she can improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ana has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Ana is requesting a new loan of $225 which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Ana from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and provide working capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Urubamba.
Maria es soltera, tiene 47 años y 1 hijo, Maria tiene una vidrieria en un local alquilado ubicado en el centro D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho, para lo cual cuenta con 4 personas que le apoyan.
Maria necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. vidrios.
Los sueños D. Maria son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener sucursales.

loans.use: Para la compra de vidrios.

loans.name: Olga Marleni

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Bancomunal  Mar del Plata, es conviviente, tiene 32 años, un hijo de 11 años que está estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Olga  vive en casa de sus padres con su familia, por la situación económica que pasaba tuvo que Salir a trabajar y empezó con las ventas de ropa interior desde hace seis años, ella vende ofreciendo por su barrio, su esposo trabaja como taxista. 
En Finca ella aprendió como llegar a ser emprendedoras exitosas, recibe capacitación como mejorar sus ventas y como actuar frente a la competencia.
Olga necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de perfumes y cosméticos.
Ah  Olga le gustaría tener una tienda de  bazar regalos en un lugar céntrico.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the Communal Bank “Mar del Plata” (Sea of Silver). She is 32 years old, in a common law marriage, and has an 11 year old son who attends a state school.

Olga lives in the house of her parents with her family. Due to her economic situation, she was forced to find work. She has been selling undergarments for the past six years and offers her products throughout the neighborhood. Her husband works as a taxi driver.

As a FINCA client, Olga learned how to become a successful entrepreneur. She received training on how to improve her sales and react to the competition. She needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy perfumes and cosmetics. Someday she hopes to open a gift shop in a central location.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfumes & cosmetics

loans.name: Eveling Del Carmen

texts.es: Eveling del Carmen  tiene 52 años, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 8 años que inicio con esta actividad, Ella siempre ha sido una mujer luchadora y emprendedora. Por lo que tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000 y con la ayuda de los financiamientos es que ha logrado salir adelante. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento con el fin de invertir en nuevos productos que sus clientes más jóvenes solicitan. Su deseo es mejorar los ingresos para su familia y proporcionarle condiciones necesarias.
texts.en:
Eveling del Carmen is a 52-year-old woman who sells cosmetics for a living. She has been in business for over 8 years. She has always been a hard-working and enterprising woman. She has been working with Fundación León 2000 for a long time and has been able to get ahead with the help of microloans. She is currently requesting this loan in order to invest it in purchasing the new products that her younger customers are asking for. Her dream is to improve her income for the sake of her family, thus allowing her to provide them with the necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Zoumana

texts.fr:
Monsieur Zoumana C. est un homme marié de trente huit ans ayant sept enfants  qui vit dans un foyer traditionnel à Dangassa (située à 70  kilomètres de Bamako) deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Zoumana excelle dans le commerce d’articles divers tels, les céréales, les produits de cueillettes, d’artisanats, les tissus etc. 
Pour faire prospérer son commerce il intégra le programme  crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt individuel, le premier a été bien remboursé sans aucune difficulté.
Il s’approvisionne en articles divers une fois par mois à Bamako et en céréales deux fois par mois au marché de Dangassa où se trouve son magasin de vente.
Il compte avoir avec ce prêt, 800  kilogrammes d’arachide, 300  kilogrammes de haricot et divers articles.
Il espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen trimestriel de 275. 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour payer l’échéance du prêt subvenir aux charges familiales et investir  le reste dans son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Zoumana C. is a thirty year old married man with seven children, he lives in a traditional home in Dangassa (located 70 kilometers from Bamako), in the second administrative region in the Republic of Mali. Zoumana excels in selling various items, such as cereals, gathered fruits, artisinal crafts, fabrics etc. So that his business will prosper, he joined Soro Yiriwaso's loan program, with which he is on his second individual loan, the first of which was fully repaid without difficulty. He supplies himself with various items once a month from Bamako and supplies himself with cereals twice a month from the market in Dangassa, where his store is located. With this loan he will buy 800 kilograms of peanuts, 300 kilograms of beans and a variety of items. With this loan he hopes to earn an average quarterly income of 275,000 FCFA, which he will use to repay his loan, to provide for the needs of his family and he will reinvest the rest in his business.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of items

loans.name: Jackie

texts.fr: A. Jackie est née le 06 Août 1977 à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique au Bénin. Jackie vit à Dogoudo à Allada depuis près de 33 ans. Jackie est mariée à ALAVO Mesmin, un enseignant, et est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Jackie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Jackie n’a pas été à l’école. Il ya 23 ans de cela que Jackie vend des sucettes glacées (faites à base de bissap et sucre, dans un sachet) et des glacières par le système de distribution. C’est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, que Jackie s’approvisionne. Jackie est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de l’institution, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Jackie voudrait augmenter son fonds de roulement et agrandir son activité, en la diversifiant par l'achat et la vente de charbon de bois. C’est pourquoi, Jackie sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Jackie was born on August 6, 1977 in Allada, in Atlantique county, in Benin. She has been living in Dogoudo, in Allada, for nearly 33 years. She is married to ALAVO Mesmin, a teacher, and is the mother of two children who are both in school. She lives together with her children and husband. The couple provide for the family jointly. Jackie has not gone to school. For 23 years since then, she has been selling popsicles (made with hibiscus flowers and sugar and offered in a plastic pouch) and insulated containers through the distribution system. She stocks up on supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client who has already benefited from two loans from this micro-finance institution, and she has repaid the loans. She would like to augment her working capital and to expand her business by diversifying it. To do so, she would like to sell charcoal. This is why she's requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for popsicles (hibiscus flowers, pouches), 2 sacks of sugar, 30 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Mrs. Rin Y., age 59, lives on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Phnom Penh is the capital city of Cambodia. She has three children: two sons and one daughter. One of them is married and lives in a separate home and one attends school. Her husband is a farmer.

Mrs. Rin Y. has been selling yellow coke (a kind of Cambodian cake) in front of her house for 20 years. One of her sons is a garment factory worker; he now hopes to change to a new business repairing and installing cell phone applications and MP3 and MP4 players. Through this business, he will be able to earn more income to support his family. Thus, Rin is applying for a loan of $400 to purchase a computer for her son’s business.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for her son’s business repairing cell phones

loans.name: Makotekokoumana Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Makotekokoumana  sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 31 ans et 2 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Timpana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parentés. Elles exercent le  commerce d’articles divers (gâteaux, friperie, chaussures, parures, des fruits et légumes etc.) 
Ces femmes ont intégré  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire et le premier prêt a été bien remboursé. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 5 sacs de farine de blé, 3 sacs de sucre, 4 casiers de boissons sucrées BRAMALI et une grande quantité d’articles divers (chaussures, parures etc.). 
La plupart des produits sont achetés à Bamako (capitale du Mali) et sont revendus sur place à Timpana et au marché de Dioïla à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 20 000FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités. 
Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités génératrices de revenus telle la vente des céréales.
texts.en:
The members of the Makotekokoumana group are married women with an average age of 31 and each has 2 children. Each lives with her husband and her children in large traditional families in the village of Timpana, a prefecture of Dioila, Koulikoro in Mali. They all met through neighbours and through family. Their business is various types of sales (cakes, clothing, shoes, jewelry, fresh fruits and vegetables etc.)

This group of women are members of the microfinance institution called Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) and their hopes are to strengthen their businesses. They are currently on their second loan, after having successfully repaid their first.

With this loan they will purchase 5 sacks of wheat flour, 3 sacs of sugar, 4 cases of Bramali softdrinks and a large quantity of assorted merchandise (shoes, jewelry etc.)

The majority of the products are purchase in Mamako (capital city of Mali) and they are resold in Timpana in the Dioila market to a varied clientele.

They hope to see an average of 20 000 FCFA in revenues per month which will be paid to pay the interest of the loan, to provide for the needs fo their respective family and to invest in their business.

Their collective wish is to improve their business by exploring other income generating activities, such as the sales of cereal grains.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, wheat flour, and various other merchandise.

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Bola O. is 26 years old and married with three children. She is a Yoruba by tribe but she lives and works in Benin City, Edo State. Her husband is a driver for a private company.

Bola is friendly woman. She sells groceries and drinks at wholesale and retail prices. She also has a grinding machine that she uses to grind tomatoes, pepper and melons. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her immediate family members.

Bola needs a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Déborah

texts.fr: T. Déborah est née en 1981 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à ZOUMEVO Damien, Déborah est mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. Le couple a un autre enfant à charge. La famille vit au quartier Logbozounkpa dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi, depuis 5 ans. Les charges de la famille sont assurées par le couple. Déborah a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Déborah mène comme activité le vente de tissus et des produits de beauté, par le système de distribution. Déborah vend également des divers (sucre, insecticide, etc.). C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et aussi à Lomé au Togo (Etat voisin du Bénin), que Déborah se ravitaille. Déborah n'a jamais bénéficié d'un prêt à ALIDé. Déborah sollicite ce premier prêt en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande des clients.
texts.en:
T. Déborah was born in 1981 in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Married to ZOUMEVO Damien, Déborah is the mother of one child who is enrolled in school. The couple is also raising another child. The family has been living in Logbozounkpa district in the township of Abomey Calavi for 5 years. Family expenses are shared by the couple.

Déborah did not go to school for very long. To cover her different expenses, Déborah sells cloth and cosmetics through the distribution system. She also sells various other things (sugar, insecticide, etc. ) She buys her goods at Dantokpa, international market of Benin, and also in Lomé, Togo (a country that borders Bénin). Déborah has never before received a loan from ALIDé. She is requesting this first loan with a view to bolstering her business and better satisfying the demand of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 10 lengths of cloth

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda, 48, is a resident of Banga, South Cotabato, and is a rice farmer. She manages a one-hectare (2.5-acre) rice field which is her main source of living. She has four children to support, the eldest being 28 years old.

Minda lacks capital and that's why she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and requested a loan of 10,000 Php. This loan will help her a lot in providing fertilizer for her rice field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice field

loans.name: Nofo

texts.en:
Nofo L. is 32 and married with 6 children (ages 1 - 12).  She owns a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish .  Nofo has 4 years of experience in this business.  Nofo needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2007, Nofo joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Nofo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Nofo L. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.3 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.4 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: La Union De Joachin Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  LA UNION DE JOACHIN porque son personas muy unidas y viven  en la misma localidad,  Las cinco personas del grupo son    KARINA B. HERANDEZ, FIEL C. M., MARCELA B. P., ARTURO F. H., BERNARDO ARTURO F. A..  Todas de ella viven en el estado de Veracruz.  Marcela  se dedica a la venta de ropa y perfume, Karina a la venta de cerámica, Fidel  vende fierro viejo, Arturo se dedica a la  venta de agua potable, y Bernardo Arturo  tiene una funeraria  en sociedad con su papa.

Karina  es la representante del grupo.  Ella está casada.  Tiene una hija   de 2  años.  Karina se dedica a la venta de cerámica  y comida entre otras cosas.  Ella  asegura que este negocio le  rinde las ganancias suficientes  porque no hay muchos negocios como el de ella en donde  vive.  


Con este crédito, quiere comprar mas mercancía para tener surtido su negocio.  Su meta para el futuro es dar una mejor calidad de  vida a su hija.  Con sus ganancias, ella espera que algún día su hija pueda ir a la universidad, y que su negocio sea uno de los mejores en  joachin.  


Karina dice que ella se siente muy a gusto en el grupo de Unidos de joachin porque ella sabe que puede confiar en ellos ya que se conocen bien y son buenos amigos.  Karina piensa  que los prestatarios de KIVA hacen bien en aportar  a sus actividades  ya que  ellos necesitan para invertir en sus negocios.
texts.en:
This group is called “La Union de Joachin” because the members are very united and live in the same area. The five members of the group are Karina B. H., Fiel C. M., Marcela B. P., Arturo F. H., and Bernardo Arturo F. A.. They all live in the State of Veracruz. Marcela sells clothing and perfume, Karina sells ceramics, Fidel sells aged iron, Arturo sells drinking water, and Bernardo Arturo manages a funeral parlor with his father. Karina is the representative for the group. She is married and has a two year old daughter. Karina sells ceramics and food among other things. She says that her business generates sufficient earnings because there are are not many businesses like hers where she lives. With this loan, Karina wants to buy more merchandise to restock her business. Her goal for the future is to provide a better quality of life for her daughter. With her earnings, she hopes to one day send her daughter to university and have her business become one of the best in Joachin. Karina says she feels very comfortable with the group “La Union de Joachin” because she knows she can trust the other members since she knows them well and are good friends. Karina believes the Kiva lenders have been a great help to their activities because the members need to invest in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ceramics to sell

loans.name: Siste

texts.en: Siste E. sells locally produced metal cooking utensils and plastic containers at Jukwa. E. has not received any form of education. She is married and has four children. Her husband is an aluminum pot maker. She helps her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more plastic products in addition to the utensils she sells. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more plastic products (in addition to utensils)

loans.name: Mukhtayaran's Group

texts.en:
Mukhtayaran is 50 years old and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historic places and its Punjabi foods.
 
Mukhtayaran is an uneducated lady, but she wants to give her children a good education. To achieve this goal she operates a business selling quilts. Her business grows in the winter season, but in the summer season she sells pillowcases and bed sheets. Her business gives her an income of PKR 8,000 every month. Her income makes her family more confident.
 
She has seven children: four sons and three daughters. Her first two sons help her in her quilt-selling business. The others are enrolled in a school and are getting an education. Her husband, L. A., is also very supportive of her business. He sometimes takes time out from his work and helps her sell quilts. He is a mason by profession. Their combined earnings allow their family finances to run smoothly. 
 
Mukhtayaran has successfully repaid her two loans to Asasah (a microfinance institution in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to purchase pillowcases and bed sheets in bulk to expand her sales and to earn a good profit.

loans.use: To purchase pillowcases and bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Oluremi

texts.en: Oluremi sells text books at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is 35 old, married with 4 children. Her eldest child is 11 years old and her children are excelling. She is requesting for a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more text books to sell .She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more text books to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Maria M. C. M. nasceu em Maputo, aos 26 de Abril de 1970. Esta a fazer 1 ano de Direito na Universidade Eduardo Mondlane. Vive com os seus 02 filhos de 05 e 20 anos de idade e estudam. E solteira  vive numa casa propria.

A cliente trabalha na Procuradoria Da Republica da Cidade de Maputo, com a categoria professional de escrituraria Judicial Provincial, auferindo um  salario mensal de 8.301,50(oito mil trezentos e um meticais e cinquenta centavos).
  
Este e o primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku, ja teve outro emprestimo no BCI para iniciar a obra no valor de 50.000,00 Mt.  Teve o conhecimento dos servicos da Hluvuku atraves duma prima de nome Adelaide cliente  desta instituicao, concretamente em Boane. Pretende solicitar mais  emprestimos na Hluvuku.

Com este valor pretende fazer o reboco da casa e cobertura da Mercearia no Bairro onde reside. Tem como desafio ver sua obra concluida e o seu maior sonho e de colocar a sua Mercearia em funcionamento. Ela veu pedir o emprestimo em pessoa mais quando nos for tirar foto, ela nao estava disponivel, entao na foto esta o seu filho maior, de 20 anos.
texts.en:
Maria M. C. M. was born in Maputo on April 26, 1970. She is going to law school at the Eduardo Mondlane University in Maputo. She lives with her two children who are 5 and 20, both also students. She's single and lives in her own house. Maria works in the city's justice department and makes around U$240 per month. This is her first loan with Hluvuku but she's had a loan with BCI bank before to build her house. She heard of Hluvuku from a cousin called Adelaide, who's also a client of the institution in the city of Boane. She hopes to fix her house and start a business. In the picture is her 20 year old son since she was not available at the time.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction supplies

loans.name: Gaston

texts.es:
El señor Gastón vive en casa de su suegra  en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y tres hijos.
 
Gastón  es profesor al igual que su esposa, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.

El crédito solicitado es para educación superior de especialización y postgrado.

Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Gastón lives in the home of his mother-in-law in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz, with his wife and three children. Gastón is a professor just like his wife. With their incomes they maintain their family. The requested loan is for education of further specialization and post-graduate education. This it is the first occasion that he has requested a loan and the socioeconomic analysis carried out qualifies him favorably, so we can agree to a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for continued education for his career as a professor

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, de 26 años, convive con su pareja y fruto de ellos, tienen dos hijas Noemí de 7 y Jimena de 2 años de edad. Juntos viven en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la  hermosa selva tropical peruana, donde tienen una casa arrendada. Nancy tiene un Bar-Recreo, que esta dirigido a clientes mayores de 18 años, desde entonces su negocio le esta dando buenos réditos económicos. El factor clave de su éxito radica en el buen servicio de atención que le brinda a sus clientes, por ello ofrece bebidas tradicionales y exóticas de la selva, con el fin de satisfacer a sus clientes. Su esposa la ayuda en el negocio, además cuenta con el servicio de dos señoritas que la ayudan en la atención. Su horario de atención es a partir de las 10:00 de la mañana hasta las 3:00 de la mañana y su punto de venta esta localizado en su misma localidad. Con los ahorros ganados durante 4 años pudo comprar su lote de terreno con la finalidad de obtener su propia casa. Sus planes a futuro es abrir una tienda donde ofrece comida típica de la selva, con el propósito de diversificar sus clientes. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además tiene confianza de que llegara muy lejos con su grupo comunal, ya que le ofrece muchos beneficios. Con el crédito que solicita, le servirá para acondicionar su local, comprando mesas, sillas, artesanías típicas de la selva para que enchape en sus paredes, con la necesidad de cautivar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nancy, 26, lives with her partner with whom she has two daughters, Noemí, 7, and Jimena, 2. Together they live in the town of Quimbiri, situated in the beautiful rainforest of Peru, where they rent their house. Nancy has a cafe bar that is aimed at customers over 18 years old. Her business is giving her good economic returns. The key factor of its success lies in the good service and attention that Nancy provides her customers, offering traditional drinks and tropical drinks, in order to satisfy her clientele. Her spouse helps with the business. In addition she relies on the service of two women who help her attend to customers. Her business hours are from 10:00 AM until 3:00 AM and her store location is right in her town. With the savings earned over four years, Nancy was able to buy a plot of land with the intention of owning her own home. Her future plans are to open a store where she will offer typical regional food in order to diversify her clientele. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, which she commits to repay timely. She has confidence that she will go far with her community group, since it offers many benefits. With the loan she requests, she will set up her bar, buying tables, chairs, and regional crafts to decorate the walls, with the intention of entertaining new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, artisan decorations for business in tourism

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (20211020048) is a 28-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. T. is the group leader of this five-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ngô Nội 2 nhóm 05 (Nhóm 05).

T. is married and has two school-aged children. She operates a family member's business providing repair services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,152,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Nguyễn Thị H. (0) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

2. Nguyễn Thị

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marie Egidia

texts.en:
Egidia was born in 1969 and is married with six children aged between 18 and 5 years old. Egidia has been in the restaurant business for eight years and she employs six people as helpers so that her business runs well. The hours of her restaurant are from 7 in the morning to 9 in the evening every day. 

After realizing that her investment is too low to increase her profit, Egidia is now requesting her second loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her restaurant qualitatively and quantitatively. With this loan, Egidia and her husband will be able to earn more profits, which will allow them to save money for the future and pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant business

loans.name: Zoila Luz

texts.es:
Zoila nació en Urubamba a una hora y diez minutos D. la ciudad D. Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos D. las cuales los tres son independientes. Zoila tiene 73 años y hace 40 años atrás abrió un restaurante en su domicilio, donD. sirve extras, desayunos, menú y otras cosas más. A pueden encontrar en su restaurante los 7 días D. las semana, desD. las 5 D. la mañana hasta tarD. en la noche o hasta que se agote el suministro D. comida.  Ya varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

Con su próximo préstamo, Livia que espera recibir S/. 1500 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero D. préstamo para ampliar su cocina.     

En el año 1994 se abrió el banco comunal “Señor D. Torrechayoc”, pero Zoila es una D. las fundadoras D. banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios pusieron D. nombre “Señor D. Torrechayoc” a su banco comunal en homenaje al patrón jurado D. la ciudad D. Urubamba pues todos los socios le tienen fe.
texts.en:
Zoila was born in Urubamba, an 70 minutes away from the city of Cusco. She lives there still with her husband and their three children. All three children are now independent. Zoila is 73 years old and it was 40 years ago that she opened a restaurant in a section of her home. She serves snacks, breakfast, an a la carte menu and other prepared foods. She works 7 days a week from 5 in the morning until last at night, or until the food is sold out. It has been many years since she first started her business and it has been very successful thanks to her hard work. In 1994 the community bank named The Man of Torrechayo was established and Rosa was one of the founding members. The members were all religious so they named the community bank after the patron saint of the city of Urubamba.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her kitchen.

loans.name: María Margarita

texts.es: María Margarita H. A., es una señora muy responsable y trabajador, la cual cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. Ella reside en San Francisco Gotera, ubicado en el departamento de Morazán, y donde vive junto a tres hijos, los cuales se dedican a estudiar y así mismo a ayudarle a su madre con el negocio. María es madre soltera, quien ha luchado con todas sus fuerzas por sacar adelante a sus hijos y de esta forma brindarles todo lo que ellos necesitan, María se dedica a la compra de cerdos, los cuales cría y posteriormente comercializa con diferentes clientes, los cuales son muy fieles con ella, debido a que María realiza un excelente trabajo en cuanto al cuido y alimentación de los animales. Ella solicita un préstamo a Integral con la esperanza de poder comprar mayor cantidad de alimentos para los cerdos así mismo vitaminas y maíz para estos, todo con el enorme deseo de poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y de esta forma obtener otros nuevos los cuales por referencias de su excelente producto puedan comprarle sus cerdos.
texts.en:
María Margarita H. A. is a very responsible and hardworking woman. She has good references from her neighbors. She lives in San Francisco Gotera located in the Morazán department. She lives with her three children who are in school and help their mother with the business. María is a single mother who has fought with all her strength to get her children ahead and offer them everything they need. María sells pigs which she raises and sells to different customers. They are very loyal to her because María does an excellent job caring for and feeding her animals. She is asking for a loan from Integral with the hope of buying a larger quantity of feed for the pigs as well as vitamins and corn for them. She does all of this with the enormous desire to offer a better service to her customers and in this way obtain new ones from the good references so they can by her pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and feed for them

location.town: San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán

loans.name: Emerita Tompong Group

texts.en: Emerita T.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. She is 41 years old, married and has five school-aged children. They are from the town of Pan-ay Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Emerita has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2005, Emerita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Emerita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC which was used to to build shelter for her livestock. Emerita is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be her 11th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. Emerita is the leader of a four member group accessing a loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Millions Group

texts.en:
Jenilyn E. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 24 years old. Jenilyn is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Millions.

Jenilyn is single and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Jenilyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting, harvesting, and selling bananas, root crops, corn, and coconut. Jenilyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jenilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jenilyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
