*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment.

loans.name: Joseph Mbaja

texts.en:
Joseph Mbaja O. is 39 years old and married to Millicent Ademo. They have two children, namely Jane Kamidi, 14 years old, and Calvine Asene, 10 years old. He has been running a retail kiosk in Mahanga, Vihiga, for 15 years and earns a profit margin of Kshs.15,000.

He has no history with any other MFI and he is applying for his second loan of Kshs. 30,000 from KADET LTD, to add more stock of assorted items like sugar, salt, small packets of omo, etc. for the business, to allow him to give better service to his customers. He plans to use the anticipated profit to increase his savings with KADET and be able to provide basic needs for his family.

In the future, Joseph hopes to expand his business and establish a wholesale outlet.

loans.use: To add more stock of assorted items like sugar, salt, small packets of omo, etc.

loans.name: Imtiaz's Group

texts.en:
Imtiaz is a resident of the small city of Khanewal and has lived there for many years with her family in a two-room brick house in the area named Ahmed nagar.  She is a housewife. She prefers to stay at home and do her household work, but a few years ago she started an animal selling business. She bought some goats, raised them up and sold them to the butchers for a profit. It earned her a very handsome income and she became an earning helper for her family. She has now adopted this business as a profession. It helps her to manage her household expenses better. She is the mother of three sons and two daughters. All of them are enrolled in school and are getting their education, except the youngest one who is just three years old.

Imtiaz has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s furniture making business. With the loan money, her husband will buy items such as nails, wood and wood polish in bulk quantities, which will enable him to make more furniture to sell. Imtiaz is hopeful that her husband's business will grow further by utilizing the loan money. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. She is a responsible client and fulfills her duties responsibly.   

Note: In the photo, Imtiaz is the lady who has a book in her hands (called Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy items for furniture making business

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie H. is from the village of Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. She is 47 years old. Rosemarie is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Rosemarie raises crops to make a living, primarily planting & harvesting corn for sale. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 7200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Rosemarie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. She is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Rosemarie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es un padre de familia de 53 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el Caserío San Martín del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona rural que se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica al comercio de productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes y golosinas en una bodega que tiene instalada en un ambiente de su vivienda. Actualmente cuenta con una clientela estable que prefiere comprar en su bodega debido al buen trato y a la calidad de productos que brinda. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cultivar limón y mango, con los ingresos que le brindan estas actividades el se encarga solventar los gastos de la economía familiar.

Santos desea ampliar su bodega con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y seguir creciendo como empresario, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder sacar adelante a su familia. El es una persona tranquila y bastante responsable. Las personas que le conocen le tienen muchas estima y respeto.
texts.en:
Santos is a father, he is 53-years-old, and lives together with his wife and children in the village of San Martín in the Tambogrande district, a rural area that works primarily in agriculture, that is part of the Piura region and is located a little over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

He works in the sale of basic necessities, groceries, and sweets in a store that is located in his home.  Currently he has a stable clientele that prefer to buy from his store because of the good treatment he gives them and the quality of the products that he offers.  Additionally, he works growing limes and mangos.  With the income that these activities bring in, he provides for the family’s expenses.

Santos would like to expand his store with the purchase of more merchandise so that he can satisfy the demand from his customers and continue growing as a business owner.  This is why he has found it convenient to request a loan for 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

His biggest goal is to continue growing as a business owner so that he can help his family get ahead.  He is a calm and responsible person.  The people that know him have great esteem and respect for him.

loans.use: Purchase of basic necessities and groceries to expand store.

loans.name: Naava

texts.en:
Naava N. is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala south region of Uganda.  She is single and has 4 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Naava has a business selling tomatoes, which she has had for over 10 years.         

To help expand her business, Naava has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more tomatoes.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Naava hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Naava hopes to own a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi O. is a fish seller at Takoradi market. She is married and has one child. She helps her husband provide the basic needs for their family. Her loan will be used to buy a variety of fresh fish to smoke to meet the tastes of her consumers. The additional income accrued as a result of the loan will be saved towards the education of her child.

loans.use: To buy fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta es socia del Banco Comunal Ladrilleros de Compñía, es casada, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo de 1 año y 8 meses. Vicente se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de leña y carbón para quemar los ladrillos.
Vicenta aprendió de la elaboración de ladrillos desde muy niña ahora realiza éste trabajo con su esposo le va bien, le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal porque le dan créditos y puede ahorrar.
Su sueño es poder juntar un capital y poder abrir una tienda de abarrotes en general y poder ahorrar para la educación de su hijo.
texts.en: Vicenta is a member of the Ladrilleros de Compañia [Bricklayers of Compañia] Community Bank. She is 30, married, and has 1 child aged 1 year and 8 months. Vincente makes bricks. She will invest the requested loan in the purchase of firewood and coal to burn the bricks. Vincenta learned brickmaking at a young age and now does this work with her husband. It is going well. She enjoys the meetings in her Community Bank because they provide her with loans and she can save. Her dream is to be able to raise capital and open a general grocery store, and to be able to save for her child's education.

loans.use: the purchase of firewood and coal

loans.name: Menana Aba

texts.en:
Menana Aba R. is divorced and has five dependents. Menana bakes pie and fries groundnuts for sale in Elmina.  She has been doing this for fifteen years. Menana uses the income she makes from her sales to take care of her dependents.

Menana will use the loan to purchase flour, groundnuts, and other ingredients to bake pies and fry groundnuts for sale. She plans to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: To purchase flour, groundnut, and baking ingredients

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha S. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 53 years old, married, and has four adult children. To make a living, Editha owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, and toothpaste in the local community. Editha has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Editha joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Editha's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is 43 years old, married and the father of two.  He is a hardworking businessman who makes cooking pans, pots and energy saving cookers (jiko) using scrap metals.   He has engaged in the business for ten years. He has learned business management skills and how to save his money through Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to have a fully grown business in the future.  He has requested 20,000 KES to buy scrap metals.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals

loans.name: Bailon

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Bailon; El socio tiene 32 años de edad, el socio  es conviviente; el socio tiene 1 hijo; el socio tiene como principal actividad la artesanía el también tiene terrenos de cultivo en los cuales producen maíz, papa y otros, el socio trabaja en la artesanía desde el año 2008; el socio realiza diseños propios y andinos, el desea que se le otorgue el crédito para poder comprar pintura, oleos, acuarelas, bastidores, aerógrafo y pinceles; el socio trabaja con sus compañeros de banco en la feria artesanal en el poblado de Chinchero. El socio desea el préstamo para invertir en la compra de pinturas, oleos, pinceles, aerógrafo y otros.  

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO” community bank. This bank is located in the district of  Chinchero, province of Urubamba, departament of Cuzco.

The member is named Bailon. He is 32 years old and in a common law marriage. He has 1 son. His main activity is artisanal craft. He also has crop land where he grows corn, potatoes and more. He has worked in artisanal crafts since 2008. He makes his own designs as well as Andean designs. He wants to be given the loan to be able to buy paint, oils, watercolors, frames, an aerograph and brushes. The member works with the other members of the bank in the artisanal fair of the town of Chinchero. He will use the loan to invest in buying paint, oils, brushes, an aerograph and more.  

The member is happy with the loan and committed to making the payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying paint, oils, brushes, and an aerograph, among other things.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn S. is from the village of Lurugan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 29 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Arlyn owns a sari-sari (variety) shop selling products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, detergents and beverages. Arlyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Arlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI and is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Arlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand the her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional food products to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 42 años, vive en concubinato con Carlos, ambos tienen 2 hijos: Leydi y Yamely, a los que cuidan y crían en su casa propia ubicada en la ciudad de Santa Ana (selva central peruana). La actividad a la que se dedica; es la venta de comida en un espacio que acondicionó en la casa de su padre. Donde brinda también pensión (venta de alimentos en el desayuno, almuerzo y cena, a una misma persona), como también bebidas gasificadas y de preparado natural. Como le gusta cocinar, también prepara picarones (plato típico), en la feria que realiza los días domingos en la ciudad de Perene, obteniendo una ganancia neta de S/. 100 nuevos soles por el día. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder ayudar en los gastos familiares, pues la labor de albañil, que realiza su esposo no les alcanza para poder cubrir los gastos. Por ello piensa mejorar la infraestructura de su restaurante y de esa manera obtener más ganancias para poder cubrir los estudios superiores de su hijo mayor. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los milagros”, y este es el octavo crédito que tiene con MFP, donde agradece por todos los años de arduo trabajo.  Ana, con el dinero que solicita, comprará insumos para la preparación de los alimentos que vende a diario.
texts.en:
Ana, 42, lives unmarried with Carlos; they have two children: Leydi and Yamely, who they care for and raise in their own home located in the city of Santa Ana (Peruvian central jungle).  The activity she’s involved with is preparing meals in a space she equipped in her father’s house.  She also provides board (sale of breakfast, lunch and dinner to the same person), as well as soft drinks and natural juices. Because she likes to cook she also prepares picarones (typical dish, similar to doughnuts) at the city of Perene’s Sunday market earning a net profit of 100 new soles daily.

What she most enjoys about her work is being able to contribute to household expenses.  Because of this she’s planning to improve her restaurant’s infrastructure to earn higher profits and cover her oldest son’s higher education expenses.

She is a member of the “Los Milagros” (The Miracles) communal bank and this is her 8th loan with MFP where she is grateful for all the years of hard work.  Ann will use the requested funds to buy ingredients to prepare the meals she sells daily.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: Marcelino tiene 45 años, su actividad económica es ofrecer el servicio de taxi. Este hombre recorre muchos lugares todos los días, a pesar de ser un trabajo ya que solamente descansa para tomar agua. El es un hombre trabajador y futuro empresario pues siempre está pensando en un sin número de medios para mejorar sus ingresos por lo que es una persona muy ejemplar. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de de repuesto de su vehículo, focos, caja de cambios y realizarle un chequeo a su taxi y así ofrecer un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Marcelino is 45 years old.  His business is offering a taxi service.  He drives many places every day.  He only rests to drink water.

Marcelino is a hard-working man and future entrepreneur as he is always thinking of lots of ways to improve his income.  He is an exemplary person.

Marcelino is requesting this loan to buy spare parts for his vehicle (headlamps and a gear box), and to have his taxi serviced so that he can offer a good service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts (headlamps and gear box), and to have his taxi serviced

loans.name: Rosa Estela

texts.es:
Rosa, reside en la ciudad de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y leña, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 19 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda con ingresos parte de su salario, ella inicio el negocio por necesidad, aprendió a hacer tortillas cuando era joven y vivía con su madre, el horario que tiene es de 8:00am a 6:00pm, de lunes a domingo.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz y leña, con este préstamo adquirirá lo necesario para seguir en la elaboración de las tortillas, además de poder aumentar la producción.
Su objetivo es algún día tener la capacidad de reinvertir sus ganancias en el negocio  sin la necesidad de obtener préstamos, para tener más libre las ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in the city of San Miguel. She sells tortillas and firewood. She lives with her husband and their two children, aged 19 and 8. Her eldest son works and he contributes with his salary. She started her business out of need. she learned to make tortillas when she was young and when she lived with her mother. She works from 8am to 6pm from Monday to Sunday.

She requests a loan to purchase corn and firewood. With this loan she will acquire what she needs to keep making her tortillas and to increase production. 

Her objective is to one day be able to reinvest her profits in the business without needing a loan, to have her earnings more at her disposal.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood.

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
Mher lives in Yerevan together with his wife, mother and daughter. He sells men’s clothing, which is the family’s main source of income. His wife helps him in the business.

Mher needs to refresh his stock of clothing so he can offer his clientele continuous good service. The loan will help Mher generate more income and cover the family’s daily costs.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
Éste Banco comunal se llama “Emprendedores” y está conformado por 15 emprendedores, pertenecientes a la comuna de Colina ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago. Todos ellos se dedican a diferentes rubros, específicamente venta de ropa, de alimentos, productos de limpieza y negocios en una feria libre. 
Ana quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, en el segundo puesto de derecha a izquierda, se dedica a vender comida rápida, específicamente completos, churrascos, empanadas, sopaipillas y pizzas. Prepara y vende esta comida desde su casa, desde hace 4 años y le ha ido muy bien en su negocio.
Su horario laboral es de martes a sábado de 6ºº de la tarde a las 12ºº de la noche. Y los fines de semana éste horario se puede extender. 
Con el préstamo comprará materiales de construcción para acomodar su local en el patio de su casa, de ésta manera podría obtener el permiso de salubridad correspondiente.
Sus metas son establecer de manera óptima su negocio, para abrir durante todo el día, ya por ahora solo puede atender en las noches por falta del permiso. Además anhela reestructurar su local para que sus clientes puedan consumir su comida en el mismo local.
Ana vive junto a su marido y su hijo de 3 años de edad. Sus sueños son convertir su trabajo en un negocio más lucrativo, de esta manera también contratar personal y ser independiente económicamente. 
Ella está muy agradecida de Fondo Esperanza, le gusta mucho participar de las reuniones, debido a la buena relación con las demás socias del banco comunal.
Colina es una comuna de la región metropolitana (donde está Santiago, capital de Chile) ubicada al norte de la misma. Actualmente es centro de importantes inversiones, principalmente en el área agro industrial, debido a la instalación de grandes e importantes empresas, que de paso entregan un gran número de empleos a la comunidad. Es también un área de parcelaciones de agrado, lo que ha contribuido a aumentar considerablemente el número de habitantes. También cuenta con espacios adecuados al turismo, tales como termas, deporte en la Laguna Piedra Roja y montañismo.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Emprendedores” (Entrepreneurs) and is composed of 15 entrepreneurs belonging to the Colina Commune located in the city of Santiago.  Each is in a different line of work, specifically clothes sales, food sales, cleaning supplies sales and businesses in farmer’s markets.

Ana, who appears in the photo seated in the front row, second from the right, sells fast food, specifically “compuestos” (Chilean hot dogs), turnovers, sopaipillas (fried flat dough) and pizzas.  She prepares and sells the food from home.  She’s been in business for four years and has done very well in her business.  Her work schedule is Tuesday through Saturday from 6pm until midnight and on weekends this schedule can lengthen.

She will use the loan to buy building materials and supplies to furbish her locale in her yard so that she can get the corresponding health permit.
Her goals are to put her business in optimal conditions so that she can be open all day since she’s only able to operate at night now because she lacks the permit.  Besides, she hopes to remodel the locale so that customers can consume their food there.

Ana lives with her husband and 3-year-old son.  Her dreams are to make her business more lucrative so that she can also hire personnel and become economically independent.

She is very grateful to Fondo Esperanza.  She enjoys participating in the meetings very much because of the good relationship she has with the other communal bank members.

Colina is a commune in the north part of the metropolitan region (where Santiago, capital of Chile is located.)  It is currently the focus of important investments especially in agro business due to the arrival of large and important firms which, by the way, generate a large number of jobs in the community.  It is also an area of “parcelaciones de agrado” (farmland turned into residential use) that has contributed significantly to the population increase.  In addition, it has places that are ideal for tourism, like hot springs, sports at Piedra Roja Lagoon and mountaineering.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Maria Del Rosario le esta haciendo falta el piso de enfrente.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar el material que es cemento, arena y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Doña Maria Del Rosario es madre soltera y tiene un hijo bajo su responsabilidad, quien esta estudiando. 
Planea pagara el crédito con una parte del ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como empleada de una fabrica en el aria de producción, este sueldo es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia. Desea que el patrimonio de su hijo este en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Del Rosario is lacking a floor in the front part of her house. She is requesting a loan to buy materials, such as cement and sand, and to pay someone to take charge of completing this improvement.

Doña Maria Del Rosario is a single mother and has one child who is her responsibility and attending school. She plans to repay the loan using part of the income she earns as a factory employee. Her salary is the source of income by which she supports her family. She wants her home to be in good condition so that she can leave it as an inheritance for her son.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor needed to install a concrete floor in the front part of her home.

loans.name: María Cruz

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal El Valle, vive en la parroquia de Zhidmad, este lugar se encuentra rodeado de vegetación, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y muchos de su gente sale a laborar en la ciudad de Cuenca y regresa en la noche, son personas muy amables y carismáticas.
 
Doña María tiene 37 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo ha migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo para mejorar la economía de su hogar, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.
 
Doña María se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de animales como: cuyes, chanchos y ganado a los que los vende en su propia comunidad.

Se encuentra en su quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para sus terrenos. 

Su meta es  arreglar y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
María is a member of the El Valle Communal Bank.  She lives in the Zhidmad parish.  This place is surrounded by vegetation, and its people devote themselves to raising animals and farming.  Many of its people leave to work in the city of Cuenca and return at night.  They are kind and charismatic people.

María is 37 years old, married, and has four children.  Her first two children go to high school, and the last two children go to elementary school in the area.  Her husband has migrated looking for better work in order to improve the household finances.  The house where they live is their own property.

María devotes herself to agriculture and to raising animals like guinea pigs, pigs, and cattle.  She sells them in her own community.

This is her fifth loan with her communal bank.  She will use it to buy fertilizer for her land.

Her goal is to fix up and improve her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Ayed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married and has three children.

Ayed has had a food market since 2000, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting a $2,500 loan to buy a generator and to purchase additional foodstuffs for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a generator and purchase additional foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Benedicta Aurentina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro. Y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Benedicta, tiene 65 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación  tiene 7 hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo no trabaja está enfermo el sufre de ataques epilépticos.

Nuestra amiga para ganarse el sustento diario de ella y su esposo se  dedica a la cría de chanchos y pollos, nos cuenta que compra estos animalitos cuando aun están pequeños, los pollos en una incubadora en Portoviejo y los chanchos en el mercado o a vecinos que los venden pequeños. A los chanchos los tiene por espacio de tres a cuatro meses hasta que tengan un peso adecuado y luego los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa y ellos los llevan a los distintos mercados de la ciudad a comercializar la carne.  A los pollos también los entrega a comerciantes  o si no los pela y los vende por libras a vecinos y tiendas de sus localidad.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas tanto para pollos y chanchos. Lleva en el  del Grupo De Crédito 10 años y  le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otros lugares de crédito y por la ayuda que le dan en el grupo. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener salud.
texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliadora community bank meets twice a month in Montecristi, an Ecuadorean town famous for being the birthplace of El Viejo Luchador (The Old Fighter), Eloy Alfaro, and for the straw hats that are made here and so admired inside the country and out.  

We met Benedicta, 65, at the bank.  She and her partner have 7 children, all grown and independent.  He suffers from epilepsy and no longer works.  

To earn enough to support them both, Benedicta operates a business raising and selling chickens and pigs.  She tells us that she buys the animals when they are young, the chicks from a supplier in Portoviejo and the piglets from a local market or from neighbors.  She keeps the pigs for three or four months until they're ready for market.  She then sells them to a passing wholesaler who, in turn, sells them at markets in the city that specialize in meat sales.  She often sells the chickens to passing wholesalers, as well, but if not, she plucks them and sells them herself.

Benedicta will use this loan to buy chickens and the supplies she needs to care for her animals.  She has been a member of the community bank for 10 years and likes it because the interest rates are relatively low and because of the help that she receives from the group.

Her greatest hope is to keep going and stay healthy.

loans.use: Comprar pollos,alimento y medicinas para pollos y chanchos.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana  está casada, tiene 31 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos 1 de los cuales está estudiando, se dedica la confección de camisas para diferentes edades, inicia este negocio como operario y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo oficio.

Decide solicitar un préstamo para ampliar su capital de trabajo para compra de telas de diferentes diseños y colores, ya que espera que su negocio se grande y con operarios.
texts.en:
Juana is married.  She’s 31 years old.  She never went to school.  She has three children; one is in school.  She makes shirts for all ages.  She started in this business as an employee and to date has five year’s experience.  Her husband supports her efforts and is in the same occupation.

She decides to request a loan to increase her working capital to buy fabric in assorted colors and designs since she expects her business to grow and to be staffed.

loans.use: to buy fabric for shirts.

loans.name: Nenabeth

texts.en:
Nenabeth is the mother of 2 children and she has been separated from her husband for a long while. She is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Besides her other means of income, Nenabeth has owned a two-wheeled motorcycle for hire for 10 years. This service has the capacity to carry 2-4 passengers. Nenabeth earns a monthly total of PHP 12,000 from all income sources.

In 2007, Nenabeth pursued her plans of joining the GDMPC cooperative. She would like to borrow PHP 5,000 to purchase motorcycle accessories to improve service quality. Nenabeth plans to use possible revenues to buy a motor cab to extend seating capacity, thereby gaining more income.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle accessories to improve service quality.

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Kheng (in the photo) is 38 years old and his wife, Pesoet, is 34 years old. They live about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have one son and one daughter. Both of their children are in school. 

Kheng is a motor taxi driver, while his wife is a garment worker. He is asking for a loan of $700 to repair the house where he lives.

loans.use: To repair the house where he lives.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Clotilde nació en la provincia de Paucartambo en la ciudad de Quiñer y tiene 23 años de edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo.  

Actualmente, Clotilde vive en la ciudad de Huancarani  y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía de tipo tejido y a la venta de comida en la plaza principal de la ciudad de Huancarani. En esta oportunidad Clotilde requiere el crédito para comprar lana y insumos como arroz, azúcar, carne y verduras. 

El Banco Comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Clotilde was born in Paucartambo province, in the city of Quiñer.  She is 23 years old, lives with her common-law husband and has one son.

Clotilde currently lives in the town of Huancarani and this is where she carries out her business activities.  Clotilde makes all kinds of handicrafts (knitting) and also sells food in the main square in the town of Huancarani.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy yarn and supplies such as rice, sugar, meat and vegetables.

The 'Once de Mayo - Huancarani' community bank meet once a month in Huancarani district, in Paucartambo, in Cusco department (Peru).  Cusco is well known for being a very touristy and commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machu Picchu).

loans.use: to buy yarn and supplies such as rice, sugar, meat and vegetables

loans.name: A.c

texts.en: A.C. is 49 years old, and lives in Airport Community. She is married, and her husband is a businessman. They have six children between the ages of 9 and 36 years old; three are currently in school and live at home, while the others are living on their own. For the past twenty-five years, she has been selling bread. She makes good profit because she has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, sugar, oil, and butter for her business. Her plan is to build a bakery, and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, oil, and butter for her business

loans.name: Jeanelyn

texts.en:
Jeanelyn is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Jeanelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Jeanelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jeanelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 67 years old and married.  She has 6 children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Ofelia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Ofelia has been raising pigs for 11 years and also earns additional income from farming rice and livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Daniel Kariuki

texts.en:
Daniel has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 23 years. This is his seventh loan and he has paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He used his previous loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer, which he planted, and it it was very profitable.

He plans to use this loan amount to buy more seedlings and fertilizer as well as other farm inputs.

Daniel hopes to improve his farming skills and become a leading farmer in Ndunuy Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Basharat's Group

texts.en: Basharat is the leader of this group. She is 55. Together with her husband, who works as a bulldozer driver, she has raised a daughter and a son. The son works in Russia and the daughter studies in a college. In order to earn money to meet the family needs, Basharat cultivates agricultural products and breeds livestock. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the near future, with the profits gained from selling the harvest and reselling livestock, Basharat plans to open a trading place. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Humu

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Humu.  She is married to a businessman, and has four children aged 13, 9, 7 and 2 years. Three are in school.
 
In 2007, Humu established her vegetable oil, toys, and jeans business. She began her business because she had lived with her stepmother, who did not allow her to attend school, but instead forced the family to sell for her.  Humu did not finish her primary education and joined her stepmother in doing business.  It made her independent. That’s why she likes doing business. 
 
Humu works 7 days a week and 11 hours a day and earns about Le 2,168,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Humu requires a loan in order to purchase 25 containers of vegetable oil @ Le 120,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 326,000. 

In the future, Humu plans to open a provision shop and a savings account.   She wants another shop to display her goods, as she needs a larger space to operate her business.  She wants her children to be important people in society. That’s why she needs additional capital to help her boost her business. 
 
A rise in transport costs and the rainy season are her major challenges.  The competition is low, as two people are dealing with the same product but Humu has a larger stock.  She is hardworking and honest.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase 25 containers of vegetable oil @ Le120,000.

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en:
Norberta is 39 years old and is married with four children. She runs a sari-sari store business in Trinidad, Bohol, where she sells various items such as vinegar, spices, shampoo, and soap. Norberta works hard to improve her business and support her husband to provide for their needs.

Norberta is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as soy sauce, vinegar, canned goods, and rice. She hopes that her business will grow and she also hopes to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as soy sauce, vinegar, canned goods, and rice

loans.name: Julia Mabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”SEÑOR DEL CALVARIO; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Calca en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Julia Mabel;  La socia tiene 41años de edad, La socia es soltera, La socia tiene 2 hijos de 22, 13 años de edad; la socia tiene su propia tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diversos productos de abarrotes, la socia en esta ocasión desea implementar su tienda e invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como son arroz, azúcar, leche, harinas, fideos, mazamorras, huevos entre otros que salen a diario, y en la compra my especial en esta navidad de panetones, vinos, champan, para las fiestas navideñas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la tienda e implementar los productos navideños para la temporada.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "SEÑOR DEL CALVARIO". The community bank is located in the district of Calca in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Julia Mabel; she is 41 years old and single. She has two children who are 22 and 13 years old. She has her own grocery store and she sells diverse products. The member wishes to equip her store at this time and invest in buying the most needed products such as rice, sugar, milk, flour, beans, bread crumbs, and eggs, among others that sell daily, and also a special purchase for this Christmas season: seasonal pastries, wines, and champagne for Christmas parties. The member requests the loan to invest in her store and offer Christmas products for the season.

The member is grateful for the loan and is committed to making payments as outlined in the schedule.

loans.use: to invest in her store and include Christmas products for the season.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna is 40 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married with five children aged 18 to 24 who are in school and live at home. For the past sixteen years, Susanna has been selling fashion slippers, blouses, and cosmetics from a table in the market. She established the business with money that she received from her parent. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion slippers, blouses, and cosmetics for her business. She enjoys the independence that her income gives her. Her plans is to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion slippers, blouses, and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Santa Veronica Camelia

texts.es:
La señora Santa Veronica Camelia es casada, tiene 18 años de edad, cursó los 5 años de educación primaria, se dedica a la costura y al bordado de blusas, lleva 2 años de experiencia en este trabajo, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la apoya económicamente.

solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la apertura de una fresquera ya que ha vista la necesidad de tener este negocio, y mejorar sus ingresos, espera en el futuro tener un negocio grande de refrescos.
texts.en:
Santa Veronica Camelia is married, 18 years old, and has a 5th grade education.  She has a business sewing clothing and embroidering blouses, and has 2 years of experience in this line of work.  She has the backing of her husband, who supports her financially.

She requests a loan to open up a refreshment stall, since she has seen the need for this type of business and wants to increase her income.  She hopes that in the future she will have a big soft drink business.

loans.use: to buy powdered soft drinks and utensils

loans.name: Mayson

texts.en:
Mayson is a 39-year-old married woman from Baqa'a, Jordan and has two children.

Mayson started her business with only one sewing machine with sales limited to friends and neighbors. But with her exceptional talent and her hard work, Mayson could expand her business into a small workshop where she has more than one sewing machine and sell her items to shops not only to individuals.

Now, Mayson is requesting a loan of 1,000 JD to purchase fabrics for designing and sewing clothes with the aspiration of purchasing her own house and financing her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics for designing and sewing clothes

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. Marilou is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Marilou is borrowing PHP 6350  through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light source that is waterproof during the rainy season/.

Marilou is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, she helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase of solar lamp

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
I sell my clothing from my house where I also sew and
work.  My customers have grown to depend on me over
the years, so they pass by my house to place their
orders.  Due to the income from my business, I have
been able to repair and improve my house and make it
secure for my family.  I am proud and happy to welcome
my customers to my home.  They place orders with me
and I make their clothing and then they come back by
to pick up the finished product.  By buying materials
in bulk with my loan, I am able to save at least 20%,
and my customers know that I am giving them a good
price, so they keep returning to place more orders.

loans.use: Buy raw materials like thread, buttons,wool, cotton, and other fabrics to make table cloths,formal dresses for mixers, silk corsages, babyclothes, and other clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mercy would like to open a beauty shop.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise B. has three businesses. She bakes bread, which she sells to street vendors to resell, and she also sells apparel and clothing accessories - all from her home in a rural town outside the capital of Hato Mayor province. Francoise lives with her 19-year-old daughter, Daniela. This loan will go towards the purchase of clothing, shoes and accessory kits which she buys in the city to re-sell in her village. She will also be able to buy more baking materials to expand her small bakery business.

Francoise is a member of a Bank of Hope solidarity group - made up of five micro-entrepreneurs who have gone through Esperanza's business training programme and have proven to be in need of a loan as well as able to pay it back. Each member will receive a share of this $1,000 loan to develop their respective businesses and are responsible for making each loan repayment together, which fosters accountability as well as social support.

loans.use: Purchase flour, clothes and accessories

loans.name: Protus

texts.en:
Protus is married with three children. One is in primary school the others are still at home. He started his chicken business in 1996 in which he gets his stock from his local Myanga market then sells at Kandui trading center. Through his business, Protus has been able to develop his farm by adding cattle and goats, and to open up a small hotel in the Mayanja business centre to diversify his business this year.

Most of the challenges he faces in his chicken business is when he purchases sick chickens without knowing it, and the transportation costs, which are very high in the area due to his movement to selling areas. He makes about $15 in profit from each chicken that he sells. With the combined businesses, he is able to support his family's basic needs and other necessities. With the loan of $125 from PEMCI, he plans to expand his chicken business, which is now booming. With this kind of business he hopes to increase on his earnings in the long run and be able to provide better for his children's education

loans.use: Chicken seller, Hotelier

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.en:
Eulogio lives with his wife, as their children have emigrated to the city of La Paz seeking work. He and his wife are dairy farmers and also grow the grain they feed their milk cows. Part of his milk production is processed at PIL Andina (Milk Producing Plant) and the balance is processed as yogurt, as their community has its own dairy. They live in the Arasaya area of Achacachi, two and a half hours from the city of La Paz.

The loan will be used to purchase a dairy cow, which will allow him to increase milk production. This is his first loan with IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Eulogio vive junto a su esposa Isabel, pues sus hijos emigraron a la ciudad de La Paz a trabajar. Eulogio y su esposa se dedican a la producción de leche de vaca y al cultivo de forraje que les sirve como alimento a su ganado. Su producción la comercializa en parte a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche) y la otra a la elaboración de yogurt, pues la comunidad cuenta con una procesadora leche. Vive en la Comunidad de Achacachi – sector Arasaya (A dos hora y media de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito sera invertido en la compra de una vaca productora de leche, de raza mejorada, para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Mrs. Hem S., age 35, raises pigs, earning about $1 per day in income. Her husband works as a farmer and earns about $1 per day. They have four children, two who work at a garment factory making about $70 per month, one who is a student, and one who is married and lives in another home. In order to expand her pig raising business, she would like to borrow $500 to purchase additional piglets and pig feed. She plans to use the increased revenue to reinvest in the growth of her business and help finance her children’s education. Her husband is pictured next to their home as she was not available at the time of the photo.

loans.use: To to purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Heri

texts.id:
This gentlemen born April 21 1981 started his business a year ago. Materials he needs are leftover leather from jackets or bags. He sees a market opportunity in this business is good. Profit could reach up to Rp650,000 (about US$70)/month. Finished product is being sold in Sukowati Art market and several artshops in Kuta area. His wife is also a leather artist. Income could reach Rp400,000 (about US42)/month. Those incomes are sufficient to pay for daily expenses of Rp20,000 (about US$21)/day. Their 2 children need education for their future. This made Heri to expand his business, especially this business is their single only hope.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Pria kelahiran 21 April 1981 ini memulai usahanya setahun yang lalu. Bahan yang dia perlukan adalah kulit sisa dari hasil pembuatan jaket atau tas. Dia melihat peluang pasar untuk usahanya ini bagus. Keuntungan yang dia peroleh mencapai Rp 650.000,00/bulan. Produk yang sudah siap, dipasarkan di Pasar Sukowati dan di beberapa artshop di daerah Kuta. Sang isteri juga bekerja sebagai pengrajin gelang kulit. Penghasilannya mencapai Rp 400.000,00/bulan. Penghasilannya tersebut dapat mencukupi biaya hidup per hari yang sebesar Rp 20.000,00. Dua orang anak yang mereka miliki memerlukan pendidikan untuk masa depan mereka. Hal ini mengharuskan Heri mengembangkan usaha ini. Apalagi usaha ini merupakan satu – satunya harapan mereka.

loans.use:
To buy raw materials

Membeli bahan baku berupa

loans.name: Maria Zoila

texts.es:
Maria Zoila is 71 years old and still works hard. She studied up until her second year of high school. She has 12 children, but only 2 still depend on her. They live in the area of Campina D. Moche in Trujillo. She has a business preparing sweets and snacks, which she sells in in her town and in the spa town of Las Delicias. Maria Zoila is a member of the group Mientras Tanto, Siempre Adelante (always forward), from which she received her first loan to purchase chocolate and dried fruit to begin her business. With the new loan, she will purchase molds for the chocolate, milk, chocolate and dried fruit. Her dream is to have a sweet shop in the city of Trujillo.

La señora Maria Zoila a sus 71 años aun trabaja con muchas ganas, estudió hasta segundo año D. secundaria y tiene 12 hijos en total pero sólo dos aun dependen D. ella. Vive en el Sector Campiña D. Moche del Distrito D. Moche D. la Provincia D. Trujillo del Departamento D. La Libertad. Se dedica a la preparación D. dulces como choco tejas, choco maní, etc., los cuales los venD. en Moche, Las Delicias y Trujillo. La señora Maria Zoila es socia del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Siempre Adelante” en este grupo obtiene su primer crédito D. S/.300.00 soles con los cuales compró cobertura D. chocolate y frutas secas e inició sola la producción debido a que antes pertenecía a una red D. dulcerías Con este préstamo D. S/.500.00 soles, que cancelará en cuatro meses, comprará mayor cantidad D. moldes, una caja D. leche, cobertura D. chocolate y frutas secas. La señora María Zoila sueña con tener una dulcería en la ciudad D. Trujillo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE INGREDIENTS NEEDED TO MAKE THE SWEETS AND CHOCOLATES SHE SELLS.

loans.name: Maya

texts.es:
Ms. May is a member of the Los Jazmines community bank, and she sells groceries and plastic bags from a stand in the Moyabamba market in the district and province of Moyamba in the department of San Martín. Born into a family of merchants, her interest in the business was sparked and, when she was older, she began selling fruit and vegetables and then moved to selling groceries and plastic bags from her stand at the Moyabamba market. She was thus able to raise her 6 children, all of whom are now living on their own. With a loan valued at 2,500.00 sols, to be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase a variety of groceries, such as boxes of soap, dishwashing detergent, several brands of bleach (marsella, bolivar, jumbo), etc., 50-kilogram sacks of rice, packaged toilet paper, canned fish, liters of oil, 20-packs of salt, packaged pasta and plastic bags of different sizes for different uses. She is 63 years old and lives with her husband. She has always stood out as a fighter, a hard worker, responsible and perseverant, and she would like to add plastic products to her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

La señora Maya es socia del banco comunal “Los Jazmines”, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y bolsas de plástico en el puesto de venta del mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Moyabamba, distrito y provincia de Moyabamba, departamento de San Martín. Nacida en una familia de comerciantes, despertó en ella su apego al negocio, por lo que siendo ya mayor se inició vendiendo frutas y verduras para luego dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes y bolsas de plástico en su puesto de venta del mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Moyabamba, y de esa manera sacar adelante a sus 6 hijos que ahora son todos independientes. Con el crédito de S/. 2,500.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará diversos abarrotes como cajas de jabón, lava vajillas, lejía de diferentes marcas (marsella, bolivar, jumbo), etc., sacos de 50 kilogR. de azúcar, papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado, aceite por litros, sal en paquetes de 20 bolsas, fideos en paquetes y bolsa de plástico de diferentes tamaños y para diferentes usos. Tiene 63 años y vive con su esposo. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer luchadora, muy trabajadora, responsable y perseverante, la cual anhela adicionar a su negocio la venta de productos de plástico.

loans.use:
Purchase of groceries (soap, sugar, oil, etc.) and plastic bags

Compra de abarrotes (jabón, azúcar, aceite, etc) y bolsas de plásticos

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin H. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 24 years old and is single. He lives with his parents. Elchin is engaged in cattle breeding. He started his business because he needed to help out even more with the family expenses. He applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for the KIVA loan in amount of $600 to purchase some sheep and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase some sheep

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
At first, Isabel brought frogs from Huancayo to sell in Lima, until she finally decided to set herself up in Huancayo. Twelve years ago she stopped selling frogs and opened a stand for natural medicine in the Central Number 3 market. For the past twelve years she has been selling not only natural medicines but also extracts of frogs and other medicinal drinks at her stand in the market.

Part of her earnings go to her home and children (she has four adult children and one newborn baby) and the other part she reinvests. What she would most like to do now is increase her supply of products and in the future, to be able to move to another place to work, since she does not feel very safe where she currently is and a short time ago was the victim of a robbery.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

En un inicio, Isabel traía ranas desde Huancayo para venderlas en Lima hasta que se animó a establecerse en Huaycán. Hace doce años dejo su venta de ranas; sin embargo abrió un puesto de medicina natural en el mercado “Central nº3”. Actualmente, ya tiene doce años vendiendo no solo medicina natural sino también extracto de rana y otras bebidas medicinales en su puesto del mercado.

Una parte de sus ganancias lo destina para su casa e hijos (tiene cuatro hijos mayores y un bebe recién nacido) y otra parte la vuelve a invertir. Lo que ella más quisiera por el momento es aumentar su mercadería y en un futuro poder mudarse a otro lugar de trabajo, puesto que en el actual no se siente muy segura, hace poco tiempo fue victima de un robo.

loans.use: Increase her merchandise stock.

loans.name: Philipina's Fruits And Vegetables Seller Group

texts.en:
Philipina is married with one child, aged 5 years old. Philipina has been a fruits and vegetables seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Philipina now hopes for a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Clara, who also sells fruits and vegetables.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetabes for her business.

loans.name: Fidelite Group

texts.fr:
Created in 2006, the Fidelité Association brings together three women who each have a different business. Their average age is 40, and they are all married and have children. They sell cassava flour and cloth at the market in Agoè. They are currently on their fourth loan cycle from WAGES. The loan they are currently requesting will allow them to purchase seven bags of cassava flour and three rolls of cloth. With the income they will earn from selling these products, they will help pay their families’ expenses.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Créée en 2006, l’ Association FIDELITE regroupe 3 femmes qui exercent des activités commerciales différentes. L’âge moyen de ces femmes est de 40 ans. Elles sont tous mariées et mère de famille. Elles sont revendeuses de farine de manioc et de tissus dans le marché d’Agoè. Elle sont à leur 4ème cycle de prêt au près de WAGES. Le crédit qu’elles sollicitent actuellement leur permettra d’acheter 7 sacs de farine de manioc et 3 rouleaux de tissus. Avec le revenu qu’elles tirent de cette activité, elles contribuent aux dépenses de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase of cassava flour

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha M. and her husband, Mr. Chansovath Choy, are teachers in Tumnop Thmey village in Kampong Chhnang Province. They have two young children. Because teachers' salaries are very small (25/month),  Mrs. Chantha M. also sells firewood. She is requesting a loan to buy buffaloes for breeding. This will improve her income and help raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy buffaloes for breeding.

loans.name: Janifa

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 45 year-old Janifa P.. She is married and has six children (ages 17 to 31). She also has two dependents who live with her because they are at school in the area. In 2005, Janifa established her charcoal business. Janifa is seeking a loan in order to purchase additional stock of charcoal. In the future, Janifa plans to to increase the quantity and variety of her charcoal stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania, using a sale and leaseback microfinance model as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, they are deemed not creditworthy by financial institutions, leading low incomes and inadequate access to basic needs and services. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women: when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of charcoal.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
The community of Pampa Cruz is located approximately 30 minutes from the district of Cangallo. Approximately 30 families live in the community, and they harvest grains such as wheat, barley, and corn, and vegetables such as peas and potatoes. This community only maximizes their land once a year because they do not have an irrigation canal that can support continual farming.

Maria H. buys various types of grains and vegetables and takes them to Ayacucho. She also has a general store where she sells groceries. Maria takes advantage of the community markets and/or annexes so that more people buy her products. She wants to improve her business in order to giver her children, who study in Cangallo, a better education and to buy them a little house. Maria says that she learned how to save through her small bank. She also values herself as a woman and understands her husband and children better.

Lorenza C. buys and sells animals. She also stocks groceries that she uses for bartering purposes. Lorenza ultimately would like to have a small grocery store as she gets older. Now that she is in FINCA Peru, she is very enthusiastic because she knows that they will train her near other businesses. Lorenza is very anxious to learn more. She only asks God to give her the health and life to keep on working.

Anna H. buys and sells animals at the community annex and sells wheat products. She does the most business in her community. Her dream is to buy a house in Ayacucho to live with her children. At her communal bank, she learned to respect herself, and she knows that she has the same abilities as the me

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

L. comunidad D. Pampa Cruz, esta ubicada aproximadamente a unos 30 minutos del distrito D. Cangallo, esta Comunidad cuenta con aproximadamente con 30 familias que viven en L. comunidad, los comuneros se dedican a L. siembra D. cereales como trigo, cebada, maíz, arveja y tubérculos como papa, esta comunidad solamente aprovecha sus terrenos una vez al año por motivos que no tienen un canal D. irrigación que pueda abastecer L. producción continua D. L. agricultura.

María H., compra todo tipo D. cereales y tubérculos y los lleva a Ayacucho, elL. tiene una bodega en L. cual venD. abarrotes que trae D. ayacucho, María también aprovecha las ferias D. las comunidades y/o anexos para que L. gente le compre sus productos. María quiere mejorar su negocio para darles mejor educación a sus hijos, ellos estudian en Cangallo es por ello que su sueño es comprar una casita. María manifiesta que en su banquito a aprendido a ahorrar, también a valorarse como mujer y a comprender mejor a su esposo e hijos.

Lorenza C., se dedica a L. compra y venta D. animales, también lleva abarrotes para hacer trueque en las comunidades. A Lorenza le gustaría tener una bodeguita para su vejez. Ahora que esta en FINCA Perú esta muy entusiasmada porque sabe que los promotores L. capacitarán a cerca D. los negocios, Lorenza esta ansiosa D. aprender mas, solo piD. a Dios que le D. salud y L. vida para seguir trabajando.

Ana H., compra y venD. animales, elL. lo hace en los anexos D. L. comunidad. También venD. cereales, en su comunidad elL. es L. que mas negocios hace. Su sueño es comprarse una casa en Ayacucho, para vivir con sus hijos. En su bancomunal a aprendido a respetarse a si misma y también sabe que tiene las mismas facultades que los varones.

loans.use: The members of the San Francisco Communal Bank are seeking a $900 loan to invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Tim

texts.en: Tim S., 47, is married and lives with five of her seven children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer but her farm is just to support the family members from day to day . Her husband has been a bean farmer since he married with his wife. On average, he typically makes US$1.70 in profits per day. Two children are students and three others are garment factory workers. She told a loan officer that she on average spends on food US$40 every month, US$10 on children's education, US$15 on transportation. To double the family's income she has requested a loan of US$500 to purchase a horse and cart to transport goods for profit.

loans.use: To purchase a horse and cart to transport goods for profit.

loans.name: Dipa

texts.en:
Mrs. Dipa K., a resident of Sanepa, Lalitpur, opened her grocery shop a year ago to improve the living standard of her family. Assisted by all members of her family, she sells a variety of grocery items such as rice, maize, biscuits and snacks in her shop.

Now Mrs. K. is requesting a loan to buy more grocery goods for her shop, planning to spend any increase in income helping her husband to improve the quality of life of her family. Mrs. Dipa K., lives with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, brother-in-law and her husband, Mr. Amit K., who works in a private office.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase yames, potatoes and additional staple foods.

loans.name: Irshad M. Mushtaq Group

texts.en:
Irshad baji is 52 year old woman and resides in Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 35 years. Her husband, M. M., works in a Government office. Irshad baji is the mother of five children: four sons and one daughter. Irshad baji has been sewing clothes for the past 15 years. She has successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and is now applying for a loan to buy more paints to expand her son’s paint selling business.

She is a group leader of a few more members in her locality. Razia begum baji is requesting a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Shazia amen baji is requesting a loan to buy clothes for her clothing business. Shahnaz baji is requesting a loan to buy paint brushes for resale. Niamat baji is requesting a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment of the entire loan.

loans.use: To buy paints for her son's paint shop

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señorita Rosa P. es soltera , y tiene 30 años de edad . El negocio lo tiene muy bien ubicado, zona altamente comercial y su boutique es  uno de los comercios más conocidos, se inició con un capital de Gs. 5.000.000.- son $ 1000.- aproximadamente,  que fue ampliando con el correr de los años ya que cuenta con una amplia clientela, pues la zona en la que se encuentran es muy poblada y muy concurrida.
La señorita Rosa P.,  retira el préstamo para la compra de varias mercaderías como ser: prendas de vestir para  damas principalmente, y para la temporada primavera - verano.
Una de sus aspiraciones es poder ampliar próximamente su negocio, en lo que se refiere  al equipamiento o mobiliario para  poder ofrecer  un ambiente más cómodo y ameno a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Miss Rosa P. is 30-years-old and single. Her boutique has a great location in a very commercial area and is one of the best-known shops. She started out with about 5,000,000 guaraní ($1000) in capital. Her business has grown over the years and she now enjoys a healthy clientele, since her area is highly populated and bustling. Miss P. will use her loan to purchase merchandise, primarily women’s clothing, and spring and summer attire. One of her short-term goals is to be able to grow her business by buying equipment and furnishings so she can offer her customers a more pleasant and comfortable atmosphere.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase lingerie, T-shirts, pants, footwear, etc.

loans.name: Mrs. Ouk Sorn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-two people living in Srey Snom village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. All the members are shown in the picture, though some are blocked.

Mrs. Ouk S., the 43-year-old village bank president, is a vegetable seller in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more vegetables to resell. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions. 

Her husband, Mr. Thy Chhum, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Ouk S. has five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other three are attending the local school and the remaining child is too young to work or study. 

Eight members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows thE. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Mireyda Del Socorro

texts.es: Mireyda es soltera, de 46 años de edad, maestra de primaria, esta solicitando su 7mo credito  el que utilizara para compra de zinc para cambiar el techo de su casa pues quiere estar preparada para el invierno, trabaja en una escuela multigrado de la zona de Comalapa, sale de su casa a las 6:00 a.m. y regresa a las 4:00 p.m., en dias determinados regresa mas tarde porque atiende el programa de Educacion de Adultos, tiene 20 años de trabajar como docente en la zona rural, tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales 4 son independientes, trabajan y le ayudan de vez en cuando, dos habitan con ella al igual que una niña pequeña que estudia primaria, se siente muy contenta  al ser clienta de AFODENIC, ya que siempre ha pagado sus cuotas en tiempo y forma y lamenta que algunos educadores esten organizados en el grupo llamado Movimiento del No Pago, pues estan manchando su record crediticio y estan llenando de vergüenza a los docentes honestos.
texts.en:
Mireyda is a single, 46 years old, elementary school teacher. She is requesting her 7th loan which she will use to buy zinc to change the roof of her house because she wants to be prepared for the winter. She works in a multi-grade school in the zone of Comalapa. She leaves her home at 6:00 a.m. and returns at 4:00 p.m. On some days, she returns later because she goes to a program of Education for Adults. She has been working as a teacher in a rural zone for 20 years, and has 5 children, 4 of whom are independent, have jobs and help her now and then. Two of them live with her, as well as her youngest daughter who is in elementary school. She feels very happy as a customer of AFODENIC, because she has always made her payments on time and she is sorry that some teachers are organized in the group called "Movement of No Payment", because they are affecting her credit rating and bringing shame to honest teachers.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying zinc to change her roof

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena E. has been selling provisions at Ntsin in Cape Coast, Ghana, for one year.  She is married, and her husband works at a restaurant in the area called Hans Cottage.  Philomena got her education through a vocational school.  She is responsible for paying for her family’s utilities, food and clothing.  Philomena’s loan will be used to buy more provisions with the intention of expanding her business. She hopes to use her newly acquired profits to buy land, on which her family intends to eventually build a home.

She is in the green dress in the photograph.

loans.use: Buy more provisions to expand her business.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.es: Merlita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Libertad”, vive en el Jr. Comercio cdra. 04 – Caserío La Libertad, Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 40 años y es madre de 02 hijos, todos independientes.Se inicio vendiendo abarrotes en pequeñas cantidades, a las que agregó la venta de cosméticos, ubicando su negocio en su propia casa. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 que cancelara a un plazo de 06 meses, comprará más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes y productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela. También invertirá en la compra y  venta  de productos de belleza, que en sus tiempos libres se dedica a ofrecer a sus amistades y conocidos. Ella maneja todas las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, se siente más  segura y responsable y llena de esperanzas. Merlita, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer, esperando que sigan así para apoyar a demás mujeres que quieren trabajar y emprender su negocio.
texts.en:
Merlita is a member of the communal bank “La Libertad” and lives in the village of La Libertad, district of Bellavista, area of San Martin. She is married, 40 years old, and has two children, both independent. She began selling groceries in small quantities, to which she added the sale of cosmetics, locating her business in her home.

With this loan of 1500 PEN which she will pay in a period of six months, she will buy more products to supply her business such as sacks of rice and sugar, products for personal hygiene and house cleaning, sodas, and various products for maintaining her customers’ satisfaction. She will also invest in the purchase and sale of beauty products which she offers to her friends and acquaintances in her free time. She manages all of the profits of her business. Personally, she feels more secure and responsible, and full of hope.

Merlita shows her appreciation for Manuela Ramos for permitting her to grow as a business owner and a woman, hoping that they continue in the same way by supporting more women who want to work and to launch their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase articles of the first need and beauty products

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei sells underwear and other types of clothing at Image market in Beregovo city. He is not married. His monthly income is 2,500 UAH. Andrei has been in this business for five years. During this time he has learned that having a large assortment of goods, that is on display all the time, is the key to success in this kind of business. Andrei's prices are not high, making the goods more attractive to his customers.

Andrei would like to borrow 1,700 UAH to increase his inventory. He hopes to develop this business further and increase his sales.

loans.use: To increase inventory of clothing

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James T. is 35 years old; he is married and father of two children. Currently both his children are schooling. James says he is blessed with God-given talent to heal the sick and most especially those that are suffering from skin rashes like boils, pimples etc. Currently James is a specialist in herbal medicine with specialization in skin rashes. He prepares his medicine with the use of some special tree bark and special leaves from the bush which are known to him alone. Through that, he has healed lots of people with skin rashes.

James has three years' experience in herbal ointment medicine. He used to sell his ointments in paper but now he has designed a smaller container in which he packages the herbal ointment medicine. In view of his performance and the quality of his medicine, lots of people have come to him for treatment. Fortunately those that came and had their healing are doing well.

James needs the loan to buy production materials like containers to package the ointment. With your help he believes others will have their treatment and will be happy too. He belongs to the village bank called ‘Nana Doma’.

loans.use: to buy shea butter for processing of herbal medicine

loans.name: Wédayamana 7 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Wédayamana 7  est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Sirakélé de la ville de Koutiala région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles soeurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et au moins 5 enfants.
Elles excellent uniquement   dans la culture de l’arachide.
