Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe   Wédayamana 7 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre prêts précédents, elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter,  une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de Koutiala ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Koutiala et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Wédayamana 7 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 65 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Wédayamana 7 is a group of married women in the Sirakélé neighborhood, in the city of Koutiala (Sikasso Region, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in large extended traditional families with their children, husbands, in-laws, etc. They average 35 years of age, and have at least 5 children. Their only business consists in growing peanuts. Eager to make their farming activities profitable, they decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, five years ago. After having repaid the previous four loans without problems, they are now seeking their fifth farming loan.

The loan will be used to buy, exclusively at the grand market in Koutiala, a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, small material, and fertilizers for the fields. After the rainy season, crops are stocked for a while to gain market value, before being sold at the grand market in Koutiala and in the surrounding villages, retail (often wholesale) and for cash, to a clientele usually coming from the larger cities.

After selling their production, the members of the Wédayamana 7 group count on turning a profit of XOF 45000 (ca US$ 100), to be used to repay the loan and to pay for the daily expenses of the family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanut seed, small material, and fertilizers for the fields

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl C. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old. Sheryl is married and has three infant children. To make a living, Sheryl owns & operates a sari-sari or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Sheryl has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Sheryl joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sheryl is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Sheryl from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 52 years old. Elizabeth is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing & selling clothing products to local businesses and community members. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 29 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (about $167 US) a month for these activities.

In 2006, Elizabeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 pesos from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 9,000 pesos which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Elizabeth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Jenipha

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Jenipha M. from Mwanza. She is married and has three children between the ages of 4 and 10 years old. Jenipha  has been running a duka (neighborhood shop) where she sells common household and grocery items. She works at the business for 12 hours per day 6 days per week and is assisted by 1 employee. Jenipha  currently earns about $130 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 TSHS to purchase more materials and equipment. In the future, she plans to expand and modify her duka business. Jenipha  thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more materials and equipment

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is 48 years old. She is married and has four children, two sons and two daughters who are all still in school. Afia works very hard to help her husband provide for the family. They live in a rented apartment in Oda in eastern Ghana.

Afia is a food vendor. She runs a chop bar in her community, preparing and selling all kinds of local dishes. She procures her food supplies in nearby towns at moderate prices.

Afia has been in business for over fifteen years and would like a loan to buy goods in bulk so as to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food supplies

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a member of the Maendeleo borrower group in Sakina, Arusha. She is 35 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 5 children. Her children are 32,26,24,19, and 17 years old. She also cares for other 3 dependent.

Tatu has owned a charcoal business for 4 years, she works 8 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Tatu,s first loan  from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 400,000Tsh in order to buy more charcoal for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Tatu hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
Lucinda es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Lucinda es casada, tiene 53 años y 4 hijos, Lucinda se dedica a la fabricación D. ladrillos D. manera artesanal en la comunidad D. Compañía, sus ventas los realiza en la misma comunidad.
Lucinda necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. leña.
Lucinda sueña con implementar con maquinas su ladrillera.
texts.en:
Lucinda is a member of the Obreras Communal Bank. She is 53 years old, married and has 4 children. She manufactures bricks using traditional methods in the Compania community where she also sells them. Lucinda needs a 2000 sol loan to purchase firewood. Lucinda hopes to be able to mechanize her brick-making shop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase firewood.

loans.name: Norvy Daniela

texts.es:
La señora NORVY DANIELA Z. R., tiene 26 años, vive en el distrito de SALPO , provincia de Otuzcó, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal VIRGEN DE LAS MERCEDES
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria , 
NORVY es madre soltera y tiene dos niños de 8 años y de 1 año de edad por quienes trabaja ya que no cuenta con el apoyo económico del padre de los niños para su crianza y educación.
NORVY   se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios en la tienda de comestibles que tiene en su casa.También a la preparación y  venta de pan.
El crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de productos alimenticios, tales como: arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, galletas, chocolates, fideos, jabones, detergentes para abastecer l atienda de comestibles que tiene en su casa.
Este crédito de 3000 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar mas productos alimenticios como azúcar, fideos, leche, bebidas gaseosas, conservas, etc. y así ampliar su tienda.
También en la compra de harina ,manteca, levadura, aceite, etc para la preparación del pan.
NORVY sueña con ampliar su negocio de la tienda y aumentar su venta de pan ya que necesita obtener dinero para poder criar a sus hijos y brindarles una optima calidad de vida.

loans.use: lo utilizará para comprar mas productos alimenticios como azúcar, fideos, leche, bebidas gaseosas, conservas, etc.

loans.name: Samuel B.

texts.en:
Here is Samuel B. C.. Samuel is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 from Kiva lenders through SMT for the first time to invest in his business and pay school fees for two of his children.

Samuel sells rice and palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil). He has been in business for many years now. He is thirty years old and is married with six children between the ages of one and 18.

loans.use: To invest in his rice and palm oil business.

loans.name: Leyla Isabel

texts.es: La señora Leyla V. de 49 años de edad,  es una mujer comprometida con su familia y con el trabajo desde hace once años se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos el cual inicio con fondos propios y luego comenzó con financiamiento en Afodenic es su doce avo ciclo el cual ha invertido en variedad de productos, vive en el barrio Memorial Sandino un barrio que queda a muchos kilómetros de la capital, y donde la delincuencia a aumentado por el desempleo, tiene dos hijos de 12 y 18 años de edad,  su esposo es conductor, desde horas temprana sale del hogar a ganarse la vida en la ruta urbana en la capital de Managua, juntos esperan terminar de hacer las mejoras a su casa. Dar a sus hijos educación para que sean hombres con un nivel profesional y no se sometan al vicio de las drogas. Con este préstamo comprara ropa, zapatos y cosmético para incrementar las ventas que en  esta temporada son buenas ya que tiene poca ropa para ofrecer a sus clientes  lo cual espera al invertir mejores resultados en las ventas como las ganancias. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo en la inversion.
texts.en:
Leyla V., 49, is a woman dedicated to her work and her family. For the past eleven years she has sold clothing, shoes, and cosmetics which she started up with her own funds and then with Afodenic financing. This is her 12th lending cycle which she has used to buy a variety of products. She lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood which is many kilometers from the capital and where delinquency has increased due to unemployment. She has two sons, a 12-year-old and an 18-year-old. Her husband is a driver who leaves home very early each day to earn his pay on an urban route in the capital city of Managua. Together, they hope to finish improving their home and provide their sons with an education so that they will become professional men and not fall into the vice of drugs. With this financing, she will buy clothing, shoes and cosmetics to increase sales since this season is good for sales but her inventory is low and she hopes to have better results in profits from her sales. She thanks the institution for the support in her investment.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes for ladies, gentlemen and children.

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
El señor Justo C. y la señora Antonia Zarate está muy agradecidos por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudieron arreglar el camión. Ya están trabajando en el la señora Antonia se pone a vender en un sitió diferente.
Están solicitando otro préstamo para poder comprar una camioneta y acondicionarlo para la venta de tacos y así darles  empleo a dos familiares, ya que en este momento no tiene trabajo y los quieren ayudar.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias de una de las camionetas ya con las ganancias del la otro camioneta será para los gastos familiares y los que vayan necesitando sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Justo C. and Mrs. Antonia Zarate are very grateful for their previous loan which allowed them to fix their truck. They are already working so that Antonia will be able to sell at a different site. They are asking for another loan so that can buy a van and equip it to sell tacos. This will give jobs to two relatives, who at this moment are unemployed and Justo and Antonia would like to help them. They plan to repay the loan with the profits from the van and their earnings from their truck will be used for family expenses and the needs of their two children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a van to sell tacos

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda's desire to rise up from poverty and her dreams to have decent life motivated Yolanda to join ASHI, a Kiva field partner, in 2007. She hopes that God will always guide her whole family and give them more blessings to cope with their challenges and problems in life. She is always praying that her business will grow bigger, because it is one sources of their family income. And, also, she is asking for support from the good hands of our lenders and ASHI-Kiva for their hopes and dreams in life. They would  love to have a calm and relaxed house to live in. 

Yolanda M. is 52 years old and a good mother to her four children. She is married to Ruben, who is a 51-year-old fisherman, and also her partner in business. Because of her perseverance and hard work, and the income from her business, she provides a good education for her children so they can  finished studies until college. 

Yolanda is engaged in many businesses. She has a sari-sari (variety) store, she sells fish, she has a skylab business (a motorcycle with "outriggers" to carry passengers and cargo), and a fishing net that catches fish easily. 

For her fifth loan, she is asking for Php 23,000.00, which she will use Php 8,500.00 to buy fishing net, Php 7,000.00 for bamboo and rope, Php 1,000.00 for labor for their skylab business, and Php 6,500.00 to purchase of items for her sari-sari store. She is very innovative she enjoying seeing her life change. This loan will be a great help to her family as they strive to overcome poverty.

loans.use: To buy fishnet, bamboo and rope, to pay for labor, and to buy items for her store

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Badenya sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et 4 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et résident dans la ville de Dioïla, quartier Socoura Est, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. 
Ces femmes qui font le commerce d’articles divers et la restauration ont intégré   l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. Elles sont à leur treizième prêt solidaire et tous les  précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, une grande quantité de céréales sur place pour en faire des galettes, des poissons frais avec les pêcheurs de Dioïla, une à deux tonnes de bananes et papayes dans le village de N’Golobougou et une quantité suffisante de condiments alimentaires  à Bamako. 
Tous ces produits sont revendus sur place au marché de Dioïla et dans les foires environnantes à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 25 000FCFA par mois. Les bénéfices seront utilisés pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans l’activité. 
Elles ont pour ambition de payer des lots à usage d’habitation  pour l’avenir de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the Badenya group are married women who are, on average, 45 years old with 4 children. They live with their husbands and children in large traditional households and reside in the city of Dioïla, East Socoura district, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali. They know each other through familial and community relations. These women, who are engaged in food preparation and the sale of various items, joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners) with the goal of making their lucrative businesses more durable. They are on their 13th solidarity (group) loan, and all the previous loans were repaid properly. They intend to use this loan to buy a large quantity of cereals on-the-spot to make flat biscuits, fresh fish from the fishermen in Dioïla, one to two tonnes of bananas and papayas in the village of N'Golobougou, and a sufficient quantity of food condiments in Bamako. All of these products are re-sold on-the-spot, at the market in Dioïla, and at the local market day fairs to a clientele composed of women and men. They hope to realize an average monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA each. The profits will be used to repay the interest on the loan and provide for the family, with the rest being invested in their businesses. Their ambition is to pay for housing plots for the future of their children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish, fruit, cereals, and condiments

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Twenty-seven year old Jocelyn is a rice farmer. She is married and has two children. Her oldest child is only six years old. She does not mind having to spend most of her time at the farm because it gives her family food to eat, clothes to wear, and provides their other needs. She currently needs additional capital for her farm. She applied for a loan of PHP5,000, which she will use to finance her farm. She will purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Isaack

texts.en:
Isaack is a 25-year-old single man. He owns an aqua farm named Kamiti Fisheries. Previously, he ran a car-hire business. His farm has been running for one year and he has six employees. 

Faulu Kenya, a Kiva partner, has helped him to buy the farm that he currently runs. He hopes to expand his business, that is why he requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings so as to buy fingerlings (young or very small fish) to add to his aqua farm. He dreams to buy more land and make more profits in the future.

loans.use: Buy fingerlings (young or very small fish)

loans.name: Fishmonger B Angei Koncy Group

texts.en: A. Koncy is a married business lady. She is 28 years old, with three children. All of her children are going to school and she has two other dependents schooling too. She sells fish, which she has been doing for over seven years. Due to inadequate capital, she is using the loan to purchase fish from the fishermen to sell to her customers. She is adding capital to purchase a big quantity of fish to market. She is a hardworking business lady whose future hopes are to improve and expand her business and her family's welfare.

loans.use: To purchase fish from the fishermen to sell to her customers

loans.name: Pablo Andres

texts.es:
Pablo A. de 58 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento pero solo cuenta con luz y agua como servicio básico. Su esposa le ayuda en la heladería con ella tienen 2 hijos. 

Pablo esta actualmente trabajando en la heladería Gino (Heladería Ecuatoriana), hace uno meses atrás el pidió vender en su casa los helados Gino, cuando tuvo la autorización invirtió su sueldo en helados. 

Ahora el vende los helados en su casa con la ayuda de su esposa, trabaja todos los días, una de las complicaciones que tiene con las lluvias ya que les baja la clientela.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar helados y tortas heladas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener una heladería mucho mas grande y poder construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Pablo A., 58 years old, lives in the outskirts of the city along Guayaquil’s Perimetral highway. His house is made of cement but only has electricity and water as basic utilities. His wife helps him in the ice cream shop and they have two children.

These days Pablo is working in the Gino ice cream shop (an Ecuadorian ice cream shop). A few months ago, he asked to sell Gino ice cream, when he received authorization he invested his salary in ice cream.

Now he sells the ice cream in his house with the help of his wife. He works every day. One of the difficulties he’s having is that the rains have decreased the number of customers.

With the loan he wants to buy ice cream and ice cream cakes for his business. In the future, he wants to have much larger ice cream shop and to be able to better build his house.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ice cream and ice cream cake

loans.name: Joyitas Group

texts.es:
La  Asociación Comunal “Joyitas” que trabaja en el centro focal de Panamericana cuenta con once integrantes, la asociación ya tiene 17 ciclos funcionando.  Los negocios que las señoras declaran son: diferentes artesanías, tejido de chompas y producción, comerciante y venta de dulces,  producción de calzados peinadoras, electrónica, serigrafía, tienda de abarrotes, costurera, venta de chamarras y producción de canastas artesanales.
Una de las socias más antiguas, Doña Julia L., indica que se encuentra desde la fundación de la asociación, eso significa que ya tiene 8 años y medio como socia de la A.C. Joyitas.  A sus 52 años, ella cuenta con una gran familia que esta conformada por, 3 hijos casados, 3 hijos que están a punto de casarse y 6 hijos que están bajo la tutela de ella y de su esposo.
Doña Julia refiere que antes tenía un negocio de venta de comida, pero que ahora gracias a que uno de sus hijos aprendió a coser chamarras ella ha cambiado de negocio y ahora le va mejor.
Durante estos años los créditos han sido variados, de acuerdo a las necesidades del negocio, la solicitud de ahora es por Bs.1500.-, monto que le alcanzará para comprar un rollo de tela y accesorios, como cierres, forros, puño e hilo.

El joven Yuri F. y Jacquelina L.  no salieron en la foto.
texts.en:
The Joyitas Communal Bank works in the Centro Focal Panamericana. The group has 11 members, and they have had 17 cycles. The women’s businesses are different handicrafts, knitting and producing sweaters, merchant, selling sweets, footwear production, hairdresser, electronics, silk screening, grocery store, seamstress, selling jackets, and production of handmade baskets. Julia L. is one of the oldest members, and she has been a member since the association began. This means that she has been a member of the A.C. Joyitas for eight and a half years. At 52 years of age, she has a large family, which is comprised of three married children, three children about to get married, and six children who are under the guardianship of Julia and her husband. Julia says that she used to have a business selling food. Now, thanks to the help of one of her children, she learned how to sew jackets. She changed businesses, and now it is going better. During these years the loans have been varied depending on the needs of the business. The request now is for Bs 1500, an amount that will cover the purchase of a roll of fabric and accessories like zippers, lining, cuffs, and thread. Yuri F. and Jacquelina L. do not appear in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina E. is 27 and married with 4 children.  She owns a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  Sina has 1 year of experience in this business.  Sina needs a loan of WST $1000 to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Sina joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Sina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth Pejere, 47, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Arsenio, a seaman, they are blessed with five children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store while also selling different varieties of vegetables, meat and seafood.

Lilibeth has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues. She uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 13,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business. She will be buying more quantities of the products in her current product inventory so that she can replenish her stocks and maintain operations of her businesses.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: Towards buying more quantities of the products in her current product inventory so that she can replenish her stocks and maintain operations of her businesses

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells spiritual items and drinks in her shop and she has been in this business for the past 15 years. She likes the business and she wants to increase and improve her business's profitability. She is 47 years of age and she has three children. Her husband is a pastor and they live in Lagos.

Mary hopes for a loan of NGN100,000 to purchase more spiritual items and drinks to sell. She thanks all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more spiritual items and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is married to a dry cleaner and they have six children. All their children go to school. Deborah takes care of additional family members (parents). She owns a stall selling second hand shoes in Kalerwe market in Kawempe Division, one of Kampala city suburbs. She sells mainly children and women's shoes. She goes shopping twice a week and buys these shoes from Owino market in Kampala city. She uses public transport to and from shopping. Deborah wants to use this loan to buy more second hand shoes. She sells mainly at retail. Deborah has been in this business for over 13 years. She works seven days a week. Her business challenges include defaulters and competitors. She aspires to educate her children up to university. She joined MCDT to boost her business. She resides in and owns a two-room house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water.  Her monthly expenses include food, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more second hand shoes

loans.name: Misael

texts.es:
El señor Misael L.  esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual  pudo realizar la mejora a su casa.
Esta solicitando nuevamente otro préstamo para terminar su casa ya que le están haciendo falta el vitropiso, por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como chofer de una constructora de casas. 
Las personas que aparecen en la foto son la señora Ana Laura Gómez y un de sus hijos ya que el señor Misael se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita.
texts.en:
Misael L. is thankful to all those who helped him with his previous loan, which allowed him to make improvements to his home. He is asking for another loan now to finish his house, as the floor still needs to be tiled. At the moment he doesn't have enough money to buy the material and pay someone to install it. Misael plans to repay the loan with the income from his job as a driver for a homebuilder. The people in the photograph are his wife, Ana Laura Gómez, and one of his sons. Misael was at work the day that the photo was taken.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of floor tiles

loans.name: Jessica De Los Angeles

texts.es: La joven Jéssica C. L. se desempeña como secretaria comercial, la cual labora para un abogado donde tiene tres años de desempeñar este cargo. Ha recibido tres créditos de Ceprodel para gastos personales con los cuales ha adquirido bienes para su hogar. El último crédito lo solicitó para la compra de una cama matrimonial con el objetivo de tener mejor comodidad en su hogar.
texts.en:
Jéssica C. L. works as an administrative assistant for an attorney, a job she has been doing for three years. She has received three loans from Ceprodel for personal expenses, which she has used to buy items for her home. She is requesting this latest loan in order to buy a full-sized bed, with the goal of being more comfortable in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a full-sized bed.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Mrs. Lay D. is 48 years old and is a villager who lives in Spueu village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who works very hard to support her three children, while her husband, Mr. Nann Tea, is a car taxi driver who is able to earn a small income to help support the family. One of their children is a beautician and the other two attend the local school.  In order to support the beauty salon, Mrs. Lay D. requests a loan to buy beautician supplies.

loans.use: To buy beautician supplies.

loans.name: Khairan's Group

texts.en:
Khairan lives with her family in a city called Lahore, which is also known as “the heart of Pakistan”. She is a working lady. She sells bangles and ready-made clothes to share the financial burden with her husband. Her husband is a fruit vendor. He sells fruit by going to different areas of the community on his bicycle. He visits different places in the city to sell his fruit. He earns approximately 12-15 thousand PKRs every month, which has become insufficient to meet the financial expenses of his family. Because he used to buy fruit on a daily basis, he has to pay first. Now he has decided to start supplying the fruit to different fruit shops so he gets the required income with profit on the same day. 

Therefore, Khairan has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will be able to buy seasonal fruit in bulk and sell it to more fruit shops. She is hopeful that, in this way, her husband can increase his income sufficiently.

loans.use: To purchase fruit for fruit selling business

loans.name: Mujeres Dinamicas Group

texts.es:
Todas las integrantes de este comité están muy satisfechas con los trabajos que vienen realizando y se encuentran en un periodo de afianzamiento del grupo ya que están dentro del primer ciclo. 
Una de las integrantes del comité es la señora Licia quien se dedica a la venta de calzados deportivos que ella importa de la Argentina.
Ella viaja cada mes y trae las mercaderías solicitadas por los clientes.
Licia ofrece mercaderías de buena calidad y facilita el pago otorgando los calzados y otras mercaderías a cuotas accesibles, así ella cuenta con muchos clientes y logra obtener ingreso que le ayuda en su hogar. 
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de nuevos modelos de calzados deportivos.
 Ella dice que si uno se propone metas todo ese puede lograr con un poco de sacrificio.
texts.en:
All of the members of this committee are very satisfied with the work each is doing and are in a group financing period since they are within the first cycle. One of the group members is Licia who sells athletic shoes that she imports from Argentina. She travels each month to bring the merchandise that her customers request. Licia offers good quality goods and easy payment plans for the shoes and other merchandise. Thus she has many regular customers and earns income that helps her support her household. The loan she is requesting is to buy new models of athletic shoes. She says that if one sets goals everything is possible with a bit of sacrifice.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy athletic shoes.

loans.name: La Bendición De Dios Group

texts.es: Doña Graciela es casada tiene tres hijos pequeños y dos de ellos están estudiando, ella y su esposo se dedican a la venta de pieles, que se utilizan para la elaboración de calzado, su negocio cuenta con quince años de experiencia, vende en San Marcos y San Francisco el Alto. Viendo la necesidad de un capital y no teniendo las garantías necesarias se unen con otras vecinas que tienen la misma necesidad para forman el Banco Comunal llamado La Bendición de Dios, esto es para poder solicitar financiamiento e incrementar sus capitales y volumen de ventas. Ella sueña con que su negocio sea más grande y algún día poder exportar pieles. El Banco Comunal es integrado por diez señoras entusiastas.
texts.en:
Doña Graciela is married and has three young children, two of whom are in school. She and her husband earn their living selling animal hides used in making shoes. Graciela has 15 years of experience in this business and sells in San Marcos and San Francisco El Alto. She is in need of capital and since she does not have the necessary guarantees, she joined with other neighbors in the same situation to form a Communal Bank called “La Benedición de Dios” (The Blessing of God). Now that they are able to request a loan, the members will be able to increase their capital and generate more sales.

Graciela dreams of expanding her business and hopes to export animal hides one day. The Communal Bank consists of ten enthusiastic women.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire animal hides to sell

loans.name: Akutwala Ekiro Kyebando Kisalosalo Group

texts.en: Caroline O. belongs to Akutwala Ekiro Kyebando Kisalosalo group loan. She sells charcoal to make ends meet for herself and her husband and five children. She has been in this business for the last 5 years in Kyebando-Kampala. It is through friends that she got the idea to start this business. Before that she was more inclined to sell clothes. She describes herself as an optimist bent on achieving success in whatever she does. She can earn as much as 500,000 shillings (UGX) each month selling charcoal. She also sells cereals like maize for additional income. With this loan, she will be able to buy more bags of charcoal for reselling.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for selling.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina P. is from the town of Banga. She is 56 years old and married. She has nine children; the eldest is aged 36 and the youngest is 19. To make a living, Josefina plants and harvests rice for sale. Josefina has been engaged in farming for over 35 years now. She says she still works at the farm because she wants to support her family.

Josefina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
Shahnoza is an entrepreneur who runs a business selling clothing for kids. She has been in this business for three years. Shahnoza has loyal customers who come to buy from her because they trust the quality of her inventory and enjoy her friendly and respectful service. She has used micro loans in the past and found them very instrumental in her business. This time Shahnoza is requesting a loan of $1,500 USD to increase the assortment of her inventory. She would like to purchase additional clothing for the upcoming cold weather so that she can increase her sales. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new goods to increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Batbold

texts.en:
Batbold is 46 years old and lives with his wife and a daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live together in a small house. His daughter is currently employed as a doctor in “OUR DOCTOR” family clinic. His wife  is operating a sewing business producing 'Deel' (traditional Mongolian coats) at home. 

Batbold has been managing a taxi service since 2000. Also, he purchased a Hyundai excel car in 2004 for his business. He enjoys transporting people and has gained much experience over the years. He  is a trusted driver for his many customers. He is a very hard-working and persistent person. He is requesting a loan to fix his house’s heating system.

loans.use: fix his house’s heating system

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en: Nasira S. is currently in the business of selling onions, beer, groundnut paste etc.  and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Nasira is 21 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has two children and one only of her children goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Uldarica

texts.en:
Uldarica D. is from the town of Doña Josefa. She is 41 years old, married and has 6 children. Uldarica owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Uldarica has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Uldarica joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Uldarica is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Uldarica from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sindangan-Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es: La señora Amalia es una cliente que ya saco tres créditos en la institución la cancelación D. sus créditos fue buena y puntual, es una cliente con buena actitud, ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa D. mujer D. vestido ya sean top blusas faldas y pantalones, la ropa que Compra la cliente es nueva y D. buena calidad, la cliente agarra toda su mercadería  D. una D. las  avenidas muy populares por la venta D. ropa por mayor y barata,  su negocio esta ubicado en la ceja del alto su negocio esta en una galería,  negocio D. la señora Amalia es sacrificado por que ella tiene que venir desD. la ciudad D. la paz hasta la ciudad D. el alto para vender en su negocio aparte que tiene que ir a comprar hasta muy tarD. mercadería, su esposo es chofer propietario D. un radio taxi, los hijos que tiene la pareja ya son mayores y ya son independientes, el crédito será invertido en la compra D. mercadería.
texts.en: Amalia is a client who already took out three loans with the institution. The repayment of her loans went well and was punctual. She is a client with a good attituD.. She sells women's dress clothing including fine blouses, skirts and pants. The clothing she buys is new and of good quality. She gets her merchandise from one of the avenues which are very popular for selling wholesale and inexpensive clothes. Her business is located in a gallery in la Ceja del Alto. She has to make sacrifices for her business because she has to come from the city of La Paz to the city of El Alto to sell her merchandise. AsiD. from that, she can't go buy the merchandise until very late. Her husband is the owner and driver of a Radio Taxi. The couple's children are older and already independent. The loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise.

loans.use: Investment in the purchase of jackets and blouses by the dozen.

loans.name: Aurora Maria

texts.es: Aurora C. confeccionista D. ajuares para bebe,  es una mujer sumamente delicada en su trabajo, el cual inició en Ciénaga, Municipio del  departamento del Magdalena,  cuando por vocación fabricó vestidos para muñecas desD. muy pequeña y con el pasar del tiempo ha ido perfeccionando el arte, con estudios especialmente en lo relacionado con diseño D. modas y confección.  Aurora tiene 62 años y vive en el barrio las Palmas D. Barranquilla, es madre D. 4 hijos en las edades D. 38 a 46 años D. edad  y su desempeño en este oficio ha sido tan bueno que lo ha convertido  en su negocio, con el cual ha generado las principales fuentes D. ingreso para su hogar. DesD. el año 1998 está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que ha logrado un crecimiento personal y empresarial,  porque ha aprovechado todo lo que le ofrece, así ha recibido seis financiamientos, se ha capacitado y ha cambiado su visión D. negocio.Su credikiva es su septimo financiamiento, con él comprará en encajes, velo, guata, hilo, cinta y aplicaciones varias. Aurora en el año 1991 tenia 63 empleados y quiere nuevamente llevar a su negocio en ese mismo sentido, por eso diariamente se esmera por darle un enfoque muy empresarial, para cumplir este su gran sueño.   Su negocio se torna próspero, tiene clientes fijos  todo el año, sus productos circulan en el centro, una zona muy comercial en Barranquilla, posee una rotación D. cuentas por cobrar D. 26 días , mientras su rentabilidad sobre las ventas es del  53%, su endeudamiento es del 30%, tiene una capacidad D. pago del 70% y su liquidez es del 2.3%. Aurora es una mujer feliz goza del cariño D. sus hijos y nietos con quien sostiene excelentes relaciones.
texts.en: Aurora C. makes layettes for babies.  She is very dedicated to her work -work that she began in Ciénaga, a town in Magdalena Department. From the time she was very young, she used to make dresses for dolls and as she got older, she perfected the art.  She took courses that were related to fashion design and dressmaking.  Aurora is 62 and lives in Las Palmas D. Barranquilla neighborhood.  She is the mother of 4, ages 38-46, and the result of her performance in the traD. has been so good that it became a business.  It has generated the main source of income for her family.  Since 1998 she has worked with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization that has helped her grow personally and business-wise because she has taken advantage of everything they offer.  She has received 6 loans.  She has received training in the business and changed her vision of what the business is capable of doing.  The Kivacredit is her 7th loan, and she will use it to buy lace, tulle, padding, thread, tape and other items.  In 1991 Aurora had 63 workers and she would like to take her business to this level again.  That is why she strives to give it an enterpreneurial focus every day so as to fulfill her dream.  Her business is prosperous and she has regular customers all year.  Her products are sold in the center, a very commercial zone of Barranquilla.  She has day sales outstanding of 26 days, while her gross profit on the sales is 53%, her debt is 30%, she has an ability to pay up to 70%, and her liquid assets are 2.3%.  Aurora is a happy woman who enjoys the love of her children and grandchildren with whom she has excellent relations.

loans.use: To buy lace, tulle, padding, thread, tape and other items

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina tiene 51 años, nació en el distrito de Chincheros provincia de Cusco y actualmente vive junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos en el distrito de Wanchaq provincia del Cusco.

Cristina se dedica a la venta artesanía; joyería, platería, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en el centro artesanal del Cusco. Ya son 30 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va excelente gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo. Con su próximo préstamo, Cristina que espera recibir de $ 300 USD  y desea aumentar artesania y comprar materiales como plata piña, plata, perlas y otras cosas más. 

Cristina pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal está empezando una nueva etapa y estará bien administrado por la antigua junta directiva.
texts.en:
Cristina is 51 years old.  She was born in Chincheros district, in Cusco province and she currently lives with her husband and three children in Wanchaq district, in Cusco province.

Cristina's business is selling handicrafts: jewelry and silverwork.  She has a small sales stall in Cusco craft center.  She has been in this business for 30 years and it is going very well indeed thanks to the hard work that she puts in.  Cristina hopes to receive $300USD in her next loan.  She would like to increase her crafts business and buy material such as pure silver, silver, pearls, etc.

Cristina is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "El Templo del Inca" (The Incan Temple) community bank.  The community bank is starting a new stage and will be well run by its former board of directors.

loans.use: To buy materials such as pure silver, silver, pearls, etc.

loans.name: Unidos Al Futuro Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Unidos al Futuro está conformada por 8 personas muy unidas y trabajadoras Sabina es una D. las integrantes D. este grupo ella tiene 53 años D. edad se dedica a su pequeña bodega desD. hace 10 años, en el cual venD. abarrotes  como son: arroz azúcar, fideos, aceite y algunos productos más que sus clientes requieren para su consumo, también venD. pollo verduras y gaseosas. Ella tiene este negocio en su casa las paredes son D.  material metálico (kiosco) por eso trabaja mucho para poder terminar D. construir su casa con la ayuda D. su esposo. Ella solicitó el préstamo a EDAPROSPO para comprar una vitrina para sus productos y más mercadería (arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite) al por mayor ya que esto le permite ahorrar y tener un poco mas D. ganancias. Con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo logró mejorar el ambiente D. su negocio ya que antes solo era D. estera.
texts.en: La Alcancía Unidos al Futuro has eight members, all of them fast friends and very hardworking. Sabina is one of the members of the group. She is 53 years old and has had her small shop for 10 years, selling groceries like rice, sugar, noodles, oil, and other products to meet her customers' needs. She also sells chicken, produce, and soft drinks. She runs the business out of her house. The walls are maD. of sheet metal, and she's working hard to be able to finish building her house with her husband's help. She requested this loan for EDAPROSPO to buy a display counter for her products and other goods (rice, sugar, noodles, oil) that she sells in bulk for a little extra income. With a lot of hard work she was able to improve her store, which used to be built of straw.

loans.use: Buy a display counter and merchandise (rice, sugar, noodles, oil) for her store

loans.name: Sol

texts.en:
Sol A. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 29 years old. Sol is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Sol owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing habal-habal (modified motorcycle) transit services to local community members. Sol has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Sol joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sol has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Sol is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle service. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Sol from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed for the maintenance of motorcycle for service

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian lives in the municipality of Medellin, Cebu.  She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  fishing and fish vending.  Her common-law husband  Necanoro, who is 41 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living.  She has seven children who are 9 months to 14 years old.  Vivian joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Vivian has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy fishing gear and equipment so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Vivian is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Hugo; El socio tiene 36 años de edad, el socio  es soltero; el socio tiene 3 hijos; (12,10,1 año y 8 meses) de edad, el socio tiene como principal actividad la agricultura, a esto el socio a decidido trabajar desde el 2008 en transporte turístico, debido a que Chinchero es una zona altamente visitada por turistas de todas partes del mundo, el socio ha hecho mucho esfuerzo para poder obtener su unidad vehicular y sacar su licencia para conducir en el servicio turístico y brindar transporte, el socio también se ha integrado a la empresa de transportes Sayhua tours que recoge turistas desde Cusco y todo el valle sagrado. El socio apoya a su conyugue en la elaboración y producción de la artesanía, el socio en esta ocasión nos comenta que él quiere hacerle el mantenimiento respectivo a su vehículo y venderlo, el requiere este crédito para poder aumentar al capital que genere la venta de su vehículo. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar un nuevo carro.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Hugo is a member of the "Nueva Victoria - Chinchero" community bank which is located in Chinchero district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Hugo is 36 years old, single, and has three children aged 12, 10, 1 and 8 months.  His main business activity is farming.  In 2008 he decided to start work transporting tourists since Chinchero is an area that receives a lot of tourists from all parts of the world.  Hugo worked hard to afford his vehicle and obtain his license to drive and provide tourist transport services.  He is a part of the Sayhua Tours transport company that transports tourists from Cusco and the whole 'Valle Sagrado' (Sacred Valley).  Hugo also supports his wife in making and producing handicrafts.

On this occasion, Hugo tells us that he would like to have some maintenance work done on his vehicle and sell it.  He needs this loan to increase the capital that he will make from the sale of his vehicle.  He is requesting this loan to buy a new car.

Hugo is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy a new car

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen A. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members.  Maureen has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Maureen sells her products at the market.    Maureen has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more baskets of tomatoes, cabbage and onions   She also generates additional income through a motorcycle for hire    .

The main business challenges for Maureen include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also to buy her own land.   Maureen lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and medication.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of tomatoes, onions and cabbages

loans.name: Liliana Rosana

texts.es: Liliana tiene 33 años de edad y es soltera. Vive en casa de sus padres ancianos en el distrito de Pimentel, unos veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque.  Su comunidad cuenta con servicios básicos de agua, luz y un proyecto de alcantarillado. Liliana cuenta con un negocio en el cual se dedica a la venta de verdura en variedad. Cuenta con su puesto propio en el mercado Los Pathos. Tiene más de 8 años de experiencia en el  rubro. Actualmente, su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado. Desea hacer unas mejoras en su domicilio para mejorar la condición de vida de sus padres que tienen edades avanzadas. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Este crédito le permitirá seguir trabajando tranquilo sin tener que recurrir a prestamistas informales que le cobrarían tasas altísimas, lo cual perjudica su liquidez diaria y retrasa su crecimiento tanto comercial como familiar. Liliana cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Es muy trabajadora y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres.
texts.en:
Liliana, 33, is single living with her elderly parents in Pimentel District about 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region’s capital.  Her community has basic services: water, electricity and sewage.

Liliana has a business selling assorted vegetables.  She has a stand of her own at the Los Pathos Market.  He has over 8 years experience in this line of work.

Currently, her house is in poor shape.  She wants to undertake some home improvements to improve her parents’, who are advanced in age, living conditions.  Because of this she felt it convenient to request a 1500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  The loan will make it possible for her to continue working in peace without having to call upon informal lenders that charge extremely high interest rates which damages her daily profits and slows down both her personal and commercial growth.  Liliana has good personal and work references.  She is very hard working and responsible.  Her greatest wish is to offer her parents a better quality of life.

loans.use: to do some home repairs.

loans.name: Wulamatu

texts.en: This is 31-year-old Wulamatu S., a single woman with one dependent, her elder sister’s son. Wulamatu, who is very determined to conscientiously improve her business, has been selling bags for the past two years, working seven days a week for ten hours each day. She is now requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000 to buy a large quantity of various bags for her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a variety of bags for her business

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 24 years old and married with one child. She practices both dairy and pig farming to earn a living. She was previously employed as a counselor before she went into business. She has sustained her business for one year and she is looking forward to having more cows and pigs in the future. She has requested a first loan of 20,000 Kes which she will use to buy chickens to raise on her farm.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Makindye Development Group

texts.en:
Seguya is 45 and the happily married mother of five buoyant and high-spirited kids who all go to schools in and around Kampala. For the last five years, she has run a used clothing business in the biggest market in Kampala. Seguya says she has been able to provide for her family with earnings from this business. As anyone in Kampala would testify, business in this boisterous market is good and the market is highly popular with all communities in Kampala. In addition, other people from Uganda frequently visit it to buy the cheap second-hand commodities that are sold there. 

Seguya began her business under the financial auspices of her brother and she currently generates a monthly profit of 700,000 UGX. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bales of used clothing to sell. This is a group loan, and one of the clients, named Aisha, is partly obscured in this photo and another client, named Moses, is not pictured. Seguya, who is the lead client of this group, is in the front row wearing a red t-shirt.

loans.use: to purchase bales of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es:
Asunción padre de familia de 30 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su hijo en casa de unos familiares; cuenta con solo el servicio de luz, ubicada  en la zona rural del distrito de José Leonardo Ortíz, que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Los pobladores de éste distrito se dedican al comercio al por mayor y menor de productos y agricultura.

Desde  algunos años Asunción se dedica a manejar su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas), actividad que realiza en su mismo distrito llevando personas a diferentes destinos, cuenta con algunos clientes fijos, a pesar de la competencia que existe, trata en lo posible de movilizar la mayor cantidad de pasajeros, con los ingresos que deja su actividad trata de solventar sus obligaciones familiares.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 2000 nuevos soles y su destino será para brindar mantenimiento a su unidad móvil y pueda seguir brindando un buen servico, pero también lo utilizará para cubrir algunos gastos personales.  Asunción es un hombre muy respetado y conocido en la zona donde vive  por ser trabajador, responsable y buen padre, con el único fin de que a su familia no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Asunción is a 30-year-old father living with his wife and son in a house belonging to relatives that only has electricity located in the rural part of José Leonardo Ortíz District belonging to Chiclayo Province.  Residents of the district are retail and wholesale merchants of products and are farmers.

For a few years now Asunción has been a mototaxi driver (mode of transportation used to go short distances with a maximum of three passengers) in his own district taking people to various destinations. He has a few regular customers despite existing competition.  He tries his best to transport the largest number of passengers and uses income generated by this activity to try to cover family obligations.

The loan he’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for is for 2000 new soles and it will be used to service the mototaxi in order to continue to offer good service but he’ll also use it to cover some personal expenses.  Asunción is a much respected, well known man in his local area for being hard working, responsible and a good father whose only aim is that his family have everything they need.

loans.use: to service his mototaxi and covers a few personal expenses.

loans.name: Paola Mariela

texts.es: El señora Paola dedicada a la confección de polleras se dedica a esta actividad hace varios años atrás durante este tiempo fue recibiendo buena aceptación por los clientes este crédito ayudara mucho a la señora para poder surgir en este rubro que le apasiona tanto "vestir a la gente", Con el dinero del crédito comprara telas e hilos para la confección de polleras ya que se acerca la fiesta de su zona y le hicieron pedido, es una persona muy trabajadora siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia. con muchas ganas de superación agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Paola works designing and making skirts.  She has done this for several years and during this time she made clients that were satisfied with her services, this loan will help her get ahead in this business where she has a "passion for dressing people", with the money from the loan she will buy fabric and threads to make skirts because party season is approaching and she has an order to fill, she is a very hardworking person that always thinks about the well-being of her family.  She hopes to improve and is thankful with the institution for the support given to her.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread to make skirts

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 52 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase more stock to sell.
Nelia has borrowed and paid back 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 30 years and also earns an income from sugarcane farming. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is a farmer from Nkubu town in eastern Kenya where she has been farming for 17 years now. Her farm produces milk, cabbages, potatoes and tea, which she sells to the local market and a local tea factory, respectively. She is aged 39 and married with 2 children who both attend school.

Florida has made a loan request of 25,000 KES to buy chickens and chicken feed in order to practice poultry farming. The extra income from this poultry project will be used to expand the poultry farm and improve her family's livelihood. She faces the challenges of the lack of a stable market and low market prices for her farm produce. She hopes that in the next 5 years, her poultry farm will have expanded and her income increased.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Sullay

texts.en:
Sullay, aged 34, is married, and has two children aged one and four. In 2007, Sullay established his motor spare parts business which includes tyres, brake pads, fan belts, batteries, windscreens, inner tubes, motor oil, etc. He began doing business when he was a small boy for his mother. When he became mature, he started his own business. 

Sullay has a special interest in business because the income he gets from this business is used to provide his family's livelihood.  It is from his business proceeds that he has bought a car and two pieces of land. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of SLL 3,000,000. Sullay requires a loan in order to buy 10 lift pumps, 50 oil filters, 50 universal joints and 10 brake kits. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000. 

In the future, Sullay plans to construct a house on his land from the proceeds of the business. By adding to his present capital, he will be able to maximize profits and send his first child to a nursery school in this coming academic year.  Increase in the cost of stock is affecting his business and competition is also high but he offers quality products so he gains more customers.  

Sullay serves all the vehicle owners and drivers of this community.  He travels twice per month to Guinea to purchase reasonable and quality goods. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for motor spare parts including lift pumps, oil filters, universal joints and brake kits

loans.name: Jacqueline Roxana

texts.es: La Sra. Jacqueline,  tiene como actividad la venta de regalos y vajilla,  actividad que realiza durante la semana  preparando y empaquetando sus regalos para su posterior venta, La mencionada actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella y su familia, el esposo trabaja  en el rubro de la construcción, juntos trabajan por el bienestar de su familia puesto que tienen 3 hijos, el destino del crédito es para la compra de mercadería y la compra de una batería electrónica para su esposo quien en su tiempo libre se dedica a la música, de esta actividad tambien tiene un ingreso extra que ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Es una persona muy trabajadora y se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Jacqueline sells gifts and tableware. She does this during the week, preparing the gifts to be sold. This activity is the main source of income for her her and her family. Her husband works in construction. Together they work for their family's wellbeing, since they have 3 children. The loan will be used to buy merchandise and an electric drum set for her husband, who is a musician in his free time. He also makes extra income with this activity to help with household expenses. She is a very hardworking woman and is grateful for the support that has been offered.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 53 years old.  She is married and has four children in school.  She sells second-hand clothes to earn a living for her family.  She started this  business four years ago.  She also owns rental houses and runs a taxi business to earn extra income.

Eunice hopes to grow her clothes business into wholesale in the future so that she can generate more income so as to provide for her children a better education. She has requested a loan for 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy second-hand clothes.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
La señora Marcela tiene la edad de 54 años, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudio, es viuda y tiene 9 hijos los cuales ya estan casados, ella vive  en una  comunidad  que se caracteriza por ser una zona cañera. 

Doña Marcela nos platica que desde hace 5 años quizo iniciar su negocio de Abarrotes para sacar adelante a sus hijos pero ahora quiere seguir con su negocio para que pueda tener una buena calidad de vida y no le falte nada en su hogar.

Ella tiene su tienda  de abarrotes en su casa, todos los dias abre desde muy temprano,  para que lleguen sus clientes y vecinos ha hacerle el gastos, ella nos comenta que busca tener bien surtido su negocio para que sus clientes siempre encuenten lo que busquen y asi su negocio tenga mas clientela 

Doña Marcela necesita este credito para la compra de dulces, galletas, aceite, mantequilla, productos enlatados, leche, refrescos, jugos, pan, frijoles, azucar, arroz, jabon en polvo, cloro, detergentes, jabon para bañarse y cereales para posteriormente venderlos en su negocio.

Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere y tambien se encuentra muy contenta con la fundacion por la confianza que le dio.
texts.en:
Marcela, 54, did not have the opportunity to go to school.  She’s a widow and has nine children who are already married.  She lives in a community in a sugarcane growing area.

Marcela tells us that for the last 5 years she’s wanted to open a grocery store to support her children but she now wants to continue with it to have a good quality of life and so that her home won’t lack anything.

Her store is located in her home.  She opens very early every day so that her customers and neighbors can come by to shop.  She comments that she tries to have a good selection available so that her customers will always find what they are looking for and her store will have more customers.

Marcela needs the loan to buy candy, cookies, oil, butter, canned goods, milk, soft-drinks, juice, bread, beans, sugar, powdered detergent, chlorine bleach, detergents, bath soap and cereal to sell in her store.  She hopes her business will prosper with this investment and she’s also happy with the Fundación for the trust it placed in her.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Tercero

texts.es:
Tercero tiene 41 años es casado y tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en Salcedo a 20 minutos de Latacunga en el centro de Ecuador. Tercero se considera una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora.

Trabaja con su esposa e hijos en la crianza de animales (ganado). Es la primera vez que le solicita crèditos a Fodemi, el mismo que serà utilizado para la compra de vacas lecheras, lo cual le ayudarà a incrementar sus ventas de leche y mejorarà sus ingresos.

Su sueño es incrementar sus ventas y que su familia tenga una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Tercero is 41 years old. He is married and has 3 children. He lives with his family in Salcedo, 20 minutes from Latacunga in central Ecuador. Tercero is considered to be a very hardworking person and a fighter. 

He works with his wife and children raising animals (cattle). This is the first time that he has asked for a loan from Fodemi. It will be used to buy dairy cows, which will help to increase his milk sales and improve his income.

His dream is to increase his sales and for his family to have a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris is a determined business man, aged 28. He is married and blessed with one child, nine-months old. 

For the last three years, Morris has been managing a pharmacy to make a living. He is also employed as a clinical officer. He testifies that, through Faulu Kenya, he has increased his inventory with his previous loans hence improving his sales. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting for a loan of 98,000 Kenya shillings to buy medicine.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en: Felipe is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. Felipe is making and peddling snacks like siopao (steamed bun with meat filling). He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. Felipe has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Felipe hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is 33 years old and married with four children. She has other dependents that she looks after and she lives with six people in her own home. Her family goal is to provide for her family needs. She has a business of used clothes, which she has been running for seven years and she strongly believes her business will grow in the future. She is requesting a loan to buy more used clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy used clothes to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 25 years old and single.  To earn a living, he runs a grocery.  He has been in the business for two years.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and has also learned how to save his money. Peter hopes to expand his business.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy tomatoes, potatoes, and onions.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes, and onions

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 32-year-old single woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase accessories for trading purposes. Manal is looking to develop her business and increase her income.
Due to cultural reasons, the photograph shows Manal's brother instead of Manal.

loans.use: to purchase accessories for trading purposes.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Mabinty. She is married to a contractor, and has 3 children, ages 14, 11 and 3 years all going to school. 

In 2000, Mabinty established her textiles and rubber slippers business. She began her business after she left school when she got in an accident. She did not have anyone to help her further her education. She decided to join her aunt in business. It is the only thing she can earn money for and it is one thing she knows best. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,049,000 SLL every month from this business. She is only assisted by a family member. Her suppliers are located in Conakry and Freetown. She usually travels to Conakry twice a month and to Freetown whenever she has shortages in stock.

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Mabinty has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase 1 bale of English Wax Cotton @ 5,000,000 SLL. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 263,000 SLL. The loans will help her greatly if she is given the chance to access them.

In the future, Mabinty plans to open a larger outlet with different types of textiles and footwear. It is good because it will help her make a positive turn in her business. She is very excited with her business. She wants to educate her children to a higher standard. Mabinty's major challenges are the rainy season and inflation in foreign currency, but she goes for quality products with prices that can be afforded by her customers. Mabinty uses part of her profit to add onto her operating capital and the rest she sets aside for any domestic problems. She is hardworking and honest. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase 1 bale of English Wax Cotton @ 5,000,000 SLL

loans.name: Poy

texts.en:
