Poy is 29 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Krong Siem Reap and cultivates rice crops. She also makes bamboo baskets, earning a profit of $5.00 a day. Poy’s husband is a construction worker who often moves from place to place with his team. 

Poy is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for her husband to use to travel to his workplace. Her future goal is to own a general store in a local market.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for her husband.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS ORQUIDEAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; ella tiene 25 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende polos, chompas, pantalones, casacas y blusas, ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pantalones, casacas, blusas y pantalones al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Señora Luz Marina is a member of the communal bank "Las Orquideas".  The bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco. 

She is 25 years old, lives with her partner and has 5 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her clothing business.  She sells shirts, sweaters, pants, jackets and blouses.  She sells in an itinerant manner from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm.  Her dream is to expand her clothing-sales business.  She is requesting a loan to buy pants, jackets and blouses wholesale.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: purchase pants, jackets and blouses wholesale.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Matola, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, solteira e mae de 2 filhos ainda sem idade para Escola. Fez 6ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e naõ sustenta mais ninguem.

É trabalhadora de uma empresa de segurança ha mais de 7 anos e o seu salario é 3.500.00mt por mês e aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a sua casa (cimento, barrotes, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. O emprestimo anterior foi de 10.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e mobilar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Eugenia was born in Matola city, which is in Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is single and has two children who are not old enough for school yet. Eugenia finished sixth grade and did not continue because she could not afford it. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She has worked at a security company for more than seven years, and her salary is 3,500 meticais per month. She uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (at BIM).

Eugenia has never had loans from other banks, and she learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Eugenia's second Hluvuku loan. She is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy construction materials (cement, beams, sand and other items) so she can continue construction work on her house. The earlier loan was for 10,000 meticais and was for the same purpose.

Eugenia promises to make her payments on time. She wants to finish her house and furnish it one day, and to do that she intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy construction material (cement, beams, sand, etc.).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wooden doors and to have iron gates made in order to make his house safer.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a married man with one daughter who is 1 year old.  He describes himself as hardworking. Josphat operates a retail store where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for five years. Josphat’s business is located in a strategic area and his primary customers are the area residents. His biggest business challenge is insufficient funding. 

Josphat will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy more milk to sell.  His business goal is to begin selling charcoal within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Zaitun

texts.en: Zaitun is single . She operates a food stall at the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for 2 years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy box of tomatoes,green peper,onions.  She works seven days a week.  She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to buy iron sheets to roof he She resides in a rented house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and food.

loans.use: To buy box of tomatoes,green peper,onions.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, 27, is a charismatic, hardworking woman who has always enjoyed working independently, managing her time and being on her mixed farm. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years and has gained a lot of experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and a variety of crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and have extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. 

The Eldoret area is very populated and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and stated that the most enjoyable part of poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Susan's biggest challenge is meeting the very high demand. She lacks funds to expand her poultry farming, and is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. 

Accessing funds is very challenging for a woman, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, Susan feels relieved knowing that she will be able to buy more poultry and achieve her dream. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profits and an improved income level. 

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profit and expand her poultry market to other markets, increasing her income and allowing her to improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and securing the future of her school-going children.

This loan will help Susan in her poultry business and in her personal life. This is a great opportunity for her family. Please select this loan now.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
I have had a clothing shop in the Municipal Market of Danli for 15 years.  I am the head of my family and the shop has always been my business.

The clothing I sell is used clothing from the United States.  I buy the clothes in bulk and then sell it in my little shop.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for sale

loans.name: Jesús Martín

texts.en:
Jesus Martin D. Leon Lopez is single and has no children. He has a snack shop where two people work. This business started as a result of a business transfer. For a long time he had searched for financial independence since he had always been working for someone else's company. His effort, dedication and enthusiasm have led him to achieve what he has today, and each day he works harder to grow.

Now Jesus needs a loan for $USD925 to invest in products for his establishment. All Jesus needs to move forward is your support. Don't think about it anymore. Today for him, tomorrow for you. Make it happen.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Jesús Martín D. L. L. es soltero, no tiene hijos. El tiene un snack como negocio, en el cual laboran dos personas. Este negocio lo inicio por medio D. un traspaso, pues durante mucho tiempo había buscado la autonomía económica, ya que siempre había laborado para alguna empresa. Su esfuerzo, dedicación y entusiasmo lo han llevado a lograr lo que hasta ahora tiene, y cada día trabaja mas para crecer.

Ahora el señor Jesús necesita un préstamo D. 925 DLLs, éstos los invertirá en la compra D. productos para su establecimiento. Para que Jesús siga adelante sólo basta con que lo apoyes, no lo pienses tanto. Hoy por el, mañana por ti. Hazlo posible.

loans.use: purchase mercandise

loans.name: Zénabou

texts.en:
Married with one child, Mrs. Zénabou started this business one year ago. She counts on introducing a new product in her business of wood charcoal, because according to her, wood charcoal is safer for children and family members in poor areas like ours. This wood charcoal is made in an environmentally-friendly manner, and is sought out for its economic savings, which helps establish an equal footing among citizens. With her business, Mrs. Zénabou must wait for a beneficiary two times more than the one before.

The total of her loan of $100 will go to the buying of firewood.

Mrs. Zénabou is part of a HELP Africa solidarity group of six women called “Second Association,” which has collectively applied for a loan of $600. Each member of the group will receive a part of this loan and will be responsible for helping their fellow group members if they are delinquent or default.

loans.use: Increase business activities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Start a Chicken Rearing Business

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en: Ramatu Lailah is eighteen years old and is married with a child.  She runs a business selling sandals, sauce pans and others small items in the market in Kabala, Sierra Leone.  Ramatu’s husband Jabari assists her in running the business.  Both are committed to prepare a secure future for their children.  Ramatu said that she used part of the profit generated from her previous loan to buy a cow so that the family can have milk for the family and to sell.  She plans to buy more cows in the future.  To enable her to do that, she is requesting a loan of $250 to expand her current business.

loans.use: to increase hermarket stall inventory

loans.name: Sit

texts.en: Mrs. Sit S., age 41, works with her husband as a broker to buy and sell rubber, together earning about $3.25 per day in profits. They have two children who are students. In order to increase her supply of rubber, she would like to request a loan of $400 to purchase an additional stock of rubber from a plantation to sell to the wholesalers. Increasing her inventory will raise revenue and thereby increase the income used to support her children’s education and family's welfare.

loans.use: To purchase rubber for resale

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru:
Suhrob B., 22, is married. He owns a photo studio that provides a variety of services to the residents of Kurgan-Tube. At present, to print his photo orders, Suhrob must travel to Dushanbe located 80 km from Kurgan-Tube. Suhrob plans to use this loan to purchase photo processing equipment. Having all the needed equipment at his studio, Suhrob will be able to reduce photo processing time and expenses and pass on the savings to the residents of Kurgan-Tube. Suhrob also hopes that by offering better service, he will be able to acquire new clients. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Беков Сухроб, возраст – 22 лет, образование среднее, женат. Беков Сухроб занимается оказанием услуг фотопечати населению города Курган-Тюбе, а именно делает фотографии различных размеров на официальные документы и фото на память по заказу клиентов. В настоящее время Сухробу чтобы распечатать фотографии небходимо ездить в город Душанбе, который находится в 80 км от Курган-Тюбе, так как в его городе это будет стоить намного больше, что соотвественно увеличивает его расходы и заставляет клиентов ждать свои заказы некоторые время. Сухроб на полученный кредит хочет приобрести необходимое оборудование для печати фотографий. Сухроб приобретя такое оборудования будет иметь возможность улучшить качество обслуживание клиентов: во-первых снизится цена за фото, во-вторых, печать фоторграфий будет делаться в короткие сроки, в-третьих – он планирует увеличить количество обслуживание клиентов, что позволит ему расширить свой бизнес. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase new photo processing equipment

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Señora Estela is a member of the Santa Ana Communal Bank. She lives in the region of San Martín in the province and district of Moyobamba. Her business is located in the wholesale foods market in her city. She makes a living by selling cured beef, chorizo (a pork sausage), chicarrón (another type of sausage), and their derivatives. For 35 years, she has been known for offering a very high-quality product, which has let her earn a good clientele.

With this loan of 2,500 nuevos soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy live pigs to be sacrificed, processed, and made into dry meat and sausages to serve as inputs for the preparation of typical dishes of the region.

Señora Estela is 62-years-old. She has a husband and 5 children who are all independent, and who are her principal source of help in her business. She likes the work that she does and hopes to continue doing it because it supports her and lets her live peacefully.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Estela es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Ana, vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Moyobamba. Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad, se dedica a la venta de cecina, chorizo, chicharrón y sus derivados. Desde hace 35 años es muy conocida por brindar un producto de muy buena calidad, lo que le ha servido para ganarse una buena clientela.

Con el préstamo de S/.2,500.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará cerdos vivos para ser sacrificados, procesados y convertirlos en carne seca y embutidos y servir de insumos para la preparación de platos típicos de la región.

La señora Estela tiene 62 años, esposo y 5 hijos, todos ellos independientes y son su principal ayuda en el negocio. Le gusta el trabajo que hace y desea continuar realizándolo porque le mantiene en actividad y le permite vivir con tranquilidad.

loans.use: Purchase of animals (pigs)

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana R. B. is an ambitious business woman in the jungle city of Bellavista, San Martin.  Juana has a store built into her home where she sells fish native to the region.  Her family also has a business raising these native fish in a pond they own outside of the city.

Juana is happily married and has three young children.  She works very hard and organizes her time wisely so she can care for her children, home, and business.  Her children are of the highest priority, it is very important that they have the opportunity to be who they would like to be.  She manages the family's money and saves for their future.  She loves her business because it lets her work from home where she can also spend time with her family.  

A member of the community bank Virgen de la Puerta, Juana is requesting a loan of  $1025 to repay over six months.  With the loan she would like to buy a variety of fish from the coast as well as dried fish to sell at her store.  One day Juana would like to have a store stocked with all types of fish and seafood.

loans.use: To buy a variety of fish

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phan Thi M., 25 years old, is living with her husband and her 4-year-old children in Hung Nguyen, Nghe An. She is the 4th member of TYM Fund. Her husband, Mr. Nguyen Van Sang, is a farmer. Besides working on the rice field, her main activity is breeding the cows and pigs. Every year she releases 3-4 litter of pigs and earns 500-600 USD. Her fund for breeding came from her family savings and borrowed money from TYM Fund. To repay the money weekly, she sells vegetables and dried food in the market. Mrs. M. thinks the weekly repayment method of TYM Fund is very suitable for her family. This time, she wants to borrow 950 USD to buy pigs, pig mash and cattle-feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Phan Thị Mỹ, 25 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 1 con trai 4 tuổi tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Chị là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương. Chồng chị, anh Nguyễn Văn Sáng, là một nông dân. Ngoài làm ruộng, công việc chính của chị Mỹ là chăn nuôi bò, lợn. Mỗi năm xuất chuồng 3-4 lứa lợn, mỗi lứa chị Mỹ thu 500-600USD. Nguồn vốn đầu tư cho chăn nuôi được lấy từ gia đình và vay của Quỹ Tình thương. Để có tiền trả tuần chị bán rau quả, hàng khô ngoài chợ. Chị Mỹ cảm thấy cơ chế hoàn trả của Quỹ rất thuận lợi với gia đình. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 950USD để mua lợn và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy pigs, pig mash and cattle-feed

loans.name: Jabiri

texts.en: Jabiri A. is a 30-year-old resident of Tabata in the Buguruni area. For six years, he has had a shop selling different food products. He is requesting a loan to purchase more food products to sell so he can expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Hauna's Esuvat Group

texts.en:
Hauna is a 27 year old woman divorced with 2 children, ages 10 and 8. Hauna is a caterer, which she began in 2005. Everyday she works from 5am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in catering, soap, clothing, grocery, and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance N. is 25 years old. She is married with 1 child. She owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood. Constance is very skillful and a talented hair dresser who adds a lot of beauty to the hair of her many customers, and that is her secret. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service; therefore, she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weaves, pomade, shampoo, activators, etc to avoid shortages and poor service. She is a member of the community group called Ezekiel Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products like weaves, pomade, shampoo, activators, etc

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng L., 55, is a widowed farmer who lives with one of her nieces in the Kampong Cham province. She typically makes US$2 each day and would like to increase her profits. The weather conditions have been difficult in Cambodia this past year and inflation has been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Heng L. included. She is asking for a loan of US$400 to purchase fertilizer for the farm, increasing her current profits and improving her prospects for the future.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cloth and other materials to keep running her activity.

loans.name: Naseem M. Zahid Group

texts.en:
Naseem Baji is the widow of M. Zahid and lives in a small city named Chichawatni, Pakistan. Her husband left her at the time when her daughters were young. Without any support, Naseem Baji worked hard and improved the education of her daughters. All of her daughters completed their education to the 10th standard.

She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She bought wood with her first loan. She cuts the wood into pieces and sells it in the community. She chose this profession because gas is not available in her area and people burn the wood for cooking. Now she is applying for a loan for the same business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Sajida Baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for hauling. Shabana Baji wants a loan to buy food (rice and cooking oil) for her food business. Sakina Baji and Hashmat Baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy woods to increase her profit

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi Q. is 51 years old. She has been with TYM since 2003. Her family lives in an area with mat weaving as a traditional job so besides farming and animal raising, they spend most of their remaining time on their mat-weaving business. As she is skilled and experienced in this business, her products sell well and bring about an increase in their income. With their income of VND 3 million plus financial assistance from her child, who has a stable job, her family's economy is getting stable and developing. For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow VND 8 million to buy rushes for her mat-weaving business.

loans.use: to buy rushes for her mat-weaving business

loans.name: Nirmala

texts.en: Mrs. Nirmala T. is a 25 year old tailor in the town of Balkhu in Kathmandu.  Three years ago, she started her tailoring business out of  in her house three years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like Kurta Sulwars, Blouses, long women’s dresses, Makhshis, and others. Before starting her business, Mrs T. took a yearlong training course in tailoring from a tailoring institute. She is requesting this loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring business. Mrs. T. lives with her husband Mr. Ranbahadur. Her husband left for Saudi-Arabia five year ago to earn money for the family. Now Mrs. T. lives with her mother.

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Erwt

texts.en: hgjmh

loans.use: wertwert

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday O. is 36 years old and married. He owns a shop where he sells provisions and repairs radios and televisions. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. 

He is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Central B2- Safina Group

texts.en:
Safina N., 40, sells vegetables (cabbages, spinach, lettuce, etc.) and fruits (passion fruit, oranges, avocadoes, mangoes, etc.) in Kabalagala market. She purchases her supplies from Owino and Nakasero markets. From sales worth Ush 100,000, she earns a profit of Ush 30,000. Safina is using the loan to purchase Irish potatoes and tomatoes to add to her stock.

She is a hard-working single lady, devoted to her family of 3 children, 2 nephews, and 2 nieces. Her ambition is to source fruits, vegetables, and cereals from upcountry farmers and sell them to retailers in Kampala. She hopes that when the business does well, she will be able to educate her children. Her desire is to see her family prosper.

loans.use: purchasing Irish potatoes and tomatoes

loans.name: Sabohatkhon

texts.en:
Sabohatkhon M. is 24 years old. She is married and has a child. Since she was a young girl, Sabohatkhon used to help her mother with her clothing sales business. Four years ago, Sabohatkhon began selling towels and blankets, since her husband’s income as a taxi driver was not enough to cover their family expenses. That was how she got a taste of the business and was convinced that it left her sufficient revenue.

Currently, she works in this business full-time, and thanks to her enthusiasm, she has made a name for herself in the market. However, her clients request more and more things each day, which is why Sabohatkhon is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni, which she is willing to repay in a 10-month term. With this money, Sabohatkhon will be able to purchase more towels and blankets and thereby give her business a boost.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing towels and different kinds of blankets to increase the range of her goods

loans.name: Mawuena

texts.fr: Mawuena habite le quartier d’avédji, elle a pour activité la vente de produits pharmaceutiques, elle fait ce commerce de façon ambulante, elle le fait depuis 2006, elle veut agrandir son stock avec l’achat de produits pharmaceutiques, elle demande donc à wages un produit de 500000f. Elle est veuve avec un enfant, c’est avec le revenu de cette activité qu’elle subvient aux besoins de son enfant.
texts.en:
Mawuena lives in the Avédji district. Her work involves selling pharmaceutical products. She goes door-to-door in the course of her work, which she has been doing since 2006. She wants to expand her inventory by buying pharmaceuticals. And so she’s asking WAGES for a loan of 500,000 francs. Mawuena is a widow with a child. With the income from this business, she provides for her child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Revelyn

texts.en:
Revelyn ventures into hog raising business and it is situated in their house at Barangay Minante 2, Cauayan City.  Revelyn is already 28 years old. She is married to George S. a tricycle operator. They have three children namely; Angeline, 8 years old, and Emmalyn, 6 years old, both elementary students in their village and the youngest is Althea Mae S., 2 years old.  

Her primary business is hog raising but she also hopes to restart her defunct poultry business.  Due to lack of financial capital she was forced to stop her poultry operations then.  She then decided to borrow a loan of PHP5,000 to maintain her hog raising business since this is also her way of assisting her husband earn extra income for their family.  She is so brave in pursuing the business despite the price increase of commodities and some inputs nowadays believing that “hardship is not destroyed by a single failure or won by a single care, it’s a lifetime venture in which you are always learning.”

loans.use: Business maintenance

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Since 1999, Mary C. has been a fresh-fish trader in Elmina. She is married with four children and has received an education through primary school. Her husband is a fisherman and uses his ocean catch for Mary to sell.  Mary and her husband use their incomes to support their children and pay their school fees. Mary is requesting a loan to purchase necessary items needed to expand her business. She hopes to use her improved income to build a home for her family.

loans.use: To expand fish-selling business

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es socia del Bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes. 
Sabina es casada tiene 60 años, tres hijos que son mayores y están casados.
Sabina es de Iquitos llego con su familia  Lima a los 8 años, estudio enfermería la ejerció hasta que se jubilo hace dos años, a la par ella empezó a vender en su casa  bizcochitos, galletas así empezó poco a poco  hoy en día tiene una bodega-bazar.    
Sabina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de loceria, compra en las fábricas. 
Desde que esta en Finca, ha implementado más su negocio, su negocio ha crecido, aprendió a mantener su negocio, ha no gastarse el capital y seguir invirtiendo.  
El sueño de Sabina es buscar otro local para ampliar su negoció
texts.en:
Sabina is a member of the Virgen de las Mercedes community bank. Sabina is 60, married, and has three grown and married children. Sabina is from Iquitos. When she was 8, she and her family came to Lima. She studied to be a nurse, and she worked as a nurse until her retirement two years ago. At that time she started to sell cakes and cookies in her home. Now she has a store-bazaar. She needs a loan of 2000 PEN to buy crockery, which she would buy from the factories. Since she has been with Finca she has been able to better establish her store, and her business has grown. She learned to how to manage her business, to not waste money, and to keep investing. Sabina’s dream is to find another location to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy crockery from the factories.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa has been married for about 21 years to a farmer named Edwin, living happily in San Isidro, Quirino, Isabela  with their two children, Lorjie, 21 years old and a high school graduate, and Rhea May, 12, currently attending elementary school. Teresa hopes that they can provide the best future for their two children. With her hard working husband, she hopes to improve their living conditions and be able to continue sending their youngest child to school through to college.  
	
For almost 36 years, Teresita has been maintaining the farm that she inherited from her parents. She is now requesting a loan of PHP19, 000.00 in order to sustain their rice and tobacco farm which produces good yields twice a year. The loan will enable them to purchase more fertilizers and other necessary farm inputs.  Since their farm is the only source of income supporting their daily necessities, Teresa wants to make it more productive in order to provide a brighter future for her children.

loans.use: To sustain the rice field.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana P. is 31 years old. She is divorced and has given birth to two children, a male and a female. She says her children are in junior high and primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Juliana is a seamstress by profession. She doesn't have her own workshop and as a result, is currently working in her house. She says she has no apprentice for now. Juliana wants a loan to buy some working patterns and fabrics to sew more designs for sale. Juliana has been in business for four years. She is hoping to acquire her own workshop and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and sewing materials

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.en:
ClotilD. is married and has two children who are both in college, one in his first year and the other in his fourth. One of her sons also owns a business selling car alarms. The family is very close and they all support each other financially. 

ClotilD. owns a hamburger stand as well as a motorcycle wash. She has owned both of these businesses for over fifteen years. She has a well-formed clientele that comes from all around the neighborhood to eat and drink at her stand. She says that in the summer, business is the best, but even in the winter she has enough customers to get by. In the future she would like to make her stand bigger in order to serve a larger customer base.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie B. is a 34-year-old mother of two from Bunawan, Agusan del Sur. She helps her husband till their 2.5-hectare rice field. Jessie dreams of sending all her children to college. That is why she and her husband are doing everything they can to improve and hopefully double their yield. Jessie is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP from Kiva partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. This will help improve the couple's yield as well as their income.

About CEVI
CEVI continues to reach out to poor communities, encouraging people to start and run a business of their own. CEVI provides its clients with credit assistance, training and insurance cover.

loans.use: To purchase seven sacks of fertilizer and other farming supplies

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
L. Trương Thị (20203040030) is a 53-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  L. is the group leader of a 6-member group L. offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual L., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đồng Thôn 05 (5).


L. is married and has one adult child.  To make a living, L. owns & operates a business selling herbs & spices in the local community.  L. has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. is requesting for the first time a L. from SEDA. She is requesting a L. of 5.152.000 VND, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products.  The L. will be the first L. taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Trương Thị Vụ (20203040031) is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her service-based business.


2.  Ngô Thị L. (20203040032) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business raising livestock.


3.  Trương Thị Hạ (20203040033) is a 46-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business raising livestock.


4.  Nguyễn Thị P. (20203040034) is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business raising livestock.


5.  Trương Thị L. (20203040035) is a 54-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her specialized retail store.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


L. Trương Thị (20203040030) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ H.n hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đồng Thôn 05 (5).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thảo mộc & gia vị trong cộng đồng địa phương.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Trương Thị Vụ (20203040031) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


2.  Ngô Thị L. (20203040032) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Trương Thị Hạ (20203040033) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Nguyễn Thị P. (20203040034) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  Trương Thị L. (20203040035) là 54 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Zahanati Group

texts.en:
Joyce M. is a member of the Zahanati borrower group. She is a 30 year old woman as well as a single mother of two children ages 12 and 1. Joyce started her own business selling CDs five years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 200,000 Tsh.

This is Joyce's first loan from BRAC Tanzania, and she requested the amount of 200,000 in order to buy more CDs. With the additional profits she will gain from the use of this loan, Joyce hopes to save money and expand her business. Naomi, Flora, and Subira are other members of the borrower group, and they are also requesting 200,000 each for their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more CDs

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en la casa que heredó de sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de comida, desde su juventud ha vendido de manera ambulante platillos al paso, pero actualmente ya cuenta con su propio local donde ofrece desayunos, almuerzos y cenas. Sus principales clientes son los trabajadores de los diferentes talleres de mecánica automotriz que abundan alrededor de su establecimiento y conocen de la buena sazón de Felicita. Debido a las buenas ganancias que le proporciona su pequeño restaurante ha decidió continuar dedicándose a este rubro y mejorar la apariencia de su local. Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, Felicita tiene grandes deseos de seguir realizando un trabajo solidario con los demás integrantes de su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de utensilios para su establecimiento, asó como la renovación de su estante y sus mesas.

loans.use: Compra de utensilios y muebles para su negocio

loans.name: Sayun Group

texts.en:
Anna is a member of the Sayun borrower group in Sakina, Arusha. She is 28 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 14,12,10 and 4 years old. She also cares for other 4 dependents.

Anna has owned a food business selling vegetable and fruits for 10 years, she works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 300,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Anna`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 100,000Tsh in order to buy more vegetable and fruits  for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Anna hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Yohana is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the loan amount of 200,000Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetable

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda tiene 50 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y optimista, vive en su casa propia junto a sus tres hijas a quienes educa con amor y dedicación. Su taller de carpintería está ubicado a unas cuadras de su domicilio, lugar donde sus clientes están acostumbrados en visitar y pedir de sus servicios. Dedicarse a la carpintería fue una idea de su pareja, quien desde pequeño adquirió experiencia en el diseño de diversos trabajos en madera, luego al casarse con Nilda la contagió de esa pasión por la ebanistería. Es así que Nilda lo apoyó en la apertura del taller, compartiendo con él el trabajo pesado. Lo que a ella le gusta de este trabajo es compartir las actividades con toda su familia, pues cada miembro pone un granito de arena en el taller, sin embargo también debe dedicarles tiempo a sus pequeños hijos para evitar algunos accidentes en el taller. En el futuro desea adquirir maquinaria que le ayude a agilizar la fabricación de los muebles y con ello tener la capacidad de recepcionar los pedidos de nuevos clientes. 
Este es su primer crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y está dispuesta a ser cumplida con las cuotas de pago con el fin de seguir contando con un próximo préstamo. Nilda necesita tres mil soles para comprar algunas herramientas que le ayuden agilizar su producción de muebles.
texts.en:
Nilda is 50 years old and a hard working, optimistic woman. She lives in her own home with her three children, who she educates with love and dedication. Her carpentry shop, located a few blocks from her home, is the place where her customers have become accustomed to visit and solicit her services. Her then boyfriend, who began developing experience in woodworking as a child, introduced her to carpentry. They later married and she developed his passion for furniture making. Nilda began helping him run the shop and sharing the more difficult jobs. What she likes most about her work is that she is able to share the activities with her entire family, each member contributing "grain of sand" to the shop. Never-the-less, she must still dedicate some time to her young children in order to prevent accidents in the shop. In the future she hopes to acquire some machinery in order to speed up her furniture making, allowing her to accept orders from new customers. This will be her first loan through " Microfinanzas PRISMA" and she is determined to meet her repayment obligations, in order to be able to receive another loan in the future. Nilda needs "3,000 Soles" ($1,050 US) to buy some tools that will help speed up her furniture making.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools for furniture making

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov S. is 46 and lives with her husband and four of her children in Siem Reap province. Since 2000, she has been selling fish at the local market to earn a living. She is able to make about US$6 each day. Her husband works in construction, making US$4 each day, but want to begin fishing for extra income. The family is also supported by some of the children who work in private companies. Pov S. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a wooden boat with a motor, nets and other fishing tools for her husband.

loans.use: Buy boat and fishing tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing basic grains, meat, dairy products and other items needed by her customers

loans.name: Maria Milagros

texts.es: La señora Maria Milagros tiene 47 años de edad, es casada con dos hijos menores de edad. Maria tiene un negocio de elaboración de productos químicos, principalmente ambientadores, shampoo, cloros, etc. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 10 años, debido a que ella notó que todos los productos que se compran en nuestras casas en Nicaragua son productos generalmente exportados. A base de allí tomo la decisión de combinar productos químicos para ambientadores. En los últimos días la señora ha tenido unos pequeños problemas en cuanto a la oferta, es decir que hay mas ofertas de productos que lo que demanda la gente, sin embargo con una buena técnica de mercadeo ha logrado quedarse en el mercado. El crédito será invertido en la compra de  materiales químicos, para hacer más productos para este fin de año. Su meta es crecer de una manera abundante y si es posible empezar a tener vendedores que viajen a los departamentos a dejar su producto.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Milagros is 47 years old, married and has two minor children. Maria has a business making chemical products, principally air fresheners, shampoos, bleach, etc. She began this business 10 years ago, after she noticed that all of the household products that are bought in Nicaragua are imported. On this basis she decided to combine chemicals to make air fresheners. Recently, she has had some small problems with the supply, that is to say that there are more products on the market than the people demand, but with good marketing techniques she has managed to stay in the market. This loan will be invested in the purchase of chemicals, in order to make more products for the end of the year. Her goal is to grow abundantly and if possible, begin to have vendors who travel to the apartment buildings to distribute her products.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 35 años, está casada con el padre de su tres hijos, con quienes vive en su casa propia.
Su trabajo es de comisionista en el puente, la principal vía por donde circulan todos los carros urbanos en su localidad. Ella ingresa inter diariamente a su trabajo a las 7 de la mañana hasta 7 de la noche, con su chaleco de transito y su silbato en mano, siempre está al  pendiente de levantar la palanca para dar el paso de ingreso y salida de los vehículos cobrando el peaje. 
Por otro lado, los días que no trabaja allí, los dedica a sus cultivos de café y plátanos en compañía de su esposo. Dedicarse en sus cultivos le gusta mucho y el sueldo de su trabajo lo invierte en el incremento de sus cultivos.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete ante todos los integrantes de su grupo a pagar de forma puntual, ya que no quiere defraudar la confianza brindada. Con el dinero que solicita invertirá en la compra de plantas de café y abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Martha is 35 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She and her family live in their own home.

Martha works as a toll collector at a bridge on one of the main roads where cars from the city travel through her area. She works every day from 7am to 7pm, traffic vest and whistle in hand. As she is collecting tolls, Martha also controls the lift gate that regulates the entry and exit of vehicles. On the days she is not working, she helps her husband tend to their coffee and banana crops. They both enjoy farming and they invest Martha’s salary so they can increase their output.

This is her first loan with MFP. Martha has committed to the other group members that she will make her payments on time so as not to betray their trust. She will use the money to buy coffee plants and fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coffee plants & fertilizers

loans.name: 5622 Tuzamuranetwese Group

texts.en:
Rachel is 49 years old and married with seven children who are between the ages of 16 and 26. She lives in Gisenyi, a city at the border of Rwanda near the Democratic Republic of Congo. It is a three-hour drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Rachel is the leader of her group and her business sells drinks and refreshments to the local community. Rachel is a hard worker and her business is open from 7 in the morning to 10 in the evening every day of the week.

Rachel is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to purchase more supplies and beverages to sell. She has seven years of experience in this business and she employs one person from her community as a helper. Rachel plans to save any additional profits, so she can continue to pay school fees for her many children. She thanks Kiva lenders and VFC for their support.

loans.use: Purchase more supplies and beverages to sell

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en: Madelyn P. is 33 years old. She owns a small rice farm. She tills from early morning until sunset to ensure that she will have a bountiful harvest to provide for her family. She has five children. Her eldest child is 15 years old. She says that she still needs more money for her farm. She is hoping to receive a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to improve her crops.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Celinda

texts.es:
La Sra. Celinda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Jazmines”, Distrito D. Moyobamba, Provincia D. Moyobamba, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 62 años y es madre D. 06 hijos, 02 que aun dependen D. ella.
Celinda, se dedica a la venta D. menestras y lleva  varios años dedicándose al negocio, se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central D. su ciudad. Nos cuenta que desD. muy joven, le gusta trabajar, por lo que poco a poco, fue ahorrando y haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes, que hoy en día, son clientes fijos en su puesto. Nos cuenta que su negocio consiste en la venta D. especias como: Maní y maíz crudo, tostado y molido, harina D. plátano, para mazamorras, semillas D. shicashica (fruto selvático) rico en aceite natural, algunas verduras como: fréjoles secos, cacao con harina D. maíz.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, comprará: sacos D. cacao, maíz y maní, para luego preparar mantequilla D. maní, maíz amarillo, para la preparación D. chichas, fréjoles en kilos, racimos D. plátanos verdes,  para preparar harina D. plátano.
Celinda, se siente muy orgullosa con el trabajo que realiza, el buen producto que venD. le ha proporcionado clientela fiel que compra todos los días y es muy conocida en el mercado. Agradace al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por el apoyo incondicional a mujeres como ella.
texts.en:
Celinda is a member of "The Jasmines" Communal Bank in the District of Moyobamba, Moyobamba Province, in the Department of San Martín. She is 62 and married, and she is the mother of 6 children, two of whom are dependents. Celinda has been in the business of selling vegetable stews for some years. She works in the central market of the city. She tells us that she has enjoyed working since she was young. Little by little, she has been saving and becoming well known among her clients. Today, her clients are completely loyal to her. Celinda specializes in the sale of specialties including: raw, roasted and ground peanuts and corn; plantain flour for puddings; seeds of the wild shicashica fruit, which is rich in natural oils; and certain vegetables like dried beans and cocoa with corn flour. With this loan of $350, she will buy sacks of cocoa, corn and peanuts for peanut butter; yellow corn for making the chicha beverage; kilos of beans; and bunches of green plantains for making plantain flour. Celinda is very proud of the work she does. The quality product she offers has afforded her a faithful clientele who buy every day, and she is well known in the market. She thanks Kiva field partner Manuela Ramos for the unconditional help they give to women like herself.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for making vegetable stews.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina, de 23 años, es una hija muy conciente y madura, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es darles una vejez tranquila.

Ella se dedica a la venta de quesos de manera ambulatoria, lo hace yendo casa por casa en espera de que la gente le compre alguno de sus productos. Es una vendedora muy convincente, es por eso que ya tiene clientes ganados, los cuales siempre compran sus deliciosos quesos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y oír como sus clientes alaban su sabrosa mercadería, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día bajo el inclemente sol, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que realizarlo. 
Con el tiempo, espera tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus quesos con mayor tranquilidad.

Este es el quinto préstamo de Rufina con MFP y quiere pagarlo a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otro préstamo posteriormente. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa, que siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de sus compañeras. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más quesos, ya que últimamente está teniendo más demanda.
texts.en:
Rufina, 23, is a mature and aware daughter; she lives with her parents and her greatest wish is to provide them with a tranquil old-age. She sells cheeses door-to-door. She is a very convincing salesperson so she has several regular customers who always buy her delicious cheeses. What she likes most about her work is to go from place to place and hear how her products are praised by her customers. She has been in this line of work for two years and considers the most difficult part of it having to walk all day under the relentless sun. Even so, she knows that this is her work and she has to do it. In time, she would like to have a store from which to sell her products more comfortably. This is Rufina's 5th loan with MFP. She wants to repay on time because she wants to be able to have access to loans in the future. She is a very active member of her communal bank; she is always concerned for the well-being of her fellow members. She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy more cheeses because demand for them has increased lately.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheese.

loans.name: Leonora Narvasa Group

texts.en: Leonora N.'s main source of income comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. She is 38 years old, married and has three school-children. They are from the village of Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. Leonora has been in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 4,600 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2006, Leonora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family. Leonora is the leader of a four member group accessing a loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Niliver

texts.es:
Niliver, de 25 años, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, quienes son independiente y generan sus propios ingresos. Toda la familia vive junta en su casa propia.

Su negocio es la venta de bolsas a diversas tiendas, consigue su mercadería comprándole a las fábricas los sobrantes. De esta manera obtiene los ingresos necesarios para solventar los gastos de su hogar, aunque toda su familia también pone de su parte, como su esposa quien se dedica a la venta de productos por campaña. Niliver se siente contento con su trabajo y le gusta mucho realizarlo, aunque deba permanecer durante casi todo el día fuera de su hogar para entregar sus pedidos. Para el futuro, quiere tener una tienda de venta de CDs porque cree que este negocio le resultará muy rentable.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de todas sus cuotas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará una cantidad grande de bolsas para aumentar sus ventas e ir comprando los CDs para implementar su futuro negocio.
texts.en:
Niliver is 25 years old and lives with his wife and her three children who are all independent and earn their own living. The whole family lives together in a home they own. His business consists of selling bags to various shops; he gets his merchandise from the leftovers from factories. His job helps him to earn a living to cover his household expenses, though the rest of the family also puts forth their part. His wife also works a field saleswoman. Niliver is happy with his work and he enjoys doing it though he has to spent almost his entire day outside of his home to deliver his orders. In the future, he would like to have a store selling CDs because he believes it would be more profitable. This is his 4th loan from MFP and he has always been very punctual in his payments. With the loan, he will buy a larger quantity of bags to increase his sales and buy CDs for his future business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory and invest in new business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 30-year-old married man with one child. He has been running a retail shop for two years where he sells general merchandise such as household items and foodstuffs. He was previously selling secondhand clothes before he diversified to this business.

Daniel appreciates Faulu Kenya for the training they offer him and he has since acquired management skills. He hopes to grow his business to a wholesale operation and improve his standard of living.

Daniel has requested a loan of Kes 10,000 to buy two bags of sugar and two bags of flour to sell. He describes himself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy two bags of sugar and two bags of maize flour to sell

loans.name: Ionatana

texts.en:
Ionatana F. is 34 and single with no children.  She owns a business venture, selling puletasi (Samoan formal wear).  Ionatana has 3 years of experience in this business.  Ionatana needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  she plans to use the earnings from his business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Ionatana joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Ionatana's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Preciosa

texts.en:
Preciosa S. is from the village of Antipolo. She is 63 years old. Preciosa is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Preciosa operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Preciosa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Preciosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Preciosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets, livestock feed and other supplies. Preciosa is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Preciosa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr: B. Delphine est née en 1981 à Dangbo, dans le département de l'Ouémé au Bénin. Mariée à HINNOUHO Olivier, un menuisier, Delphine est mère de quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Delphine vit avec sa famille au quartier Avotrou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis cinq ans environs. Delphine n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Il y a près de quatre ans que Delphine exerce comme activité, la vente d'ustensiles de cuisine, de façon ambulante. De façon secondaire, Delphine vend des tissus. Ces deux activités génèrent à Delphine des revenus qui l'aident à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et à apporter ainsi une aide à son mari. Delphine achète ses articles à Lomé au Togo, et aussi à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Delphine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Dans l'optique d'agrandir davantage son activité et d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire, Delphine sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Delphine B. was born in 1981 in Dangbo, in the Ouémé province of Benin. She is married to Olivier Hinnhouho, a carpenter, and is the mother of four children, some of whom are in school. Delphine has been living with her family in the Ayotrou district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for about five years. Delphine never went to school. Since about four years ago she has been selling kitchen supplies as a street vendor. In addition, she also sells fabrics. The income from these business activities allow Delphine to help provide for her children and be a support for her husband. Delphine purchases her sotck in Lomé in Toga and also in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Delphine is an old client of ALIDé and had three earlier loans, all of which were properly repaid. With the view towards enlarging her business and increasing her profits, Delphine is seeking a new loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing kitchen supplies and fabrics [for resale]

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en: Fausta is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members. Fausta makes and weaves tablecloths and placemats. She wants to use this loan to buy more cloth and thread for making tablecloths. Fausta buys these materials from Kiyembe shops, one of the busiest places for clothing material in Kampala city.  She goes shopping twice a month and uses public transport to and from shopping. Fausta has been in this business for eight years and with MCDT for one and half years, servicing her third loan. Besides this weaving business, she also rears chickens at her home and owns a motorcycle for hire. She sells to all categories of people and makes her products according to one's fashion and style. She works seven days a week. Her business challenges are defaulters and transportation. She aspires to see her business grow big and start using machines instead of hand weaving. She joined MCDT because she wanted to increase her capital base. Fausta resides in and owns a house where the family stays and they have access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and thread

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “RENOVACIÓN”; Nuestra socia nació en la provincia de la Convención Quillabamba y vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Consuelo;  ella tiene 54 años de edad, la socia es soltera, Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de café snack, Nuestra socia tiene una pequeña cafetería snack en la universidad de bellas artes, situado a dos cuadras de la plaza principal de armas en la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos, insumos  y mercadería para su negocio. Ella vende sándwich de queso, jamón, carne, pollo, huevo, salchichas, empanadas, salteñas, leche, café, jugos y confites. 

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “RENOVACIÓN” ("Renewal") communal bank. She was born in the province of Convención Quillabamba, and she lives in the San Jerónimo district of the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Consuelo, and she is 54 years old and single. Her business is selling café-type snacks. She operates a small cafeteria at the University of Fine Arts, which is located two blocks from the main plaza of the city of Cusco. She is requesting the loan to buy products, supplies and merchandise for her business. She sells ham and cheese sandwiches, meat, chicken, eggs, sausages, empanadas, salteñas [another type of empanada], milk, coffee, juices and sweets. Consuelo values and appreciates the support provided to her in this way, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies for her café

loans.name: Altansuh

texts.en:
Altansuh C. is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of  Mongolia. He and his family live in their own apartment. His wife is currently unemployed and takes care of their two children.

Altansuh operates a shoe business in the city. He provides a wide variety of shoes to satisfy his customer's needs. He owns a stall in the market where he sells his products. Initially, Altansuh borrowed 200 USD with with a high interest rate to begin his shoe business. Working alongside his wife, they worked hard to quickly grow the business. 

Today his business operation is very stable. He has used his success to purchase a new home for his family. Altansuh is a modest, energetic and optimistic person. He says, “I had a serious car accident a few years ago, but I am happy to have overcome this terrible time in my life and create new success for myself. Now what I really want is to provide my children with favorable and safe living conditions." 

Altansuh is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a wide variety of summer shoes to sell at his business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok K., 43 years old, is married to Sokhom, age 28, and they currently have two school-aged children. This couple has been earning a living as requirement laborers who are also hired by people to harvest their mature fruits or to build their new houses. Sok K. is taking out her first loan to buy an old motorcycle that she and her husband can use to get to work without having to pay for a taxi.

loans.use: To purchase an old motorcycle

loans.name: Janine

texts.en:
Janine C. is from the village of Brgy. Almaguer South, Bambang,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 20 years old. Janine is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Janine owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a tricycle transport services. Janine has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Janine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase a new engine. Janine is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Janine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle to provide better service

loans.name: Djekafo I Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djekafo I est  constitués de dix femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne 42 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et  vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Dramanebougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KONIMBA T. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1, 5 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla  ou Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée de consommateurs et de commerçants. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 45.000FCFA environ en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The Djekafo I group is made up of 10 married women with an average age of 42, an average of 4 children, and they live for the most part in polygamous families in Dramanebougou, one of the villages in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region, the second administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their rainy season activities. They grow, among other crops, pearl millet, peanuts, and beans. They are on their third seasonal loan and all their previous loans have been repaid in full. With this new loan, Konimba T. plans on buying fertilizer, small farming equipment, and paying for the labor costs involved in maintaining approximately 1.5 hectares of pearl millet and peanuts. The harvested crops are sold in Dioïla and Massigui to a client base made up of consumers and shopkeepers. She hopes to make a profit of approximately 45,000 francs CFA by the end of the season.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, and small farming equipment

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana Carolina J. R., tiene 22 años.  Estado civil unión libre y vive con la compañera y los hijos,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos.  Tiene 2 hijos, Miguel (2) Y Anahi (4). 

Diana es un socia de la ventanilla rural “San Jose de los Amarillos”, que está ubicada en el Recinto de los Amarillos a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Diana se dedica al negocio, tiene un restaurante en la ciudad. Realiza sus compras cada semana en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en restaurante en la ciudad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra en el negocio de comida. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener casa propia y ponerse un negocio más grande que el actual. Enfrenta desafíos como los precios de los productos comestibles.

Le gusta jugar fútbol y pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
Diana Carolina Jimenez R. is 22 years old. She is single and she lives children and a friend. She lives in the city of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios. She has 2 children, Miguel (2 years old) and Anahi (four years old). Diana is a member of the rural village of San Jose de los Amarillos. It is located in the Recinto de los Amarillos region, 90 minutes from the city of Ventanas. There are 23 members in her group and the majority of them are agriculturists. This is the second loan they request through the San Jose Cooperative (Kiva Field Partner). Diana has a restaurant in the city. She makes her purchases every week in the city of Ventanas and she sells her products in her restaurant in the city. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of food and ingredients for her business. She sees this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. Her dreams are to have a house of her own and to have a larger business. The challenges she faces are the high prices of ingredients. She enjoys playing soccer and she likes taking trips with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora María Rosario P. es socia del banco comunal San Pablo, vive en la comunidad de Los Laureles en donde su gente se dedica a la cría de anímeles y a la agricultura, muchos salen a la ciudad a realizar varios trabajos, también mucha de su población ha migrado a otros países en busca de un mejor futuro para sus familias.

Doña María tiene 57 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, cuatro de ellos son casados y viven de manera independiente, sus dos hijos solteros trabajan pero no le ayudan ya que el sueldo que ganan es solo para sus gastos, su esposo se dedica a la construcción ya que es maestro albañil, gracias al trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. María se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres actividad que la realiza ambulantemente por los mercados de la ciudad de Cuenca, trabaja en esta labor desde que tenía 12 años ya que su madre le  enseño esta actividad. También se dedica a la cría de animales como son pollos y cuyes a los cuales los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad en su propia comunidad.

Es nuestra socia hace 2 años y ha sido incentivada por una amiga que pertenece al banco comunal a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres luchadoras. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más frutas para incrementar su negocio.
 
Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
María Rosario P. is a member of the San Pablo Communal Bank. She lives in the Los Laureles community. The people in this community raise animals and farm. Many people leave the city to perform various jobs. Also, much of the population has migrated to other countries looking for a better future for their families. María, age 57, is married and has six grown children. Four of her children are married and live independently. Two of her children are single and work. However, they do not help her because the salary they earn is only for their expenses. Her husband works in construction. He is a master bricklayer. Thanks to their communal work they managed to build their own house. María sells fruits and vegetables in an itinerant manner at the markets in the city of Cuenca. She has been doing this work since she was 12 years old. Her mother taught her this work. Also, she raises animals like chickens and guinea pigs. When she needs to, she sells them in her own community. She has been a member for two years. A friend who belongs to the communal bank encouraged to form part of this group of tenacious women. She will use the new loan to buy more fruit to increase her business. Her goal is to keep growing in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bananas, oranges, coconuts, stawberries, and papayas, etc.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn D. is from the town of Banga. She is 51 years old and married. She has four children, aged 23, 21, 15 and 13. To make a living, Merlyn plants and harvests rice for sale. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 23 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

Merlyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with four children: three boys and one girl, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing for the family.
