For the past 10 years, she has operated her tailoring business from home and sells to her neighbors and passersby. She cites competition as a major challenge as she is located near her competitors. Janet hopes to add more sewing machines and employ people. 

With the 15,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase a bundle of cloth materials. Janet decided to work with Yehu to access loans and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of cloth materials

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida M., 53, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Stephen M., a photographer, and mother to three hardworking young adults and two high school aged teens. At this time, Zenaida is working hard to continually support her children’s education all the way through college.

Zenaida operates a videography and photography studio. They offer all kinds of services like photo and video coverage of any occasion. They also offer video and photo editing, photo printing and other services of the like.
 
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php36, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy needs for the business like hardware (cameras, headset for the computer, picture paper) and software ( video and photo editing software). She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Zenaida dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy business supplies like hardware (cameras, headset for the computer, picture paper) and software ( video and photo editing software)

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es: Blanca Lidia G. Vda. D. V. D. 61 años D. edad, es una señora muy dedicada a su hogar, la cual posee su propio negocio gracias al cual cuenta con todo lo necesario. Vive junto a un hijo mayor D. edad, quien se dedica a trabajar, con quien resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador. Blanca  posee una tienda D. productos comestibles como pan y golosinas, y también   D. primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo,  negocio el cual se encuentra en su casa D. habitación. Blanca solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda, así mismo para comprar mayor cantidad D. maíz, y verduras, D. manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y D. esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en: Blanca Lidia G. Vda. D. V. is 61 years old.  She is a lady who is very much committed to her home.  She owns her own business, thanks to which she has everything she needs.  She lives together with a grown-up son, who works, in San Salvador department.  Blanca has a store selling foodstuffs such as bread and candies and also basic products such as soap and shampoo.  Her business is located in her home.  Blanca is requesting a loan so that she can better stock her store.  She would also like to buy more corn and vegetables so that she can better serve her customers and, in this way, improve her sales.  This is her priority as she wants to help her household get ahead.

loans.use: To buy perishable products

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 38 years old and resides in Teresa, which is located in the province of Rizal. She lives with her husband and their four children.

Helen has a store in her house where she sells basic necessities and various products that people use in their homes. She is requesting a loan to buy more food products and basic household goods. This will allow her to attract more customers and increase her sales.

Helen’s business is very important because it enables her to provide more financial stability for her family so they can live decently. She hopes to provide her family with everything necessary to move forward, out of poverty.  

Helen dreams of the best for her family: expanding her business, having a happy family, and providing a better education for her four children so they can find better employment. She has shown herself to be hard-working and strong-minded enough to make her dreams come true. She hopes that the productivity of her business will continue to increase and improve the overall quality of her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food products and other inventory

loans.name: Natalio

texts.es:
Natalio tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en la localidad de Huaca de Barro del distrito de Mórrope, una zona agrícola y comercial poblada de gente humilde y bastante trabajadora. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con animales menores los cuales cría en algunos corrales situados en la parte exterior de su domicilio. Usualmente cría cerdos y aves de corral, alimentándoles de granos y pastos naturales. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona y al público en general. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga de solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia.

Natalio deseas adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para poder satisfacer la demanda que se suele incrementar por temporada navideña. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Natalio is 20 years old.  He is single and lives with his family in Huaca de Barro, in Mórrope district, which is an agricultural and commercial area full of humble and quite hard-working people.  It is in Lambayeque province, more than one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Natalio has young animals which he raises in some pens located outside his home.  He usually raises pigs and poultry, feeding them grains and natural fodder.  When the animals have reached a good level of development he offers them for sale to the traders who always visit his area.  He also offers them to the general public.  He uses the profits he makes from this activity to cover his personal expenses and support his family.

Natalio would like to acquire more animals and balanced feed so that he can meet the demand which normally increases around the Christmas period.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy animals and balanced feed to expand his business

loans.name: Guillermina Blandina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Guillermina Blandina; ella tiene 65 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de repuestos de carro, ella tiene una tienda donde vende repuestos de carro y atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de repuestos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  repuestos para los carros al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower, Ms. Guillermina Blandina, belongs to the "Maquimanta Purisun" communal bank, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Ms. Guillermina is 65 years old, married, and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling spare auto parts.  She has a store where she sells the car parts, which she tends from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm.  She would like to expand and improve her spare parts business.  Ms. Guillermina is requesting this loan to buy spare car parts wholesale.

She is happy to receive this loan and promises to comply with the repayment terms.

loans.use: to buy spare car parts wholesale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther M. is from the city of Maningcol Ozamiz City. She is 50 years old. Esther is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Esther owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing boarding house services to local community members. Esther has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Esther joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esther has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from GDMPC. Esther is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Esther from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He will buy the raw materials used to make clay (mud, small sticks and black seeds used as a colorant).

loans.name: Marijen

texts.en:
Marijen C. is from the town of Tagbilaran. She is 32 years old. Marijen is married and has 5 school-aged children. 

To make a living, Marijen owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. Marijen has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

Marijen joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marijen has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment such as hooks & nets

loans.name: Kalumu

texts.en:
Kalumu is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a dry fish selling business for the past three years, selling at the market to her local neighbours. Kalumu faces a major challenge of competition from other dry fish sellers in the market. 

With the Kshs 30,000 he wants to purchase sacks of dry fish to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Silvino

texts.en:
Silvino F. is from the village of Lantungan, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 59 years old, and married, with 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Silvino sells wood and wood-related products. Silvino has been engaged in his business for more than 12 years and earns approximately 12500 PHP a month.

Silvino joined GDMPC this year to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Silvino is requesting his first loan, for 40000 PHP, to be used to invest in expanding the business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon P. O. is 28 years-old and married. His wife runs a salon and they have three children aged between seven years-old and one year-old whom they hope to givea  good education to the university level. 

His business is located at a market in Nyalenda in Kisumu. Kisumu is the region of Kenya that harbours lake Victoria and is well known as the lake basin. He owns a barber shop in which he gives haircut services to the local people. He has been in this business for six years now and has managed to provide employment to one person. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is a lack of proper equipment. However, he works hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy shaving machines to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to diversify into a transport business. He describes himself as self reliant.

loans.use: to buy a shaving machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase essential tools for his vehicle repair workshop

loans.name: Diana Alexandra

texts.es:
Diana de 35 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un taller de costura y confección. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar con el haciendo costuras y confección.

Su taller lo tiene ubicado en una parte de su casa ya que aun no tiene capital suficiente para poder incursionar en un local. Ella hace ropa por pedido y las vende o espera que las retiren los dueños.  Aunque su negocio lo comenzó cuando tenía poco capital ella ha vendió incrementando sus taller. Quiere continuar con su taller por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar telas y tener más oportunidades de trabajar.
texts.en:
Diana is 35 years old. She is a hardworking woman that has a sewing and tailoring workshop. She has high aspirations for her business. That is why she wants to continue sewing and tailoring.
Her workshop is located in a part of her house since she doesn't have enough money to be able to set up in a different location. She makes clothes by request and sells them or hopes that the owners take it away. Although she started her business when she had little money, she has been increasing her amount of work. She wants to continue her business. That is why she asks for the loan to buy fabric and to have more working opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramón es un padre de familia trabajador, con el fin de poder apoyar a sus cuatro hijos, ha venido trabajando  con préstamos para lograr hacer las mejoras a su casa.
Trabaja en servicios de seguridad, desde hace varios años, y por su salario viene haciendo las reparaciones poco a poco, ya que tiene que cubrir otros gastos.
Con este nuevo préstamo terminara de cerrar el muro que comenzó hacer, y que le beneficio para cerrar todo, el cual le queda como muro y cerrara un cuarto y necesita poner el techo lo que con este préstamo comprara: láminas de zinc, perlines, golosos, soldadura para poder tener más espacio.
Lo que está contento por lograr cada día la mejora. Gracias a los financiamiento que Afodenic le ha otorgado.
texts.en:
Ramón is a hard working father who wants to support his four children.  He’s been working with loans to make improvements to his home.

He’s been working in security for several years and has been using his salary to make repairs to his home little by little, and pay other expenses.

He will use the money from this new loan to finish building a wall that he started.  This will close off a room he is building, but it will still need a roof.  He will use the money to buy zinc metal sheeting, solder, and other materials.  He is happy because every day gets better, thanks to this loan through Afodenic.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Zaton

texts.en: Zaton sells  beans and onions.She is 38 years old, married,with 5 children. 4 of the children go to school. Zaton is asking for a loan to stock more beans and onions to sell. Zaton hopes to buy goats in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es: José Ramón tiene su negocio que es una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años que tiene esta actividad. Inicio con fondos propios ya que no tenia los suficientes ingresos para mantener a su familia, sus hijos están a su cargo todos los días José se levanta temprano para empezar a atender a sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de golosina, refrescos, pan galletas y grano básicos.
texts.en: José Ramón has had a grocery store business  for more than six years. He started his business -- with his own funds -- because he did not have enough income to support his family. He takes care of his children every day and he wakes up early to serve his customers. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy candy, soft drinks, bread, cookies and basic grains.

loans.use: to purchase candy, soft drinks, bread, cookies, and basic grains.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy de 42 años, es natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa,  vive en su propia morada al lado de su pareja Víctor de 44 años y sus 03 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindarles una buena comodidad. Nancy es una mujer muy laboriosa, se esmera cada día por entregar lo mejor de si a los miembros de su familia. Ella se dedica al trabajo del agro donde labra la tierras para cultivar cacao, café y achiote; viene realizando esta actividad hace 18 años con mucho esmero y laboriosidad,  por que gracias a los frutos que le brinda sus plantas ella adquirió mas espacio de terreno para cultivar y también compró su propia movilidad para trasladar sus productos hasta los centros de acopio situados en la ciudad e San Francisco donde percibe mejores precios por sus granos. En tiempos de cosecha y limpieza de sus plantaciones, necesariamente contrata jornaleros para poder avanzar con mayor celeridad en cuanto a su faena programada. Nancy cuenta con 02 hectáreas de terreno sin cultivar,  lo cual necesariamente necesita el apoyo de la entidad financiera para llevar acabo sus actividades programadas. Por ahora tiene pensado sembrar sus fincas con más plantas de cacao y café, es por ello que acude a los prestamos que la institución MFP facilita a las personas de bajos recursos con miras a progresar. Para el bien de su trabajo, espera contar con la misma fuerza e ímpetu que la caracteriza para sacar adelante  sus sembríos. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP, es por ello espera de su colaboración para poder concretar sus planes y se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cronogramas de pago ya que desea acceder a otros prestamos posteriormente. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles comprará, más semillas de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Nancy, 42, is from the city of Santa Rosa.  She lives in her own house with her spouse, Víctor, 44, and their three beloved children that she wants to provide more comfort for.

Nancy is a very hard working woman who strives daily to do the best for her family.  She works in agriculture cultivating cocoa beans, coffee and achiote.  She’s been doing this work for 18 years with much dedication and diligence because thanks to the fruits her plants provide she was able to acquire more land to farm and also bought her own vehicle to transport her crops to the gathering centers in the city of San Francisco where she gets the best prices for her grains.

During harvesting and weed clearing she necessarily must hire day laborers in order to streamline the programmed tasks.

Nancy has two fallow hectares that she needs financial help in order to carry out the programmed tasks in.  For now, she plans to plant more cocoa beans and coffee so she is asking MFP for the loans that they give to people of low resources who want to progress.

For the good of her work she hopes to have the same strength and drive that characterizes her to successfully grow her crops.  This will be loan #2 with MFP and hopes to have your collaboration in order to reach her goals and she commits to make her payments according to the payment schedule because she wants to access future loans.  She will use the 3000 new sol loans to buy cocoa bean and coffee seeds.

loans.use: to buy cocoa bean and coffee seeds.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 53 years old and married with three children.

Elvira works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Elvira has borrowed and re-paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns income by farming rice.

Elvira aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maria Blanca

texts.en: Maria Blanca is 37-years-old and lives near the city of Ambato in the central Ecuadorian Andes. She is a single mother of two children, aged fifteen and two-and-a-half years. She is a responsible, peaceful, and very hard-working woman. Maria Blanca’s business is raising animals including guinea pigs, rabbits, and pigs. She began her business with only ten guinea pigs in a wooden pen. Her 15-year-old daughter helps her care for the animals. Maria Blanca reports that her business has been going well lately with the exception of an illness that killed ten of her rabbits. She is seeking her first loan to expand her business by adding chickens to sell to increase her income. Her dream is to improve her home and raise more animals.

loans.use: to begin raising chickens

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora, age 40, has earned her living for 20 years from farming corn and bananas. She and her family live in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Every month, she earns PHP 3,000.00 from her farming activities. She has five children. 

Leonora has requested a loan of PHP 5,000.00 from GDMPC to pay for weeding and fertilizers. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. 

She hopes to extend the business and plant other crops in order to increase her income and support her family.

loans.use: to pay for weeding and fertilizers

loans.name: Maryorie Jissela

texts.es:
Maryorie Jissela tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera vive con los padres, en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C 	PATRON SAN JUAN , se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad San Juan, sector Llullundondo, parroquia Guanujo, a una distancia de 25 minutos  perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Maryorie Jissela se dedica al negocio de salchipapas y la agricultura, su negocio lo realiza en el mismo sector donde vive y se traslada también a lugares donde haya fiestas, siembra en los terrenos de los padres cultiva papas y otros productos que se dan en la zona. Compra y vende sus productos en la ciudad de Guaranda

Solicita el crédito para incrementar su negocio y tener alguna utilidad. Enfrenta desafíos el incremento y caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los bruscos cambios climáticos por los que estamos atravesando. Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio.
.
Le gustan las festividades del carnaval y del patrón San Juan, realizar actividades como salir a pasear y el deporte.
texts.en:
Mayorie Jissela is 21 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the canton of Guaranda in the Bolivar province. 
The members of the loan group V.R.C. Patron San Juan, are located in the community of San Juan, in the Llullundondo sector and the parish of Guanujo, which belongs to the canton of Guaranda. The members of this group work in agriculture and livestock raising.
Mayorie Jissela works selling a potato and sausage snack called salchipapas and in agricutlure. She runs her business in the same area where she lives and also goes to places where they are having fiestas. She grows crops in the land her parents own, cultivating potatoes and other products of the region. She buys and sells her produce in the city of Guaranda.
She is requesting the loan in order to grow her business and have some more profit. She faces challenges such as the rise and fall of prices for the goods she sells as well as the abrupt climate changes that we are going through. Her dream is to grow her business.
She likes the festivals for carnaval and the feast of San Juan, and she likes doing things like going out for a work and sports.

loans.use: to grow her business and have some more profit.

loans.name: Ecitane

texts.pt:
Nasceu  na cidade  de Maputo, provincia  do  mesmo  nome, sul  de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 5 filhos  dos  quais  todos  frequentam  a  escola. Fez  a  6ª classe  e  parou  por  falta  de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é empregada domestica ha mais de 2 anos e tem um salario de  3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Já fez emprestimo na PROCREDIT no valor de 5.000.00mt destinado ao inicio da sua obra, o qual conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material DE CONSTRUCAO DE UMA CASA ( ferro, cimento, areia, pedra, barrotes, e outros.) para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Pretende concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua familia, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Ecitane was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique. She is single and mother of 5 children, all of whom go to school. She made it through the 6th grade, but dropped out due to financial hardship. She lives in her own house with her family and has no other dependents to care for. 

She has never left her homeland and has been a domestic worker for over 2 years, which provides her a monthly income of 3,000 Mozambique Meticais (MZN), which she puts toward her household expenses and some of which she saves in her personal bank account (BIM). 

She has already taken out a 5,000 MZN loan from PROCREDIT to start her construction project, which she has had no trouble in paying off. She came to know Hluvuku [Kiva field partner] through a friend who is also a Hluvuku client. This 10,000 MZN loan is her first with Hluvuku and she intends to use it to buy construction materials for her house (iron, cement, sand, stone, beams, etc) in order to continue her home improvement work. She intends on finishing her house in order to improve the living conditions of her family, and so she plans to request further loans with Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her house (iron, cement, sand, stone, beams, etc).

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 54 years old and married to Benito who is a farmer in the village where they live. The couple is blessed with two children. To boost her family's household's income, Pacita established a sari-sari (variety) store in front of her house. The daily net profit of 200 Philippine pesos (PHP) is just enough to cover the cost of daily meals and allowances for her children.

After four years of sacrifices, Pacita was very proud when her eldest child graduated from school.  That child now works at a restaurant, and sometimes helps Pacita by givng her money for the other child in the family, who is still a high school student.

Pacita plans to use this loan of 50,000 PHP to buy more grocery items, such as soft drinks, biscuits, breads and eggs, to sell in her sari-sari store. She wants to generate more income so she's able to save for her youngest daughter's college education.

In the future, Pacita dreams of managing a mini-grocery in their village to make herself more financially stable.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, biscuits, breads and eggs as inventory for a small retail store

loans.name: Morena

texts.en:
Morena, a 35-year-old married mother of three children, lives in the Philippines where she has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, breads and beverages. In business for four years and a member of HSPFI since 2010, Morena has requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

In the future, Morena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Sopp Adbou Latif Mbacke Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé depuis environs 06 mois. Il est composé de 13 femmes qui sont issues du même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la transformation d'huile d'arachide. 


Madame MaF. debout à l’extrême gauche de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est marié et mère de 07 enfants en charge. 

Elle est vendeuse de légumes dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Elle fait également de l'élevage de mouton comme activité parallèle. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de financer son activité de vente de légumes et d'acheter une paire de moutons.

Les bénéficies générés par son activité lui permettrons de participer à la prise en charge de sa progéniture et d'assuré sa scolarité
texts.en:
This solidarity group has been created about six months ago. It is composed of 13 women from the same village. Their business activity is vending and making peanut oil.

Ms. MaF., standing on the far left in the photo, is the group’s leader. She is 49 years old. She is married and the mother of seven dependent children.
She sells vegetables at weekly markets. As a parallel activity, she also raises sheep. Her new loan will allow her to finance her vegetable business and to buy a pair of sheep. The income generated by her business will allow her to take care of her children and provide for their studies.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 49 years old, married, has three children and works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. In addition to her store, she also earns income from karaoke rentals. Her goal is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina is 41 years old. She is married with six children. Cristina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy additional items like canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell. Cristina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Cristina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 59 years old, married to Amos, and together they are blessed with four children. She does rabbit keeping in Dandora Phase ll. She has been in this business for the last year and gets an income of KES 10,000 per month.

Margaret has a good credit history with KADET and she is applying for her second loan of KES 60,000 from KADET, which she plans to use to buy more rabbits. 

She will use the anticipated profits to venture into farming. Margaret hopes to venture into large scale farming. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: to buy more rabbits for sale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret  lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has three children, none of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). Margaret has a restaurant business. She has been in this business for more than 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Margaret sells her products in a shop by means of retail. Margaret has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bananas, Irish potatoes and beans. The main business challenges for Margaret include seasonality and increasing prices of food. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to build rental rooms.  Margaret lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, Irish potatoes and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomato seeds and for labor purposes

loans.name: Sulton

texts.ru: Султон занимается торговлей на рынке. В основном он продает яблоки, виноград и гранат. В этой области он десять лет. Ему 43 года. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Султон берет кредит для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Sulton is engaged in trade in the market. In general, he sells apples, grapes and pomegranates. He has spent ten years in this area. He is 43 years old. He is married and has five children. Sulton is taking a loan in order to increase his product turnover.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es: Un grupo con creatividad para los negocios y empeño por salir adelante, así se caracteriza la alcancía comunal “Camino al Éxito” integrada por 7 miembros hace más de 4 años. Un grupo con mucho en común como el deseo de superación y con una historia en particular de cada integrante, tal es así el caso de la señora Ruby Dolorier de 50 años de edad casada y con 4 hijos. Uno aun en colegio. Ella se dedica diariamente a la costura, trabajo que viene desempeñando desde hace mas de 3 años, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo  ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que ahora tiene mayores ingresos  económicos, el cual gracias  a eso  está a punto de lograr una de sus grandes metas que es concluir la construcción de su vivienda para asegurarle a sus hijos un lugar donde puedan vivir y desarrollarse como excelentes ciudadanos. Ruby Dolorier no solo es una próspera trabajadora, sino que también es una excelente cocinera, es por eso que eventualmente se dedica a preparar deliciosos platillos los fines de semana, para a si lograr algunos ingresos extras. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá para  invertir por campaña navideña (compras de Telas). En el futuro le gustaría ampliar su negocio teniendo un taller bien equipado para a si obtener mayores ingresos para ella y su familia.
texts.en: A group with creativity for business and determination to get ahead—this is how the “Camino al Éxito” [Path to Success] communal bank can be described. It has been made up of 7 members for more than 4 years. It is a group with a lot in common, such as the desire to overcome and an individual story for each member. Such is the case of Ruby Dolorier, who is 50 years old, married, and has 4 children, one of whom is still in high school. She works every day in sewing, work which she has been doing for more than 3 years. Through her hard work she has managed to improve her quality of life because she now has more savings. Because of this, she is about to achieve one her biggest goals, which is to finish building her house so that her children can have a place to live and grow into excellent citizens. Ruby Dolorier isn’t just a prosperous worker; she is also an excellent cook. This is why she also makes delicious foods on the weekends, so that she can make some extra income. She will use the recent loan to invest for the Christmas season (she will buy fabrics). In the future she would like to expand her business to have a workshop that is well equipped so that she can earn a better income for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 62-year-old widower and father of four adult children. He has been in the farming business for the past six years earning a monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Simon will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will open a retail shop for his son. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

texts.en: Chantal is 28 years old. She sells various items in her store. With the loan, she wants to buy more electric materials for sale. With the profits from the business, she wants to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more electric materials for sale.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 50 years old and married with five children, two of whom in school, Rosalina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc..

Rosalina has been in this business for 1 year. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Amalia

texts.en:
I sell new clothes, but my specialty is baby's clothes. When there is a new baby born in the neighborhood, my clients tell me so I can visit the family and offer them some nice new clothes for the baby to wear.

I sell my new clothes door to door in the sorrounding communities where my clients live.

loans.use: Working capital to expand my clothing selection.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.en:
My name is Oscar T. and I deliver objects such as sand and gravel to homes. I have had my business for 3 years and I have a good clientel because I am contracted at a local hardware store in my community. My business generates enough income to support my family and my goal is to gain more customers. With the additional earnings I will be able to repair my car in order to provide a better service to my customers as well as pay University fees for my daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Oscar T. me dedico a la transportacion de objetos de casa, arena y grava, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mi clientela es muy buena ya que yo estoy contratado en una ferreteria de mi comunidad, mi necocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es tener mayores clientes y con las ganancias que obtenga poder arreglar mi carro para dar un mejor servicio y pagarles los estudios universitarios a mi hija.

loans.use: To purchase tires, oil and filters.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: Gulnora is a mother of one child and got divorced several years ago. She had to move back to her parents' house and decided to earn her own money. It has been three years since she started working at the market. One day, she hopes to make enough money to get a University degree and have an apartment of her own. Gulnora is a hard-working person, and she believes that her business will help her to accomplish her goals. Her brother helps her in her business. Most of the time, he makes the trips to bring the goods for her to sell. She would like to use the loan to purchase more grain to sell.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Shoirahon

texts.en:
Shoirahon is a young salesperson with 2 children. She likes everything concerning children. Currently she has chosen a business that supplies kids with beautiful clothes. In the first place, of course, she does this to earn her living, but also to educate her children who are going to school.

Shoirahon has developed a stable and profitable enterprise in the 4 years she has been in business. In 2004, she applied for the first time to Micro Invest for a loan of 150 USD. She reimbursed the loan on time under the supervision of Micro Invest.

Now her problem is the condition of her shop, where she needs to install a new roof. With her profit, she cannot afford maintenance expenses. The new roof is vital because it will keep her goods safe from rain and snow in wintertime and from sun damage in summer. To have a new roof installed, Shoirahon needs 1200 USD.

loans.use: a new roof for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy furniture for his store

loans.name: Regina Jaime

texts.pt:
Regina is not married but lives with her 5 children and their father. She joined the credit program in 2006. She is now in the 6th cycle. The business is doing well and she wants to add to her inventory frozen chicken. Her children are in school. If the business continues to do well Regina wants to improve her home

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Regina e solteira e mae de 5 filhos.Vive maritalmente com o pai dos seus filhos.Ela entrou para o programa de credito do Fundo de desenvolvimento da Mulher em 2006.Agora esta no quinto ciclo. O negocio corre-lhe bem, por isso quer introduzir tambem a venda de frango congelado.Os seus filhos estao a estudar e ela comparticipa nas despesas da escola e ajuda o marido nas despesas da casa. Se os negocios continuarem a correr bem ela pensa reabilitar a sua casa.

loans.use: Increase and diversify inventory

loans.name: Aquiles

texts.es:
Aquiles is a devoted father who has formed a family together with his wife Saturnina. He dedicates himself to the raising and selling of cattle, an activity he manages efficiently thanks to the experience he has gained year after year. He performs this activity with passion and energy, given that his efforts are for the benefit of his four children who live in the shelter of his humble home. The wish of this model father is to provide them the opportunity to finish their higher educations, something he himself was not able to achieve when young due to a lack of resources. To realize their plans, they ask for a loan to invest in the daily activities of the business to help increase their earnings through the sale of the cattle. Both commit to repaying the loan within a period of eight months. Aquiles and his charming wife appeal to your generous heart to help them meet their objective.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Aquiles, es un empeñoso y ejemplar padre desde que formó su familia junto a su esposa, Saturnina, se dedicó por completo a la labor de crianza y comercialización de ganado vacuno; actividad que realiza eficientemente gracias a la experiencia que fue adquiriendo años tras año. Esta noble y laboriosa labor que desempeña apasionadamente lo va llenando de dicha y alegría, porque su esfuerzo se desplega en beneficio de sus cuatro queridos hijos que viene cobijando en su humilde hogar.El deseo de este ejemplar padre es otorgarle la oportunidad de concluir los estudios superiores a sus hijos, oportunidad que el nunca tuvo por los escasos recursos económicos con los que contaba su hogar cuando era pequeño. Para concretar sus planes solicitan un préstamo de dinero, capital que invertirá en su actividad diaria a fin de obtener mayores ganancias con la venta de los animalitos, ambos prometen reembolsar el préstamo en un lapso de ocho meses. Aquiles y su encantadora esposa apelan a tu generoso corazón para concretar sus planes.

loans.use: Purchase of additional livestock to help meet the needs of their children.

loans.name: Nora Elia

texts.es:
Nora Elia is an enterprising woman who helps her husband selling cosmetics, shoes and clothes through a catalog to her her neighbors and friends. She works because what her husband earns as an electrician isn't enough to be able to pay the expenses of their two children. Her children are 11 and 8 years old and are studying in grade school. Nora Elia has worked in this business for two years and little by little has grown her customer base.

However, during the Christmas season, she has been given orders that she cannot fulfill so she's requesting a loan of $475 that she will pay back in a term of 6 months. With this money, Nora Elia will be able to buy the merchandise that her customers are requesting. In addition, she will be able to buy extra products to be able to have more of a variety to offer her customers. With your help, Nora Elia will be able to continue moving forward and growing her business at a strong rate.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Nora Elia es una mujer muy emprendedora que apoya a su esposo vendiendo cosméticos, zapatos y ropa por catálogo a sus vecinas y amigos puesto que lo que gana su esposo como electricista no es suficiente para poder pagar los gastos de sus dos hijos de 11 y 8 años que están estudiando la primaria. Nora Elia tiene dos años con este tipo de negocio y poco a poco ha ido creciendo su clientela.

Sin embargo en la temporada Navideña le han hecho un pedido que ella no puede surtir es por esto que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Nora Elia podrá comprar la mercancía que le están solicitando. Además de comprar productos extras para poder tener variedad para ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Nora Elia podrá salir delante y crecer su negocio a pasos firmes.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to supply her business orders.

loans.name: Paula Luz

texts.es:
The life of Paula C. has been full of struggles and difficult situations. Currently she sells all types of homemade products and cosmetics, but she started with a different occupation. She began by selling medications in the street . She sold medication for several years until the practice was prohibited and all of her products were taken from her.

Since she was a single mother responsible for two children, she decided to invest what little savings she had into the purchase of various products and began selling them from her home. She now has 30 years of experience selling homemade products and cosmetics. This is how she has moved forward tending and developing her business. Recently she began obtaining credits from CEPRODEL (she has received 13 up till now) which she has used for her families’ benefit by purchasing more merchandise and bettering the conditions of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La vida que ha llevado la señora Paula C. ha sido de muchos esfuerzos y además de muchas situaciones duras. Su negocio actualmente es la venta de todo tipo de productos caseros y personales(cosmeticos), pero para poder haber llegado hasta aquí comenzó primeramente con la venta de medicamentos donde se dedicó por varios años a este negocio vendiendo ambulante hasta que en una ocasión se prohibió la venta de estos productos y le fueron desposeídos.

Por ser madre soltera pero responsable con sus dos hijos decide invertir todos sus pocos ahorros para la compra de productos varios y comenzarlos a vender poco a poco en su hogar (Actualmente tiene 30 años de vender productos caseros y personales). Así es como ha venido creciendo y desarrollándose hasta que obtuvo créditos en CEPRODEL (Actualmente un total de 13 créditos) que le han beneficiado para la compra de mercadería y además para mejorar en parte las condiciones de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic supplies.

loans.name: Sokhum

texts.en: Mrs. S. Sokhum and her husband have been married since 2002. They have two sons who are still young and stay at home. Sokhum has been in the business of raising pigs and growing rice for three years. Her husband, Oy Tin, is a worker and farmer. Sokhum and her family live across Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan in the amount $500 from MAXIMA for the second time. She will use this money to purchase baby pigs for raising and for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase baby pigs and for growing rice

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Señora Ana lives with her husband and children in her inlaws' house on Buenos Aires Avenue in the Las Lomas zone of the city of La Paz. The work that she does is selling cell phones of different brands, which is how she generates income. The credit she is requesting is to increase her capital and to purchase more cell phones because her sales are very good right now.

Her previous credit history qualilfies her to obtain a new credit. She has been a good client of ours since last year.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Ana vive con su esposo e hijos en casa de sus suegros en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona de Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que tiene es la venta de celulares de distintas marcas con la cual genera sus ingresos. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y comprar más celulares pues tiene muy buenas ventas.

Su antecedente Histórico la califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, es buena cliente nuestra desde el año pasado.

loans.use: Purchase of more cell phones to sell

loans.name: Ruth's Esuvat Group

texts.en:
Ruth is 26 years old and is married woman with 3 children, ages 10 and 5 years old. Ruth is a clohtes (batik) seller,she started in 2003. Everyday, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes (batik) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in charcoal sales,shop and soap sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (batik) for her business.

loans.name: Ligia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Señora G. has received six loans from our institution over the past three years, which she has used to invest in her business. She raises her family with this business. She is a single mother and her daughter is currently in medical school. She wants to diversify her business and be able to offer more and better products. Apart from her business, she also works as a secretary.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

La señora G. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace unos tres años donde ha manejado seis creditos los que ha utilizado para capital de trabajo, cabe destacar que con el negocio ella mantiene su familia tiene una hija la que estudia medicina en la universidad es madre soltera, su sueño es diversificar mas su negocio y poder ofertar mas y mejores productos, adeñas ella trabaja como secretaria.

loans.use: Invest in clothing and cosmetic supplies

loans.name: Waziran

texts.en:
Waziran baji, wife of A. H., lives in Kasur, Pakistan, a city that is famous for its sweatmeat. Waziran baji has a good reputation in her neighborhood. Everybody gives her respect. Waziran baji has a two-room brick house and one big hallway. She does housework and she sells milk and earns a good profit. Her daily income is $10 to $15.

She is applying for a loan to buy a buffalo in order to expand her milk business.

NOTE: "Baji" (elder sister) is an Urdu term of respect for women.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for her milk business

loans.name: Rozigul

texts.ru:
Rozigul G. lives in Vakhsh district. She is 37 years old, married, and has four children. She is a trader, bringing clothes from Dushanbe city and selling them at the Vakhsh district market. She would like to increase her stock turnover so that she can lower the prices of her goods. This would help her increase the volume of her sales and draw in new customers. To do so, she plans to take out a loan and pay it back within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer.

Гумахмадова Рузигуль жительница района Вахш. Возраст 37 лет . Замужем , имеет четверых детей. Занимается торговлей. Привозит одежду из города Душанбе. А реализует на рынке района Вахш. Хочет увеличить товарооборот , для того , чтобы снизить цены на продаваемую продукцию. Это поможет увеличить объем продаж и привлечь новых клиентов. Для этого она планирует получить кредит и погасить его она сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase stock turnover

loans.name: Shiv

texts.en: Mr. Shiv T. is a construction worker in Roka Village in Kandal Province. He is a 36-year-old widower with three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while two are attending school. Since Mr. Shiv T.'s family lives in poor conditions and he cannot afford to fix his house, Mr. Shiv T. decided to ask for a loan to repair his house to live more easily.

loans.use: To repair his house in order to live more easily.
